review.employee-type: Assistant Store Manager of Sales & Service (Former Employee)
review.title: “I enjoyed working at Toys R Us very much.”
review.pros: Pros – Upper management support, let me run my Departments & Supervisors the way I thought was best. Gave me time to coach my team.Salary, vacation time, and personal days.
review.cons: Cons – Labor hours - not enough. Very high number of call outs because most team members were part-time, this hurt my weekend coverage. Did not hold them accountable for call outs.I averaged 60 hours a week.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire more mature Team Members, Share corporate news. Just over the last 6 months to a year at least 4 District Managers left the company. My wife and I have been working for Toys for the last 6 years. We decided that I would resign and change my retail career.

review.title: “Alright”
review.pros: Pros – People, Customers and Flexible hours
review.cons: Cons – Horrible management, low pay for what you do
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Evaluate management within store.

review.title: “The company needs re-structuring”
review.pros: Pros – Great First Start for retail work
review.cons: Cons – Long hours sometime required in retail stores. More diversity needed in management. Re evaluate profit margins.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to focus on developing your people and brand. Show your expertise in the toy field.

review.title: “Exhausting”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible scheduleIf you are liked by management, more hours
review.cons: Cons – Rude customersManagement has little to no interest in moving you up even though you are qualifiedBeing a team member means knowing entire store rather than department
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Mold your team to take your place, so you can move up and stop complaining about not being able to.Set an example

review.title: “good”
review.pros: Pros – long hours to each day
review.cons: Cons – low pay for the job
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – better

review.title: “It's retail.”
review.pros: Pros – Management works with you to grow you in the company. They help you with scheduling. Almost always great people to work with.
review.cons: Cons – It always felt management past the store managers are out of touch with what is going on in the store. The district manager would tell your team to do one thing and then another big wig would come in and say that's wrong do it this way. Also working at a toy store during the holiday season can be brutal. Also if you wanted to move up in the company you have to be willing to relocate to another store. You can get promoted from part-time to a full-time supervisor IF someone from the DS team steps up to a ASM position at another store.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Very good middle management in corporate office; very willing to work as a team. enjoyed my stay there very muc”
review.pros: Pros – Fairly good at the time; flexible as possible (in retail) with needs of staff in corporate office. Very professional and diverse environment.
review.cons: Cons – Little slow with monetary rewards.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – At the time, accounting systems were not quite up to best practices; could be frustrating. But that may have changed since I was there.

review.title: “Amazing”
review.pros: Pros – The best place to work!
review.cons: Cons – No Cons that I can think of
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what you are doing

review.title: “Great place to work, great growth opportunities for those who work hard for it”
review.pros: Pros – Work-life balance is fantastic. Nicest group of people you will work for within finance. Encouraged to move around every 1.5 years or so, so there your career is dynamic and holistic. Lots of free toy samples occasionally.
review.cons: Cons – IT systems are antiquated and everyone's work is grounded in Excel. Not a lot of investment in upgrading our technology. Pay is lower than other companies, especially since growth is declining.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “An outstanding job give me a good experience in warehouse such as assembler, stocking, and unloading trucks.”
review.pros: Pros – flexible schedule a great company employers an awesome environment to work.
review.cons: Cons – Only a seasonal job did not have the time to stay longer at the company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Great experience with management.

review.title: “Working for TRU”
review.pros: Pros – Ok payGreat for a college student
review.cons: Cons – Hours aren't fairFavortism shownRude employers
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “High School and College Job”
review.pros: Pros – - Flexible schedule around school, family vacations, and other activities.- Overnights during the holiday season were usually fun; working during days was hit and miss depending on customer attitudes.- Useful life experience to have been at the bottom of the totem pole in employment.- Job was straightforward and didn't require any thought while not there.- Watching parent/kid interactions was occasionally funny/entertaining and will be potentially useful when having kids.- Many days (unloading the truck/working out product/carrying out big ticket items) could be good exercise.- Generally likeable co-workers throughout my time there.
review.cons: Cons – - Pay-level flirting with minimum wage.- Occasionally customers or (only one in my case) manager(s) could really dampen one's day.- When working register, long list of questions to cover though most people aren't interested.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Big one to corporate: when redoing the store layout (twice a year), make it not physically impossible to match the specified layout (due to configuration of the store, etc.) which made it frustrating for everyone on the in-store end.- Also to corporate: don't continuously send new products with no intended place in the store (again making it frustrating to place them).- Keep up the good work at the store-level management in St. Cloud, MN.

review.title: “Great experience”
review.pros: Pros – Lot's of friendly co-workersPlenty of experience to gain
review.cons: Cons – Upper management gives conflicting direction. No one is on the same page.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take time to deliver positive feedback instead of only pointing out what is wrong.

review.title: “Not enough hours”
review.pros: Pros – Great place and people. Easy work
review.cons: Cons – They don't give much hours. I get scheduled once a week for 4-6 hours.

review.employee-type: Professional Position In Corporate HQs (Former Employee)
review.title: “Looks great on a resume but it's a mess from the inside. It's existing on fumes.”
review.pros: Pros – Generally speaking, I worked with a very nice group of people across the company.
review.cons: Cons – Departments are treated inconsistently to each other. If eCommerce has a good year, they get a holiday party. Anyone else? A potluck breakfast. Also, this is NOT a family friendly company, sadly enough. At least in my department, there was NO working from home whatsoever. It was not allowed.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Love your employees' kids as much as you love your customers' kids.

review.title: “The company is confused as to what they want to focus on”
review.pros: Pros – - unlimited overtime during season w/ time & half
review.cons: Cons – - no payroll to run the building effectively- too much focus on MULTIPLE sales metrics (too many)- hires young kids that do not care much- constantly moving management from store to store which mamkes being promoted very difficult- support of upper management is almost non-existent which makes being promoted very difficult
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Racist Managers”
review.pros: Pros – Its a family store for kids.
review.cons: Cons – They only hire the minium amount of minorities
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please be fair to all qualified applicants and loose the racist mentality.Stop teaching employees to follow hispanic and black customers around.

review.title: “Lackluster leadership”
review.pros: Pros – Toys R Us Brand - great memories of going to toys store.Tenured staff (double edge sword)Might be better off as a consultant there instead of staffLots of product trainingCan move to different departments
review.cons: Cons – frequent layoffs - and I'm not talking about seasonal staffTenured staff not as open to new ideasTeam is a core value- I haven't found that the culture lives up to that except on Thanksgiving when corporate staff can choose to work in the stores or their annual christmas event for children.Benefits are not the greatest - but recognize that benefits are changing at a lot of companiesTraining- feast or famine depending on your level.Trying to move up- not a lot of programs for that- no mentoring or training (feast or famine)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get your act together and decide what you want to be when you grow up and stop living your tag song (I don't wanna grow up...I'm a Toys R Us kid...)

review.title: “Horrible pay, favoritism, and no room to grow”
review.pros: Pros – 10% discount on toysFriendly peers
review.cons: Cons – Outdated sales methodsNo opportunity of advancementHorrible wagesClear favoritism among employees and managementHours are cut if you call in sickHours are cut if you take vacation timeMinimal/No benefits for part time employeesNo overtimeManagement is very demanding
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Good people. Terrible Management”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible schedule, friendly and helpful coworkers.
review.cons: Cons – Terrible managers, awful (limited) training, low pay and hardly room for advancement. Hard to stand out and difficult to have a passion for the job when most managers don't know how to motivate employees, all they care about is sales of warranties and memberships. Most training and product knowledge you'll have to learn by yourself as you go along,
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take time to choose the right managers and to train them properly. No one wants to work in a place where no matter how hard you work, most managers point out flaws repeatedly in front of other employees and guests and compare two employees by glorifying one and humiliating the other while out in public. A manager's job isn't to only point out your mistakes, but to motivate you to do so much better and learn from them.

review.title: “Not what you think”
review.pros: Pros – Nice corporate campus, friendly poeple
review.cons: Cons – Many areas too political, lot's of average employees doing a lot of CYA makes it tough to get things accomplished.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “would not recommend, no matter HOW desperate you are for a job.”
review.pros: Pros – -I had more positive experiences with customers then the people I worked with.-Though a few of the co-workers were nice. Emphasis on "a few".-I got paid. That's always a good thing.
review.cons: Cons – The manager at the time was TERRIBLE. He ignored people's request to take days off. He slacked. He was rude/in a bad mood majority of the time. Same for the co-manager. The supervisor I had to work with half the time was even worse. To this day I wonder how any of them got a job working in TRU.The store I worked in is the biggest in the district, yet we somehow had the least amount of workers. And this DID NOT help during the holiday season. For two weeks before Christmas, I had to answer phone calls and that's it. Sounds great, right? Sitting around...answering phone calls...munching on candy that was in the computer room...Wrong. Workers on the floor had to look up the items for me, but nobody would. The manager (unsurprisingly) didn't care, thus I was forced to run around checking inventory AND answer the countless phone calls.Another problem I had was the fact that the supervisors and managers failed to tell others if they did something wrong. I know I screwed up a few times, but other than that I thought was doing fine for a few months until randomly one day a supervisor told me that there were complaints about me. I'm not sure how they expected the workers to improve if they never tell them anything. I don't know if they thought I was mind reader, but if I was one, then I sure as hell wouldn't've worked there."Training" to be a cashier was an absolute joke, as was the training in general. The coupons they have are a joke, and most of the time you'll find yourself having trouble with them, as with any sale they have going on.The company expects you to basically nag the junk out of customers about buying batteries and getting their reward cards and credit cards. They expect you ask at least 4 different questions each time someone buys something, even if they're just buying some candy.There's A LOT of ass kissing you have to do in order to get any recognition. The most awful workers got a lot of recognition and respect from the higher-ups. Speaking of respect, there was none to give to us cashiers and item-shelf-straighteners, none whatsoever. Oh, but the slacker-of-a-supervisor who took 4 smoke breaks in a span of 3 hours and was no where to be found half the time? All the respect for that guy.Now, it appears that some people have had awesome experiences working for this (god forbidden) company, but I will say this: if you want to work here, it's going to be very hit-or-miss.Oh, and did I mention how you only get 10% off of your purchases as a TRU member? And how you can't use that on a few things? Ridiculous, I know.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat your workers better. We're being paid minimum wage just to have the managers treat us like nothing? No thanks.

review.title: “Misled”
review.pros: Pros – 10% off discount almost all items.
review.cons: Cons – 1800 support staff, upper management hires & practices.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There is no reason to seek participation from employees to answer questions regarding store-level operations, morale, etc. if no action is seen from corporate when a store's survey results in percentages below 70% on questions relating to store management being fair, etc.Tech support should provide long term solutions to equipment issues - not short term solutions that end up costing the company more when such equipment becomes damaged beyond repair.Also, the company could save a lot of money if they knew how much money is wasted at store level on paper alone. Corporate would be amazed.Corporate space analysts/planogram creators should be held more accountable if the planograms they create do not reflect a store's layout. There were numerous planograms that displayed measurements for gondolas, end caps, etc. that were inaccurate.Stores should have a greater say in informing corporate buyers that certain buying decisions of products (ex: high school musical merchandise) does not sell, even in clearance or manager markdown situations.All stores should be more conscientious toward physically impaired individuals. Numerous guests complained over the lack of at least a wheelchair.Corporate should also take more interest in making unannounced visits to stores, without the presence of a DM, SM, and/or ASM, to learn more about how much financial waste occurs.

review.title: “Great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Good place to work. Everyone is very helpful
review.cons: Cons – Been for a few weeks. Too soon to tell
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “My job was to stock and transport merchandise from truck onto floor.”
review.pros: Pros – The best reasons to work at Toys R Us was that everyone helped one another, including the supervisors and managers. The staff was friendly and courteous.
review.cons: Cons – To be honest, there were no downfalls at Toys R Us.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work.

review.title: “Ehhhh.”
review.pros: Pros – Nice managers, good employees, flexible working areas.
review.cons: Cons – Very loud, absolutely dead during the off season.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't tell someone they're part-time and then let them go when season is done. This is mis-leading and not fair

review.title: “Ok place to work, needs a lot of improvement.”
review.pros: Pros – People at my specific store were great, it was a lot of fun, and availability could be flexible and management would work around school.
review.cons: Cons – hours are very limited unless you are full time. Promotions are VERY hard to come by, and if they appear there is a lot of favoritism. and the pay sucks! starting is minimum wage (8$ in CA) There's too much expected from associates with anyone above supervisor doing the bare minimum. Management really needs to improve, about 10 people have left within 6 months. Considering we are a store with about 30 or so associates, that is a big chunk. Also work is distributed unevenly within associates, with a hand full of people responsible for the work of the team. I knew people who worked at surrounding stores within the Bay Area in CA, and some of the same problems of lack of communication, and work unbalance were common.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Learn to talk to your employee's better, communication or failure of communication was a big problem.

review.title: “Fun”
review.pros: Pros – Fun environment , enjoyable coworkers and you were selling toys!
review.cons: Cons – Incompetent management , had to work Black Friday, Christmas.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great First time job”
review.pros: Pros – raises, supportive managers postive work environment
review.cons: Cons – Area I worked was snooty, return policy
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great Place to Work”
review.pros: Pros – They treat their employees great and care about what they have to say. Very organized company and a great place to work. People have been there for years and that goes to show how good a company really is.
review.cons: Cons – The employee discount. That's it.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work!

review.title: “It's a very fast paced but fun environment during the holiday season”
review.pros: Pros – The people in general are fun to work with and understanding of those who have families
review.cons: Cons – Especially during the holiday season, there are extra long hours that can sometimes be mandatory
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Appreciate your hard workers more and give them room to grow

review.title: “Bad Management”
review.pros: Pros – the pay is not that bad
review.cons: Cons – management doesn't run things correctly
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “it's ok if you have no life a Christmas time”
review.pros: Pros – great people . get to see all the new toys
review.cons: Cons – Christmas time the hours are a killer. so you cant enjoy Christmas
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – more employees. for a toy store its to bad they don't let you have time with your family for the holidays

review.title: “Multiple jobs, one salary”
review.pros: Pros – The more you can perform, the more you'll get paid, which seems fair on the surface.
review.cons: Cons – With getting paid more, it comes with strenuous work loads. Someone calls out, you very well may be doing their job and yours.Minimization of staff, due to payroll, which seems to be a problem at most Toys R Us branches.Employees aren't properly trained to work in areas of the store that produce the most sales. No is trained to show customers how strollers and car seats function, putting employees in a tough spot, and leaving the customer frustrated. Cashiers working around the store's electronics mostly only know how to ring up purchases, and half the time, not knowledgeable about the actual products in the area.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Help out on one of the multiple tasks employees are forced to do.

review.title: “Horrible Store”
review.pros: Pros – Overnight stocking is very easy, but repetitive.
review.cons: Cons – Was hired as seasonal and had to quit because of my primary job. The manager threatened to come into my other job and harass me and my managers because I quit Toys.They also lost my W-2s, and more recently lost two paychecks from a friend of mine that worked there for 3 weeks. She quit because they weren't paying her.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Scrap the entire team and start from scratch.

review.title: “Pitiful Excuse For A Retail Store”
review.pros: Pros – A discount on toys for kids in your family.
review.cons: Cons – where to begin... first off here was horrible management. they were absolutely pitiful. let me mention that I had worked in another TRU in a different state & loved it!!. I Re-located to Wichita Kansas and it went down the drain. I got 8 hours the first week and 6.5 the next , then no hours the next, and the I got called in to come for an hour and a half. the store is dirty and employees are lazy. newbies are expected to carry the weight of an incompetent staff and poor mangers.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do not hire somebody promising them their previous wage and at least 20 hours, only to deliver less than 10 hours a week and minimum wage.

review.title: “Overall great experience.”
review.pros: Pros – Firstly I must say that if you are considering or have just accepted a position from TRU as your first job, don't stress out. I can honestly say that this is the easiest job I've ever had. I met so many great people there. You will receive great hours from about July to December. The supervisors and management help out with any customer situation or question you may have, and they really like it when you show them that you have an interest in expanding your in-store knowledge and skill set.
review.cons: Cons – From January to June, the store is almost dead. I would actually get 4 hours a week consecutively, and for way too long. The hours are horrible for everyone though, even management. This is impossible to live off of if you have bills to pay. However, it is a great time to take time off if you really needed to. I was encouraged to at this time to go see out of state family, because it distributes the hours a little bit better. One thing that was complained about by nearly everyone, is that they will hire just about anyone who applies for season. No matter how sloppy and rude they were, and majority of them were not much help with anything. The assistant manager my store hired seasonally was essentially a horrible dictator.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Screen the seasonal hires far more carefully.

review.title: “Department Supervisor with Keys”
review.pros: Pros – There are great people to work with and for. Most of the customers are pleasant and looking for a good time.
review.cons: Cons – There is no exit strategy for obsolete merchandise. Ever. Management turnovers can be outstandingly high. Some people in stores have no work ethic.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Address clearance more aggressively. Have a clear markdown cadence to turn inventories. Stop implementing good ideas without finishing the thought.

review.title: “management needs a lot of work”
review.pros: Pros – The customers. Meeting new parents, grandparents, etc and sharing their happiness.
review.cons: Cons – Management needs a lot of work; needs to listen to employees, not just ask how to help. Actually take action.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Listen to your employees.

review.title: “Try to avoid being a cashier”
review.pros: Pros – It is a job so it is better than nothing. You are told by management to approach every guest and talk to people so that can be a pro or a con depending on your personality.
review.cons: Cons – You are constantly nagged by management to get customers to sign up for loyalty cards and credit cards and are never praised for selling.I started at 8.50 an hour and minimum wage is 8.00 and the annual raise is only around 20 to 30 cents a year. The hours are usually a con because you will always be scheduled on Saturdays unless you are a full time employee. Full time employees usually get what I considered to be the best shifts: weekday mornings and Sundays.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay your employees better to keep them happier

review.title: “IT Tech Support”
review.pros: Pros – I worked for Toys r us for 7 years. I had prior It jobs before but I really consider that place my start in IT. The people and culture were great and the atmosphere was easy going. Their Benefits and compensation were really great at the time. I really didn't appreciate that aspect until I moved on to other companies.
review.cons: Cons – A lot of their systems were proprietary and Antiquated. Found out I had lost quite a bit of skills after leaving there. Pay could have been better although their benefits and compensation were very good.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay better, modernize systems.

review.title: “Great pt job”
review.pros: Pros – Great coworkers, and some decent customers.
review.cons: Cons – Management is horrible. Some of them just push all the work on the team members.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do the job you get paid for

review.title: “Senior Management change needed in Wayne”
review.pros: Pros – Able to hold multilple positions and perform various tasks while at TRU, good learning and training environment at multi-tasking.
review.cons: Cons – Upper Management decided to remove almost all tenured team members, many with mulitple years of seasonal knowledge... big mistake!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Remove the Sr VP of stores/operations and locate someone with people skills... he personally removed many great leaders and brought in his "friends" from Home Depot

review.title: “Worse company I have ever worked for.”
review.pros: Pros – Hired with the promise of being promoted within 3 months. I learned much later that is what they tell everyone.
review.cons: Cons – Horrible Store Managers horrible District Management unless you are part of the good old boys club. Yes it still exists at this company. If you are not one of the 'chosen' your requests for vacation time that you have earned and specific days off will be ignored. You will be scheduled to close and then back to open while Store Manager takes extra time away from the store to enjoy life. But be sure you get all the resets and price changes done with no staff. The SM will schedule all the strong workers on his shift and then ask what your problem is that you can't service the guest & complete all the tasks.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing exactly what you are doing I would love to see this company go out of business. Read Facebook look at all the customers complaints high prices and claims that you price match. This company is a joke run don't walk away.

review.title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
review.pros: Pros – It's fun working with the kids (most of the time). Luckily I liked most of the people, otherwise I would have quit right away.
review.cons: Cons – Poor pay (usual annual pay raise is around 8 cents). They rarely schedule anyone for full-time so that they can dodge the associated benefits.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You need a decent amount of people to be on the floor so that crap can actually get sold.

review.title: “I would never go back”
review.pros: Pros – Solid medical. Good 401k match. That's only for FT employees PT people get taken advantage of.
review.cons: Cons – Horrible hours. No vision. Takes advantage of guests. Return policy changes daily and 1800 toys r us is outsourced to work at home reps with no knowledge of SOP
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop speaking out of both sides of your mouth

review.title: “Enjoyable”
review.pros: Pros – I worked with good co workers
review.cons: Cons – They have no loyalty to long time employees
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – good people

review.title: “Not worth seasonal work”
review.pros: Pros – Pay was OK. Could be better.
review.cons: Cons – Not enough hours. Not even close to part time.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Overworked, underpaid, no staff to provide expected exception customer service”
review.pros: Pros – Interactions with families and kids can be funAlways new merchandise to learn aboutTraining provided for products
review.cons: Cons – Opportunities for advancement in management only if you relocateLow salary pay and no bonus structure for Assistant ManagersManagement training occurs outside of store you are hired to workMeeting expectations of corporate office in high customer service are nearly impossible with limited staff, large stores and strict payroll constraintsHourly associates are paid minimum wage and turnover is high
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Better incentive plan for entire management teamSpend time in stores to see how difficult they are to run on a day to day basisOffer contests or competitions to keep spirits high and teams engagedHigher discounts for store associates (different tiers of management vs associates)

review.title: “It's fun sometimes, but they don't pay you anything close to the same position at other stores”
review.pros: Pros – fun, like the people, i would recommend if you didn't need to pay bills
review.cons: Cons – opportunity to grow is slow and pay for a move up is hardly worth itthey need to focus on making their employees happy rather than updating the tile on the floor
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Horrid”
review.pros: Pros – Easy job, working with children
review.cons: Cons – Standing for hours on end, not enough wages, not enough hours, management doesn't care. about its employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take better care of your employees. We should be important, but you make us unimportant

review.title: “I only worked seasonal, but...”
review.pros: Pros – (Most of) the people were friendly.
review.cons: Cons – Management pushed you to go above and beyond, promised rewards and a permanent position, but end up only keeping one or two employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be honest with your seasonal members. Don't imply that you're going to keep them on and then let them go.

review.title: “Awesome, although your mileage may vary.”
review.pros: Pros – I worked at a "pop-up" store, which meant things were small, close-knit, and lacked a lot of the bureaucracy and oversight you might find at other stores. We handled business and had a blast. I had very down to earth, and trusting managers, as well as very cool co-workers. The environment lent itself to more of a family atmosphere, and that made the job infinitely better.
review.cons: Cons – Pop-up stores sometimes don't last, and such was the case with us. Other than that, there weren't any other cons, and it was easily the best job I've had, as far as retail and slave wages go.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to understand that ruling with an iron fist won't get you the results you need. Be close enough until you understand how people work, and then reap the benefits from a workforce that is comfortable in their own skin and willing do the work for you as you need.

review.title: “Very happy with Toys”
review.pros: Pros – Really nice environment to work in.
review.cons: Cons – Long hours during the holiday season.

review.title: “It's was good experience, different work environment”
review.pros: Pros – Enjoy working with different dept and seeing the outcomes the toys.
review.cons: Cons – Not communication within other dept.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Must learn to train and development a better work place.

review.title: “Great people to work with, no so great company to work for.”
review.pros: Pros – The employees were really good to work with and we all mostly did our best to help each other around the store as it was needed. I enjoyed working with customers as well, since most that came into the store outside of the Christmas season were regulars. The job itself wasn't physically demanding outside of working trucks. My management team was friendly and got along with almost everyone on the job.
review.cons: Cons – Despite not being a physically demanding job, corporate tends to cut corners and cut hours to a bare minimum for different projects. They also expect an individuals to take on lots of responsibilities without offering acceptable pay raises or other incentives to strive at the job. I left due to pay and the stress from Christmas season.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay the employees higher than minimum wage and give decent pay raises. One of the difficulties with paying so low is you get people who don't care about the job. When the pay rises, people start to care more, or you will pull in better employees for your business. Better employees means better customer service and you will receive fewer complaints on bad employees.

review.employee-type: Merchandise Planning and Allocation Business Analyst (Former Employee)
review.title: “Periodic corporate layoffs and unfair treatment of analysts make working here difficult.”
review.pros: Pros – -Some friendly co-workers.-Scenic suburban campus.-Working for a toy company.-Training program.-Working with many national toy vendors.
review.cons: Cons – -Several backstabbing employees and managers.-Gossiping and rumors going around daily, which can make work distracting.-Management promotes some questionable people who seem to have been favored from day one and lets go of some talented people for no good reason.-Store discount of only 10%.-Workload constantly increases and firedrills happen almost daily.-Analysts are forcefully encouraged to take on projects that add to the almost impossible workload, otherwise they are looked down upon or not considered for promotion..-Some managers are extremely demanding and unreasonable and will throw you under the bus if they feel threatened by their analysts' performance.-Contradicting performance reviews.-Widespread layoffs after unfavorable annual results are reported.-Very high turnover rate for analysts, hence the training program twice a year with new hires.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make sure candidates who are being promoted to management are equipped with the proper people skills before promotion. Although many of the planning managers are really great people with good management skills, there are more than a handful who drive out their analysts with improper and unprofessional treatment. Also, stop laying off large groups of employees every year. Find other ways to cut costs and produce more favorable sales results through innovation; letting go of good employees is not the answer.

It was expected that workers would get the job done even if it meant staying until midnight and working weekends which I did plenty of. Over the years our benefits were chiseled away so that by the time I left, the medical insurance I am buying myself at present is better coverage than what the company provided.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please just say thank you for a change for a job well done instead of working against the people who are there trying to do a great job and under appreciated.

Hire some people to go put re-shop away during store hours instead of having to stay an hour after closing.

They will transfer you to other stores if the need arises and there are many chances to be promoted.
review.cons: Cons – After the first few weeks of January, business is dead. Suddenly your shift feels like it is 10x longer than it was before and you stand around waiting and hoping for the moment when a customer will come and look at something. It can get pretty disheartening.

review.title: “The Long Haul”
review.pros: Pros – Friendly people, Nice atmosphere, easy, help generally given.
review.cons: Cons – Unreasonable time frame to do projects (example: a 60 minute project is given 5 minutes to complete)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give enough time to the person asking for it. If the person is a goof off then no, I understand that, but most of the time the veterans who know what they are doing are usually brushed off. I do not know if The highest levels give the proper time and the District Manager gives less hours in order to get a bigger bonus. That is an easy fix..No bonus' all around. There is not enough time in the day to do everything this is true, but my big suggestion is to think about this. If you force stores to cut hours and the floor people go home leaving the floor open for shrink you are not helping your business. It seems you put less people on the floor to save money, but at the same time Shrink goes up, way up. Lat year my store had an ungodly amount of shrink, but it all could have been avoided by a second person on RGD and proper people in the correct zones. Plus the aisles will look better and have the opportunity to sell more merchandise having it correctly merchandised. Also you need more Department Supervisors to help with the load. It will help and I guarantee more money for the business.

review.cons: Cons – sometimes people would call out and when there was supposed to be 10 people working that day only 2 would show up, supervisors would change sometimes so once you got used to a certain way of doing things another supervisor would come in and change up your whole routine which can be annoying

review.title: “Great learning experience and environment”

review.cons: Cons – not challenged enough outside of scope of internship project

review.title: “Decent company and good benefits”
review.pros: Pros – Get to work with toys and training for management is good. They have invested in their equipment and POS systems in the last few years. My former district manager was outstanding and really cared about his employees.
review.cons: Cons – Company doesn't have a solid direction on where they want to be for the moment. Not many opportunities to grow. Managers like most retail establishments are moved around to help save any store that is feeling the crunch. Not many hours for employees to work.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Have better direction.

review.title: “Should have quit while I was ahead”
review.pros: Pros – I really can't think of any. When there were enough hours it was fun to get the merchandise out on the sales floor, get it priced, straightened, and looking good.
review.cons: Cons – No benefits except 10% discount for part-timers. Hours get cut to 2,4,8 per week until you quit out of frustration.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Tell your employees thank you once in a while.

review.title: “I WANTED a career with your company but that's IMPOSSIBLE!”
review.pros: Pros – Worked at the Babies R Us store for a few years and that was excellent. The customers were terrific and the management was well trained.
review.cons: Cons – Toys R Us store is a complete 180 from the Babies R Us. Training stinks. There is no time for anything. There are 2 employees and one manager for the most part of the day. No hours are given unless you are a supervisor. If you are a supervisor you MUST have completely open availability which means, they can schedule you til 4am during season and then come back in at 8am the next day.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Allow your employees to be able to balance home life as well as work. Perhaps allow your supervisors to pick one day a week where they have off or even one day a week where they know their hours!!! You make it IMPOSSIBLE for a single parent of 2 to have a career with your company.

review.title: “Employees treated badly”
review.pros: Pros – Some team members have become like family. At the same time others are very clicky. Though I love working with e pec rant moms and families.
review.cons: Cons – I work at Babies R Us side. Very gossipy. People will talk about others making up stories to help themselves.Management will write up a team member to save their own ass.Regarding customer issues management never has your back, you are on your own fighting for your rights. HR will also gossip to management when you try to confide in them. Don't ever get hurt working for this company either, you will stay injured and fight in court, and stay injured indefinitely. They will change your hours or position at the drop of a hat. There is NO holiday pay or extra benefit for working holidays. For a family oriented company they could care less about family except their own. I went from hired as full time to the company pushing it to part time then went from 30-33 hrs a week to being lucky if there were 10. Managers will lie and blame others for their mistakes or a problem that they caused. They promise promotions and then bring in who they want, or not even let the inside person apply for the promotion. They stay open during state of emergencies and give you hell for calling out. Don't ever try to leave early either.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Upper management needs to not only look at the mighty buck. This company is going down the tubes because you are not running the company competently. If you give to your employees you will get more all the way through. We work our tails off for a company that could care less about us!!

review.title: “long and cold and toys”
review.pros: Pros – kids are everywhere so u see the fun
review.cons: Cons – long lines and onl one register open

review.title: “If you put your family first then this is not the job for you.”
review.pros: Pros – Seeing the expecting moms and dads buy stuff for their babies. Helping customers pick out baby shower gifts, etc. The Babies R Us I worked at was in a mall so it was a great diversity of people. Customers were generally very kind and understanding.
review.cons: Cons – Training is on the computer for 3 days and only about 30 minutes on the sales floor. After that you're thrown out into this huge store to fend for yourself. Spent 45 minutes with one customer trying to find an item on her registry print out. No one else helped me. Also, when I had a scheduling issue and tried to explain it to my GM, he cut me off mid sentence and said he "didn't care about my personal life" and was only concerned with "the hours I said I was available to work when he hired me". I was so disgusted with him I no call no showed and then quit. Didnt even last a month.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Train your employees more on products and the store. Most of the training was signing policy after policy and watching your "R US" robots on a computer screen stress how much you "care about your employees" (what a joke!) It doesn't matter how new your employees are you should value them ALL!

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Support us with good benefits and wage and we might stay longer. Ask employee opinions more then just a yearly survey you don't really listen to.

review.title: “High expectations desired with little to no help to get there.”
review.pros: Pros – Good employees, occasionally fun enviroment. Decent opportunities for growth. Management that understands the bulk of the extraordinary expectations.
review.cons: Cons – Low pay, outrageous expectations. Stores are staffed with very few associates despite being a "guest focused" culture. Expected to work 365 days a year, a company that preaches family values while not having a single aspect of a life/work balance.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Work in the stores that you have such high expectations of. How often store management is asked to perform at unbelieveable levels with very few workers and even fewer hours to work out projects by corporate level management. Corporate should have to work in the stores especially during season when lower level management is being given over to management burnout.

review.title: “No appreciation for seasonal workers”
review.pros: Pros – I got a lot of hours closer to the holidays
review.cons: Cons – I was working there temporarily over the holidays. I knew I was a temp going into the job. However, I was not expecting the manager to call me the night of Christmas Eve telling me I was no longer needed and they weren't hiring any of the holiday employees on for part-time work. The managers have no sense of respect for their seasonal employees.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Disappointing, disingenuous, demeaning...”
review.pros: Pros – Payroll is typically accurate and timely.
review.cons: Cons – Schedules are non-existent, last-minute, and lack integrity.Hours are cut at last minute and often without legitimate reason.Management and supervisors exhibit unprofessional behavior based on limited employee recourse.Store "Human Resource" employee is not required to have any professional HR training (contributing to the limitation on employee advocacy).Management, HR and departmental communication implies lack of basic education, general knowledge and/or skills.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – While profitability is always the main goal, the company would be well-served to realize the constant turnover due to mistreatment and disrespect of "team members" is costly and negatively impacts the bottom line. Recognize, encourage and nurture your dedicated, efficient and professional employees.

review.title: “Toys "R" Us is stressful during season and very relaxed otherwise; but, all in all an easy side job.”
review.pros: Pros – Employees are down-to-earth and considerate. Knowledge of sales and deals at Toys "R" Us is a perk. Store Manager is friendly and flexible with schedules.
review.cons: Cons – Store tends to get very dirty and inventory is often strewn about. Managers constantly berate employees about metrics. Out-of-season is very limited in terms of work hours given to part-time employees. Employee discount is negligible. Training is very informal and lacking.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Improve inventory by allowing customers to have official input on what they want to purchase. Improve the "Big Ticket" request system because as it is now, customers take a slip, wait in line at registers, hand the slip, cashiers call Big Ticket, and customers have to wait even longer before exiting the store and/or making the purchase. Streamline the Big Ticket system so that customers can make the request before ever standing in line at registers. Improve break rooms. Rest rooms also need lots of attention.

review.title: “I was working there in season during Black Friday/ Christmas, so the hours were good with decent pay.”

review.cons: Cons – The hours out of season. Only getting a total of 10-12 hours per paycheck doesn't help someone financially.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.cons: Cons – - Screaming kids, angry customer complaints- Doesn't pay enough- HORRIBLE place to be in during Black Friday + Christmas season- Forced to be in until your work is done even if it's too much for 1 shift to handle WITHOUT overtime
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please make sure the managers you hire aren't bipolar or have anger issues.

review.title: “Cashier/sales”

review.title: “Corporate Human Resources not a good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – I had nice and friendly co-workers. It was a good place to jog/walk. Small but good gym and very affordable dry cleaner available to employees. Half days on Fridays during the summer if you made up the time. Cafeteria on premises. Starbucks coffee.
review.cons: Cons – Corporate Human Resources was a good place to work. Belligerent management destroyed the warm, friendly culture former and better managment spent years cultivating. It is now a toxic environment without respect, motivation, or career development. Co-workers just disappear one day and you found out much later they were let go, without any explanation from management. Poor leadership. Morale is nonexistent. What a shame because it used to be a really great and fun place to work.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire managment who live in the twenty first century, not the twentieth. Treat employees with the respect they deserve.

review.title: “not so great but 8.5 is higher than minimum wage”
review.pros: Pros – 10% discount on toys and baby products
review.cons: Cons – Busy season don't expect a break. They work you right through your paid 15 minute breaks, and most of your unpaid 1/2 hour breaks. Yes there's little notes in the break room telling you to call the toll free number if you feel like you're not getting your fair share of breaks... don't call it unless you want to be fired for some other reason. After they work you through your 1/2 break (unpaid) they ask you to sign a piece of paper saying you forgot to punch in and out for lunch. Then there's the buyer protection plans (look at the prices of the protection plan... you're paying too much according to the manufacturers). You are expected to shove these down the throats of the customers. You don't sell enough in a day, you get publicly humiliated in the break room they put big fat zeros next to your name for all your co-workers to see.Lot's and Lot's of young management on power trips. Much like being in Jr. High again. If you're not in the in crowd expect 20 hours a week spread out so that it's impossible to work another job, expect to close one night and open the following morning, and expect to work every single weekend. Everyone who works for toys r us are expected to know how to run the cash registers.... it doesn't work like that. If you're in the in crowd, you don't have to work the cash register if you don't want to.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “R Zone”
review.pros: Pros – The work is very easy. Outside of season you really don't due much. It's a good job for students.
review.cons: Cons – Almost everything. The stores really push Rewards, and Credit Cards a lot. A majority of customers already have the Rewards cards, so it's hard to get them. You hours (in R Zone) are based of your metrics. Batteries, Rewards, Buyer Protection Plans, and Instant Credit. My location (like most) are very under staffed. I stand around for half my shift doing nothing because I have to stay visible. I'll be the only person on the floor till I go home. I can't even straightin the area up. It's kinda stressful at times. The management expects a lot, for no real incentive outside pizza parties. I still need training for store policy. But they can't do that due to the lack of hours. I get about 22 hours a week if I'm lucky. I wouldn't want anybody to have this Job unless they have mad sales skills.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Help your employees more.

review.title: “Working here drained the life out of me.”
review.pros: Pros – The hours are flexible mostly. The pay is alright, I guess. There's a relaxed dress code with some opportunities to wear things such as sports jerseys.
review.cons: Cons – The managers aren't helpful. You don't receive proper training. Hours are cut more than in half as soon as holiday season ends and are given to the seasonal employees who were kept on staff.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get involved more, don't hide in your offices. Give proper training when employees first start working.

review.title: “Full time in Bentonville, AR”

review.cons: Cons – Management (at the time) let team leads get away with showing up late including for opening. No accountability, and playing tricks with pay.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Toys R Us in Puerto Rico - Good job to have to know you don't want to work in retail”

review.cons: Cons – Managers and supervisors were uncoordinated, store management was a mess, training for seasonal employees was minimal and not very helpful, fake promise of permanent position (they did not hire anyone after the holiday season), Black Friday was a horrible mess that I was about to quit, very uncaring managers in my opinion, does not live up to the training videos about star service.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do not treat employees so bad and more communication is needed between managers.

review.title: “Uncaring”
review.pros: Pros – It's a job, hire a lot of people, quite a few of the workers are nice, the interview is a lot of fun, there's a few discounts, easy job to do.
review.cons: Cons – They don't care about their employees, can't use employee discount on diapers or much needed baby supplies, easy to get in trouble at the company, they push stupid questions and a lot of them (at least 6 per person and you have to ask each person if they need batteries, if they have a toy that requires them or not), no tolerance for the workers, very low pay. I gave my 2 weeks to my HR because I was offered a better job elsewhere and was told by the head manager that I could never apply there again because I was unprofessional when I quit. He was very rude.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Care more about your employees, better pay and benefits, less rude people.

review.title: “Definitely would not recommend to serious retail professionals...”

review.cons: Cons – - Constantly Cutting labor, to the point of damaging productivity,business and customer satisfaction.- Little or no communication between, corporate, regional and dist. leadership.- No real sales emphasis. Very much a "clerk" mentality.- At least in my experience management had a hard time holding associates accountable.- Poor SOP, go into 10 TRU/ BRU locations and get 10 experiences- Horrible training. Invest in your people- More Labor, especially for recovery and inventory replenishment. Stores look pretty bad
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Invest in real, meaningful training for your employment- More incentives for line level associates. At least offer spiffs for esp's, credit, rewards etc. Base pay is pretty bad for line level team members.

review.title: “Good first time (seasonal) job.”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible hours, will work with you if you have school or another job.Friendly co-workers and management.Fun environment.
review.cons: Cons – During seasonal hours can very and be few.Little training - consisted of watching a 45 minute video and shadowing someone for about half an hour, then sent out on your own.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – A little more training would be nice, I know that I was only seasonal, but that doesn't mean that I don't care about the job I'm doing and that I don't want to know what I'm really doing.

review.title: “its ok. i dont want to be here here forever though if i cant move up soon”
review.pros: Pros – good pay, good hours if you ask to work and learn things. and of course if you do a good job then you will make more money. it can be fun at times. talking to people on the sales floor definitely gives great experience for many other future jobs. its not easy to get fired really. not as many crying babies as one might expect. and pregnant ladies are actually pretty kind. when people do recognize your hard work, it feels pretty good, but thats not often. pos system is pretty simple. scheduling is pretty good.
review.cons: Cons – sales pressure for cashiers is not cool. cashiering can make one feel robotic and while it may look good on applications to cashier for a couple years, it does a lot more for your character to sell things on the sales floor. some employees can be rude and immature at times. inconsistent policies and procedures. not all employees are on the same page about how things work. i have a bad feeling that my last pay "raise" was based on a personal bias of one supervisor towards me which had no reasonable explanation to it. its not that easy to be recognized. nobody seems to trust each other. theres no drug tests. after my long time working very hard i feel like if im not recognized as the next supervisor of my department then im basically wasting my time. when the store is busy, the lack of enough main cashiers calls for sales floor workers to get on registers and lose time that could be used on more important tasks. oh, and managers definitely have favorites. too much complaining from everyone about everything. the complaining has definitely rubbed off on me as well
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – pay closer attention to all employees. show more respect. an old assistant manager of mine was basically an expert of the whole store, all managers should be that way. managers should basically know more than anyone when it comes to certain procedures, product knowledge, and just how to do everything. could be a little more open minded. store seems too divided by departments. we need more to make our small group of employees feel like an awesome team. more employees and more business to make use of new employees. if theres any way to suggest to corporate better marketing strategies to improve sales that would be great. out store seems like the minimum of a "busy store".

review.title: “Very good job but not career unless you like retail A LOT”
review.pros: Pros – I loved working there for about 8 or 9 months but I was there for 14 months total. I was hired for season in November and it was my first job and I was ecstatic at the age of 17. Working season for the first time was a lot of fun yet a lot of work which wasnt anything to complain about. My managers seemed to love me and I was given a very very very small raise which again i was fine with at 17. I got along great with my coworkers at work but since i was so young i was excluded from most of the activities that the other coworkers always did such as bowling, movies, and bars which i couldnt go for obvious reasons. The pay was ok for me since i was in high school but it was not much. I worked for 14 months and ony made 4500 total.
review.cons: Cons – Aside from the good things,which i cant deny there were a lot but very seldom, there were so many flaws that i never saw until i matured through my job and personal life. One of the biggest flaws is those stupid metrics such as loyalty goals and bpp's and batteries. NOBODY CARES I GUARANTEE IT. of course there are the few suckers (guests) that get sucked into the monopoloy of over priced toys that are "only at toys r us." but in reality and for the real people of this wold, no one cares about loyalty cards and they especially dont care about the secret marketing idea that is behind them. and if metrics ae so important than why shouldnt you give the cashiers some form of comission for selling them. if we dont get any reward for doing them and geting a lot of metrics (and believe me i got plenty) then that causes people like me to not care about metrics. there is no room for advanceent unless you are tere for fricken ever. since there is no room for advancement there is no desire to do anything at all that benefits the ompany unless it somehow benefits us but it DOES NOT. for example wheni had been there for about 4 months they tld me that they wanted to move me to rzone in about two months. im a geek so i belong there and i completed their training but waited patiently for about 6 or 7 months. when they started hiring for season i asked f i could go to rzone but they told me some crappy stuff about me being the best cahier and they needed me to help te new ones. instead of moving me there they hired new people who knew almost nothing and that angered me. cashiering is not hard at all and i figured it out onmy own. they can too. i again patiently wated until season was over and i expected to work rzone by then but no they moved somebody else over there because "it as a girl" . by season after working there for a year with no appreciation i stopped caring at all. during reshop i would stick a bunch of random items behind biger suff so we could leave early. anybody that has worked cashier know its exrremely easy but it is beyondboring and annoying as hell. i got tired of neglect and getting terible hours for terrible wges and constantly working cashier shifts so i just stopped going and could care less what happened because of my absence.sory for all the grammar errors this was off of a phone.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Figure out a way to motivate employes to actually do their job.Make a rewards program that actually benefits the guests and make it easier to understand and utilize for the guests.Stop sucking at your jobGet better and faster checkout lanes and counters

review.title: “Sales Associate”

review.title: “Toys R Us”

review.cons: Cons – The do not put employees in a position to succeed the budget goals with inefficient resources and expect the stronger employees to compensate for bad planning. It is a formula that leads to unsatisfied overworked employees and little bandwidth to make adjustments should any complications arise. All in all it is a poorly run company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – As a store manager I would say that you need to provide more realistic resources for stores and not expect a manager to have satisfied customers without budgeting for sufficient employee resources for both projects and service.

review.title: “Great opportunity gone to waste by old fashioned ideas...”
review.pros: Pros – Pay is much higher than most other internshipsThere is little to no hand-holding, intern must desire challenge and have an assertive personalityIntern gets the harsh reality of working in the retail industry
review.cons: Cons – Many older people work at Toys "R" Us and they have been there for years which is indicative that the company is slow to promoteMuch time is spent at the front end of the store as a cashier if store is under-staffedLeadership dismisses internship assignments unless intern is persistent
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – An internship is intended for students to gain a first-hand glimpse into the reality of their chosen job fields. Being a management internship, this is designed for students to understand the various supervisory roles within the organization. In order for an intern to truly learn all of the aspects of their internship, management should be proactive and organized with a plan of action for the week. Interns should not come in and operate as cashiers and/or floor team members. The internship is designed for students who can take on a leadership role as they have already proven the basic skills.

review.title: “Good people mostly, ridiculous protocol and Yes man managers”

And the scheduled get revised and not always told of change.
review.cons: Cons – Horrible managing , When you follow through protocol upper management comes and make you look silly by changing protocol for the customer making you look Ike you don't know what you are doing but when ask them before finalizing decision you get the " you know the rules". Company is a joke
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop using favoritism and leave equal as equal as well stop hiring more and more people and just give more hours to the people who work for you instead of giving four hour shift and 2 day work weeks

Apparently easy to move into a supervisor position.
review.cons: Cons – Understaffed, messy as hell at the store I'm in. Lack of clear duties. Sporadic scheduling. Can't openly have a beverage out to stay hydrated. Employees seem to be retained only by how many member cards and such that they can hand out.

review.cons: Cons – No training, lots of confusion in management, and little scheduling flexibility.

I didn't even know what buttons to push. This in turn made customers very upset and impatient. There has to be at least some training within the organization. When I asked other associates to help, they seemed just as confused as me. I worked at Toys R Us for one day (I was even asked my the manager there to stay 2 hours extra) and called HR the next day to tell them this was not a good fit.

review.title: “Terrible company, terrible management”

review.cons: Cons – Terrible payLow hours 9 months of the yearManagement is terribleJob security is minimal for mostYour treatment is based on your sales performanceBenefits are miserableNo chance of promotion, everUpper management is very disorganized, and lacks communicationWill push you to your limits of frustrationNo chance of a constant scheduleNo training

review.title: “Low pay, long hours, disregard for rights”
review.pros: Pros – You get paid money, which is used for buying things.
review.cons: Cons – Breaks are only given because they have to be- you can be standing over 10 hours before you get even a 15 minute break. Especially during the holiday season. Most managers won't let you use the bathroom or get a drink of water even after hours straight, leaving the majority of employees dehydrated with medical problems not covered because they do not offer benefits. Complaints about harassment are not taken seriously. You work until the store is clean at night, even if it means you stay until 3am or you lose your job. This goes for people with kids, pregnant people, those with second jobs because TRU will not pay a livable wage in any version of reality, etc. You are held to extremely high standards and ridiculous expectations with no option for bonus. This is why most employees do not care about their job and it's reflected in the service customers get from standard red shirts.

review.title: “Excessive management turnover”
review.pros: Pros – 10% discount on many but not all items in the store. Salary was very competitive.
review.cons: Cons – In my store we went through 3 district managers, 3 store managers, 1 interim store manager in the span of 3 years.This high turnover resulted in assistant managers having to compete with each other for resources, since there was no real leadership, it broke down cooperation, increased squabbling and finger-pointing.Even when there was stable district leadership, the hours were pretty brutal. You can expect a 55 to 60 hour work week in a store where things are running well out of season. 70 hours or more and 6 days a week in a situation where the store is not running well, and during the holiday/ inventory season.All of this would have been bearable for those with a strong work ethic, but for one VERY important issue: Respect.When store managers take credit for all the accomplishments you and you peers as ASMs have cultivated through hard work and ridiculous hours, but then get thrown under the bus and have any issues or problems attributed to the ASMs lack of dedication, or ability or care... It's incredibly demoralizing. It makes going to work each day a chore. Worse than that, it sets a precedent where ASMs begin blaming team leads for failures and so on.Everyone in that building is there to succeed. Of all the district and store leaders in those three years only ONE made the team feel that way. Everyone else made it clear that the team was there to make them, meaning that one DM or store manager, succeed. Our personal views, issues, aspirations, needs, challenges did not matter it they did not further his personal growth.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Absolutely ALL of this stems from insufficient training and payroll. TRU wants to emulate Target so badly, but doesn't take into account that their employee base and your are EXACTLY the same. Rather than luck out and find a competent manager or hourly team member, how about creating them?Investing in training pays off in too many ways to list here, not the least of which are competence, loyalty and morale. Do you really think that some eLearing and LMS courses are enough to train someone? New hires are coverage almost immediately due to payroll constraints. New managers are thrown in the fray of things immediately and PLEASE do not say how they get two weeks of 'training' before starting. Those are two weeks of pushing freight in some other store, or doing their resets and planograms. If TRU took training seriously they wouldn't leave the Store manager and ASM training to self-taught, hourly team members who happen to have kept their job over several years. They would have corporate-driven, train the trainer programs to disseminate STANDARDIZED process, not "Well, this is the way I do it" shortcuts from individuals who never had the ability and/or desire to become managers themselves.

review.cons: Cons – I didn't like the clean-up at the end of the night. I worked the late shift and the last hour or so was everyone wandering around putting things back and straightening the shelves. It can get very dusty and takes forever with little instruction. I understand why it has to be done, but it sucked.

review.title: “Just don't do it”
review.pros: Pros – Great workforce training programs. Empowering workforce structure. Strong investment in process improvements. Encourages movement within the organization. Great corporate execution, makes up for lack of plans.
review.cons: Cons – The chickens are running the coup. In many ways HR has good policies and controls, but delinquent in other ways. Lower level employees feel empowered to the point where they can be overly aggressive to their management and involve HR if they get pushed back. Roles are very confining in scope, great if you like to be an expert in a very narrow range of responsibility, but not good for a generalist/executive in training.The company strategy is not analytical and based off of feel. This is extremely frustrating when presenting obvious facts against a counter ideology that disagrees based on a belief.Had no confidence in the CEO when he spent 20 minutes out of a presentation in front of the whole company asking associates what they should name their Saturday sales event. Isn't this what you pay a marketing team for? Sure enough after 20 minutes of alliteration from all corners of the room "Super Savings Saturday" wound up on the flyer. Some of you may like the inclusion that management gives in this example, but to me I felt like there was a complete lack of organization and structure.Company is owned by VC right now (public knowledge). This means that they are currently reducing the workforce cost to make the company look better for IPO. This puts extra workload on the employees and added stress. I would be very concerned for the companies prospect of surviving long after the IPO when the loans come due. This is only my opinion though.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management needs to lead from the top and depend on competence underneath them. The executives need a longer range plan with practical benchmarks and strong continuity. Strategy needs to be approached in a cross functional manner, not in silos. Use the strong analytical tools of the organization to support your decisions. Base your decisions on moving the needle from analytics not making the analytics match your ideology.

No hours outside of season - really, I averaged 6 a week at that point.

review.cons: Cons – Job descriptions seem very limiting and very niche. Not good if you want to get a wide array of experience and knowledge in a short amount of time. review.title: “Great people to work with but way too much sales pressure.”

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Learn to treat your employees with respect. We aren't just mindless drones we have lives, personalities and integrity. Toys R Us is the WORST company I have ever worked for and I make sure everyone knows not to get a job there.

You may not get to look like a hero for bending the rules, but you'll have associates who will trust you and work harder for you.

review.title: “Working during the holiday peak season will test you physically, mentally and emotionally”

review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “A horrible, soul crushing, life sucking company to work for”
review.pros: Pros – Decent benefits for part-time employees ( vacation time, personal time, very basic health care package is available to purchase) You WILL learn the art of multitasking to the "nth" degree, whether you want to or not
review.cons: Cons – I could write a book- Let's see, they jam the importance of "guest service" down our throats each and every day, yet continue to cut employee hours to the point that there is NOBODY available to help customers. The store that I work at is extremely busy- every God-given morning there are people camped out front waiting for us to open, and upper management is aware of this. But instead of having a cashier or two scheduled to be there for opening, they will schedule only one to come in an hour after we open. So do you know what that means? That means the service desk associate gets to ring purchases, do returns, adjustments, layaways, internet orders, help customers find items, and answer the 12 phone lines that constantly ring off the hook. Then, when you finally do get a cashier, they will pull them to the entrance to "greet" the customers coming in the door, because we have to constantly worry about our GSAT (guest satisfaction) scores. So while people are waiting in line forever, they can look over and see an associate just standing there saying "hello" to people. They in turn get pissed off and get nasty with whoever is working the front end, and ask why that person is just standing there when the lines are so long. Then the idiots in upper management wonder why we get crappy survey scores! They can't seem to fathom that most customers would rather be able to make their purchases quickly than to have someone greet them at the door and make them feel all warm and fuzzy inside. Our registers and computers are often very slow, which just adds to the stress level. Half of what's on sale each week will not ring up correctly, and we are constantly having to check signage and our ads because of this. Why can't things be programmed properly, EVER?? Isn't that somebody's job, to make sure that the sales ring properly? And when you are up at the front end by yourself and there's no one available on the floor to check the signage for you, you have to run back and do it yourself, leaving your line of customers to do so. I have never seen this happen in other stores, at least not on a consistent, daily basis. Also, the air conditioning in our store is practically nonexistent. In the summer time, it gets so hot and uncomfortable and stuffy in there. We always have customers complain about it as well, and they will be dressed in tank tops and flip flops. Try being in long pants, socks and shoes, and a nasty red polo shirt, running around helping people like a chicken with its head cut off! But do you think that upper management will have the AC replaced?? Of course not, what do they care? They're sitting on their lazy butts in a nice peaceful air-conditioned office! They don't have to hear the customers complain about the heat, and they're not the ones getting light-headed, dizzy, and sweating their butts off! You will never enjoy a holiday, ANY holiday again, if you work here. It doesn't matter if it's Christmas, Thanksgiving, Easter or the Fourth of July. We always have one ridiculous ad or another out during any given holiday. The problem is, we often won't have many of the items in the ad in stock, which really angers people! Or, if we do have the item, we will only have a few of them, so we run out the first day of the ad. (also angering people) The customers in turn proceed to scream and yell at the service desk associate, because it is their fault after all, isn't it?? Then you will have the people that call on the phones nonstop,as if we're the Home Shopping Network, wanting someone in the store to do their shopping for them. The problem is, we are always so short-staffed that the people who call on the phones are often on hold for an eternity. Of course, that's IF the service desk person has time to even answer the phones at all! Then some of our managers even have the gall to ask why the phones aren't being answered in a timely manner. Um, hello, I'm alone up front with a line a mile long!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop making your stores run on a skeleton crew and then berate them when they get poor survey scores, quit making sale ads for things that won't be in stock, hire someone to answer phones at the busier stores, replace broken air-conditioning in stores that need it, give better raises to employees who get good yearly reviews, hire some form of security for stores in high crime areas

review.title: “Toys R us is a fun face paced retail environment”
