review.cons: Cons – You need to have lots of patience. Kids will be kids so you constantly need to be on your feet. The only real con would be lack of hours during non-peak season (Holiday season). However during peak season, it can get very stressful and chaotic.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be honest and straightforward with your employees.

review.title: “Working at TRU is draining”
review.pros: Pros – The excitement of the kids
review.cons: Cons – Management is unsatifactoryNot all information in changes and promotions is communicated effectively
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more engaged in what is going on in the storeTry to relate and communicate more with employees so we may better communicate with guestsIt is a toy store, so have lively personality so that the atmosphere of the work place isn't so draining

review.title: “Horrible Experience!”
review.pros: Pros – The retail industry is not suited for me due to the inconsistency,unpredictable scheduling,and demanding (physical) expectations that employees are expected to follow. However, if you enjoy working in the challenging retail store environment, and if you enjoy working the various inconsistent schedules that the retail industry demands of you, then you would probably enjoy working at Toys R Us. Not to mention, if you really enjoy being around people and kids, then this job is for you. There were some nice customers I encountered that appreciated what I would do for them,but some were just plain rude(as is to be expected in the retail industry). Walking around the store non-stop to organize the toys that kids misplaced was tiring and burdensome, but it was a great form of exercise.
review.cons: Cons – Well, let's see....Toys R Us obligates employees to work excruciating hours on major holidays like Christmas and Thanksgiving, when they should be allowed to spend that time with their families. Holidays are meant to be spent with family;holidays are not meant for people to be at work slaving away for demanding customers that didn't want to do their christmas shopping in advance. I understand that Toys R Us is a corporation, and as such, needs to make money and profits. However, the CEO and managers at Toys R Us should comprehend and uderstand that the hardworking hourly employees are the ones that contribute to the successes and profits of the company,and without the employees Toys R Us would fall apart. The employees' needs for balance in work and family life should be taken into consideration, because in turn employees will be happy and more productive. Employees are subjected to unsafe work conditions, and management doesn't appropriately train their employees on safety regulations and the safe way to do things; they expect employees to "know" what to do. There is a lack of proper communication with management in regards to employee safety. Employees are not paid an appropriate living wage, they are expected to work demanding hours on their feet all the time without overtime, and they are expected to work extreme hours just to please the customers.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management and the CEO should be humane with their hard-working employees, and they should close the stores on major holidays in order to allow their employees to spend time with their families. If you take into consideration that your employees are human beings that have lives and families outside of work, then they will be happy and more productive. Happy employees that feel appreciated and respected work harder, and they are more productive. Management and the CEO should close the stores earlier(or not open them at all) on Sundays, because Sundays should be spent with family and not working. Employees are people with families and lives outside of work, and they are not robots. Pay your dedicated employees a living wage, and treat them like human beings!

review.title: “Don't waist any time working at Toys R Us....”
review.pros: Pros – Easy work, if you work overnight. Flexible hours. Good place to work if you're in high school.
review.cons: Cons – It's a joke. The worse workers get more respect than the real workers. They seem to pay very little attention to who's working and who's not. Average workers who walk around with their pants below their butt and their boxers showing, manage to be kept, while people who actually dress presentable and put in hard work are thrown away unless they are buddies with the management.I've worked in 2 other retail stores that are actually bigger than Toy R Us and this is by far the worse one. Usually the smaller the store, the better the treatment, but not in this case. It's the only employer that expects workers to know how to work equipment without any training and do jobs that they've never been trained to do. Toys R Us and training don't even belong in the same sentence. Don't even get me started on the lack of break policy. They are picky about who gets a break and who doesn't. Some people have worked all 8 hours without a break and filing a complaint to corporate won't help. The whole entire company is garbage. Wish they would fall off already. They don't deserve the success.I didn't work there long enough to know earn a raise, but the ones who have still haven't got one. They treat everyone as an expendable. If you're over 18 don't invest anytime at Toys R Us. It's a joke.

review.title: “Good Place to work”
review.pros: Pros – It is a great place to learn!!
review.cons: Cons – Internal promotion pay is very minimum.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Why not pay your internal promotions as much as you would outsiders?

review.title: “It was OK to work for but not sure if I would go back due to the Mandatory staying late.”
review.pros: Pros – 10% employee discount.No Waiting on line for Holiday Sales.1st dibs on the hot new toys.Very Flexable Hours and Days Off.Friendly Employees.
review.cons: Cons – No matter what time your schedule says you will be leaving they force you to stay and "reshop" the store to put away the toys. I was stuck there until 3am one night even though i was only scheduled until 12am and had to go to my real job at 8am. The next day went back to TRU and again was told it was mandatory that I stayed late because there was alot to reshop and we were not allowed to leave until it was done which took until 6am! Also I was not allowed to take a dinner break or a 15 min break during the 6 extra hours I was stuck there. (I didn't take one before the mandatory staying)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Have the overnight crews that knows where EVERY item in the stores go reshop because they are a lot faster then cashiers that have no idea of where things keep getting moved to. Also you should ask the employees if they are able to stay late and inform them it might be until 3am or later. You can not hold people there for hours and hours extra without them agreeing to stay.Hire more night crew for them to do the reshopping that way the cashiers that have dealt with fighting parents and screaming children all day can go home.

review.title: “Irritating”
review.pros: Pros – -The other team members-its a lot of fun with others-learn a lot of different stuff-gain experience for future
review.cons: Cons – -the manager doesn't know how to effectively communicate what he feels with employees-they treat you as if you are expendable-you deal with more crazy and rude customers than any other place-you have to deal with system failures and problems with the computer all the time-they demand a lot from you-they aren't very forgiving when you're sick... they have no problem firing you over it
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Communicate with employees better, and do not fire someone over something that was not their fault, but another manager's. Someone should not be fired for being sick and calling in.

review.title: “very good experience”
review.pros: Pros – helpful employees and easy to learn everything
review.cons: Cons – slow at timesnot alot of training
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “A great stepping stone.”
review.pros: Pros – If you are looking to move up as a dept. supervisor, toys r us is the place to work. They do 80% internal promotions.
review.cons: Cons – They reason why they do 80% internal promotions is so they dont have to pay you that much. As a HR dept supervisor moving up in the company or any other supervisor position, you would make about $2 more than minimum wage, or lower.... depending on how long you have worked there.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – not to my immediate manager, but to corporate... there would be a lot less turnover, and better supervisor if you would pay your employees better than you would pay someone coming from outside the company

review.title: “They expect more of their employees every year with less time and resources to do the job.”
review.pros: Pros – The company is very flexible. They definitely work with you in terms of scheduling. It is generally a smaller staff in the stores and this promotes a tight knit group of employees.
review.cons: Cons – The company continues to increase the workload and expectations of its employees while at the same time reducing hours. The return policies and lack of the policy printed on receipts makes it extremely difficult for the associates to keep the customers satisfied. With the right resources and hours the stores could do well. Unfortunately this is not the case.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Come into the stores and see what your employees are going through. You can't add in extra services that create extra work and then reduce hours. Your employees are frustrated and stressed. Get back in touch with your stores and the reality of what the customers and employees need. And please put the return policy back on the receipts! As a consumer myself, I think it was a very poor choice to remove it.

review.title: “Slave labor”
review.pros: Pros – The weak 10% discount makes your purchases tax free, then 3% off.'It's a job.
review.cons: Cons – Management doesn't post the schedule until less than 24 hours before that schedule begins, making it impossible to know when you work.Revisions are made to the schedule (hours cut) without notifying those who are affected.Low pay with low, not often, raises.Expected to take on the roles of 3-4 people with little to know training at all.Under 6 hours you are supposed to have a 15 min break. *Almost never happens*Over 6 hours you are supposed to have a 30 min lunch break. *Only if you have a reasonable manager on that shift*I've gone 7 hours straight here with absolutely no break....just more ridiculous commands.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Follow your own company policies before you expect your employees to.Be more organized and have your schedules set and posted at a reasonable time. *I.E. one week ahead*

review.title: “Fine”
review.pros: Pros – Work live balance is acceptable
review.cons: Cons – seasonal demans place a strees on the work live balance
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – reduce stress

review.title: “Should be better”
review.pros: Pros – I found some very hard working people there.Taking care of the kids makes you feel great
review.cons: Cons – No bonus, Minimum Discount, No travel... There is absolutly no advantage of managing in this company. Why do you need 4+ managers opening by 7am? I know... So you can use them as free labor being that they are on salary. No way should the managers do what they are doing. But this is the business they believe to be successful, however it will not. Be prepared for some of the sillyest problems that will drive you insane on a daily basis (item not on file, not enough computers to help more than one guest at a time, return policy? haha. its just turrible)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Change... Every aspect. You cannot have your DM's micro manage the stores in which they are not even in. you Have 4-6 managers per store. If you make up a "front end manager", what role does everyone else play? It seems like the verterans get the easier part of the job. Its sad but im sure this business will be belly up soon. Oh yea..... your return policy is by far thee worst ever. Thanks for making my days difficult due to your insane return policy.

review.title: “The most stressful and most thankless job I've ever had.”
review.pros: Pros – It's better than being unemployed. Team members are over all very hard working, cooperative, good intentioned, and very friendly to work with.
review.cons: Cons – The pay is less than other big box retailers. There is no extra compensation for holidays, for which they are open for all except Christmas. As a DS, you have no say in how or when you are scheduled, you have to offer open availability. There are weekly "turnaround" shifts, where you close and leave the store around midnight, and then have to be back at 6am. In a year, I only had 2 days in a row off once. The store manager where I worked crushed the morale of everyone working there. There was a 100% turnover in in one year. Training was on the fly, in a very high volume fast paced store, most of us were figuring out things as we went. GSL leading, was very frustrating, because we had to coach the cashiers to sell bpp's, batteries, rewards and instant credit all of which most people didn't need or want. They tracked the numbers on these add ons and if the numbers where low as a DS you were held accountable and could be written up for that. When you quit, any earned vacation time is not paid out. You lose it, but you gain the opportunity to find a better place to work where you'll be more respected.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – When there is 100% turn over in one store, many of whom have been with the company for 5 plus years, take a close look, something, or many things are terribly wrong

review.title: “An OK place to work; Laid back environment; Not very stressful”

review.cons: Cons – - Bonus incentive is nominal and is tied to company & international performance which makes it hard to really motivate- Promotions can take a long time; Lateral moves are encouraged and more frequent but the company policy is not to give pay increases for lateral moves- Company overly focuses on bringing in MBAs - it's a core requirement, but any MBA from any school is fine. Quality of education is irrelevant for this company, you just need the degree. This leads to a VERY wide range of talent all at the same title- Too many test initiatives + analysts who don't know how to interpret data properly-No tuition reimbursement-HMO healthplan is affordable, but POS plan is very expensive, especially for a family.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need more stratification in the titles; (At this company, a person one year out of college can be a Senior Analyst, and so can someone w/ 10 years of experience from an Ivy League school)

review.title: “It sure beats being unemployed!”
review.pros: Pros – My coworkers are the only real enjoyable part of my job experience so far. They are very helpful and courteous towards me. I look forward to going to work because of them.
review.cons: Cons – I absolutely loathe the corporate section of toys r us. I understand that the bottom line is what matters the most for any company. THIS company, however, puts the bottom line above treating its employees fairly.Store managers are forced to cut hours, on a biweekly basis due to unreasonable corporate demands. We recently lost an assistant manager, and our other assistant manager just put in his two weeks notice. The logical response would be to increase the hours of its hourly employees (who make less than or equal to 1/4 of an assistant manager) to help compensate for these losses. Instead, corporate decides that it will "front" us 30 hours. By front I mean, that they will let us go over our allotted weekly hours, but we will also have to pay these hours back. So basically, they put us into a worse situation for the future. This is because we will have to cut hours in future weeks to make up for the 30 borrowed hours.I could go on to criticize the lack of on the job training, the pay, and the other unreasonable demands (metrics, planograms, etc.) of the corporate offices. Unfortunately reviews are not allowed to contain rants or obscenities so I will cut myself off.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I like the way that our store managers and supervisors run the store.Corporate really needs to get their act together. How can you expect your grunts to be effective if you set ineffective policies?

review.title: “4th rate retail”
review.pros: Pros – Work here only if you need a job in a bad way. Initial salaries are competitive for Store Managers. Again, unless you are desparate, stary away from ToysRus. No self-respecting professional has any business here.
review.cons: Cons – 4th rate retail. The leadership at the company thinks TRU is relevant. It is not. It is not fun, you have no resourses, and your are micromanaged. This company does not even pay you for accrued vacation if you leave--classy! Stay away from this company. If you work here--over time-- you will be embarrassed and angry at the company, its mis-management, and its blatent disregard for Team members. There is a reason why you can at any given time find multiple listings for store managers in every TRU market. This is 4th rate retail. Stay far, far away.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Close it down. You are not relevant and considered a joke in the business community.

review.title: “Unorganized and a lot of Arrogance”
review.pros: Pros – During the holidays, it's very busy which is nice. There's actually a lot of cool stuff that they have there that you can get to learn about in your down time. Being around toys a lot helps you choose presents a lot easier.
review.cons: Cons – The management was full of arrogant people. My supervisor took very long to get the most simple things done for me, like get me a cashier sign on code. The store manager seemed very spacy.

review.title: “Fun, but was a dead end job.”
review.pros: Pros – I built and tested bikes, mopeds and power wheels. Super fun! It was a second job and all my managers except the store manager understood that my other job payed a lot more, and required more responsibility, so they worked with my schedule because they wanted to keep me.
review.cons: Cons – Christmas season was brutal and it was my second job. I worked 20 hour days regularly between the two jobs. The store manager was rude, but the other managers were down to earth and easy to get along with.

review.title: “Good zombie work”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible schedule, and a paycheck.
review.cons: Cons – Hounded for selling credit cards and warranties as if you were paid through commission.Inept managementAwful training (promises of knowing everything, pingeon hold into one department)Pay for full-time employees is definately not worth the added stress.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Reevaluate pay for full-time associates, make them want to put in that extra drive to better the company.Do away with "succession plan" based promotions, it's a load of crap.

review.title: “Messy”
review.pros: Pros – Getting the job wasnt hard.
review.cons: Cons – Communication between the managers and employees is minimal and very disorganized with lunch and breaks
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Okay”
review.pros: Pros – Team work, easy quotas, fair management, respectful, easy to work with sales associates and management, felt fair overall really, time request granted
review.cons: Cons – Pay was the worst, not organized, some parts were a let down, hardly any training, no preperation for busy times
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You should get things in order and be ready for times such as Christmas season. Get it together, and not all of us can afford to work 4 hours at minimum wage... I'll take myself elsewhere

review.title: “Oh, by the way...”
review.pros: Pros – It was a decent pay and 65% of the managers/supervisors treated me ok. There was a discount: 10%--ooh, watch out.Babies and little kids that talk to you in the checkout line are cute!Working around babies, toys, kids and electronics.If there are any, using walkie talkies!
review.cons: Cons – It was a little out of the way, like a 15/20 drive. So 3 hour work shift weren't really worth it in between classes.On the last day (Christmas Eve) one of the managers said, [literally] "By the way, [for those of you that didn't know] this was your last day of work." Oh, thanks. Wish I had known that.The computer prompts for batteries, credit cards and special donations. When a person wants to make a donation I have to go back 3 screens to get to it. Doesn't make sense.Lousy discount for seasonal.Notice about the 8,000 things that goes on sale every week would be nice, you literally don't find out until you walk in the door/get to your station or a customer brings you a coupon.Customers & coupons: 'nuff said.Restock and recovery. Especially when people are in the store.Walkie talkies: 40 people, 15 walkies (if that) you do the math.Not enough people working at some times.Upselling so much stuff
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop pushing the batteries and Credit cards, if people want them they will buy them.Who is the genius that put the "Toys for Toys" button *BEFORE* the prompt is sent out?

review.title: “Fast paced and fun, but management structure unstable”
review.pros: Pros – It is a fun place to work especially if you like to be around children. The work isn't difficult, you just have to have patience and be able to work with aggravated and unruly parents at time.
review.cons: Cons – During off-season, business drops so low that there are hardly any hours to pass around. If you were on for seasonal, there's little chance that they will have need for you after wards. The way they lay off seasonal is very unprofessional and they give you no heads up. Seasonal was supposed to end January 15, but once we clocked out on Christmas Eve, they told us that was our last day. Felt bad for people who really needed the job.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't treat employees like cattle; even if they are seasonal. I was there for a bit, but I was a better employee than most of their regular employees. We put in many long and hard hours and deserve to at least be treated with respect. A week notice would have been better than clocking out and then being told that was it. Hire better managers who know what they are doing.

review.title: “It was alright.”
review.pros: Pros – 10% off is alright. Sort of a flexible schedule. You will know/ come to learn about the "it" toy. You can make friends with co- workers.
review.cons: Cons – Costumers/Management assuming they are know-it-alls/ above you. The Holiday season.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat part time/ full time Associate with respect.

review.title: “Very unorganized, Hard work is not rewarded.”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible scheduling, you let them know when you can and can't work and they will only schedule according to your availability. Affordable health benefits, even for part-timers, paid vacation, and accrued time off. Excited new parents and discount on cute clothes if you have little ones in your life. also discount at Toys-R-us.
review.cons: Cons – The pay is a joke. I was started at $7.90/hr with 2 years retail experience, an adult working to support a family, making what I made as a grocery cashier in high school. There were never enough available hours per week, I went from getting 30 hours/wk the first month, to under 20 hours per week when I finally left 1 year later. There was no training and no matter how hard I worked or how much praise i received from supervisors I was never moved to a full time position despite many request and inquiries. Employee satisfaction surveys and focus groups were a joke, because nothing ever changed, and we were never supplied with the tools or knowledge we needed to do the best job. Customers looked to us to be experts on the products we were selling but we were never given the time or information to learn about many of the products.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Train your employees! There were so many terms, policies and programs talked about in the morning huddles (idea stolen from Target, that was not used as effectively as Target), that I had absolutely no idea what they were and were never explained. Everything I learned how to do I learned by trial and error, even using the cash register. And show your good employees some appreciation, I saw many great employees walk out because they weren't treated as such.

review.title: “Positive Experience”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible work schedule and strong ability to promote.
review.cons: Cons – Management does not encourage innovation. Seasonal employment is high.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – None.

review.title: “Hostile and mean spirited”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunity to meet some nice co-workers
review.cons: Cons – To list the downsides of working for this company I would need sev eral sheets of paper
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Dont hire people with no lifes or work experience. Hiring someone that is 20 years old is ridiculous

review.title: “fun place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – You get to play with toys pretty much all day. In fact, you're required to. It's called 'demoing'.Unlike grocery stores such as Wal-Mart and Safeway, where people have to be there to get their weekly shopping, most people are shopping at Toys R Us for fun.The people you work with are usually friendly and management, supervisors and long-serving associates are pretty good at helping newbies learn the ropes.Working in a toy store genuinely is as fun as it sounds.
review.cons: Cons – Hearing 'Elmo's Song' constantly repeated all day long.People messing up displays and shelves so that nothing's where it's supposed to be.Other associates can often be 'cliquey', which can make a person feel somewhat left out.Management can be lax sometimes.Having to try to force people to buy batteries and buyer protection plans for everything.Pay could stand to be better, but it's not terrible.Too many Zhu Zhu Pets.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Big box retailers like Target and Wal-Mart are undercutting us quite badly. I'm tired of hearing people say 'Well, this is great, but we can get it cheaper at Wal-Mart'. If they can charge discount prices for toys, so can we.

review.title: “Fun at first, then it becomes a drag.”
review.pros: Pros – Some friendly peopleOne nice managerElectronics is the easiest jobOther then this there is nothing special about toysrus
review.cons: Cons – Managers ignore your help requestsManagers don't pay attention to your breaksMad when you ask for breakUpset when you call in sick
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – actually help employees when they ask for help, don't just stand up at the service desk and talk to other managers, also make sure you actually give employees their breaks.

review.title: “16 year old level job..”
review.pros: Pros – You get to look at cute babies all day.
review.cons: Cons – They messed up my pay I never once got the hourly pay I was promised, I finally called the lead of HR and got a check for the money all my pay checks were missing. This took weeks! No one talked to me about how I was doing or what I should do. A lot of drama between coworkers, try and stay out of it as much as you can but someone will try and suck you into it. You have to stay later than your shift hours to clean up the Toys R Us side after everyone is gone since that side is such a mess. You have to push credit cards, batteries etc. VERY FEW people actually buy either. Great job for a first high school level job but nothing you will want to stay with.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Better pay, talk to employees, keep your words about pay etc, try and make the drama less!

review.title: “A little bit”
review.pros: Pros – It is an amazing company with interactions with many different customers, also we respect all of our customers a lot.
review.cons: Cons – There are a lot of people that are not trained properly and this leads to a lot of problems with shopping.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There is a need for there to be an increased level of training for all of the sales staff as it leads to chaos.

review.title: “Unappreciated”
review.pros: Pros – -some coworkers are nice and funny-10% discount on all items except gaming systemssorry these are all the pros
review.cons: Cons – -every co worker put on this extremely fake attitude, you can tell they didn't really appreciate you working there-a thankless job-they keep beating around the bush, they will never tell you what is wrong directly to your face-lies,lies, and more lies,you don't know if what you are doing is the correct way to do it, and they will never tell you it is wrong until you are fired-they treat the new workers like aliens-i never received a proper name tag, i guess its because i was not going to be kept past the seasonal session, to bad they couldn't just freaking tell me, instead they make me work like a slave until the bitter end.bottom line screw toys r us, i hope you go out of business.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please actually give a crap about who you hire, and give them criticism directly to their face, don't talk behind their back.

review.title: “It's retail...”
review.pros: Pros – You're surrounded by toys.Discounts if you need them.Hours are pretty flexible.Hard work will be met with recognition.
review.cons: Cons – Some of the girls you work with that have been there a while before you tend to have attitudes and look and talk down to you. They are still in or barely out of high school, and like to be bossy, but when it comes to doing something when it's busy, they whine and tell you to do it. It's a toy store, not Trump Tower. Lighten up and be a little friendlier to new people. If you're that miserable or think you're so much better than everyone, find a new job. Another thing- you're at work, so stop with the texting.Some of them are not very knowledgeable about products.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The last thing a customer wants to hear are offers for 5 different things when all they're trying to do is purchase their items and leave quickly. About 90% of them decline batteries, BPPs and Instant Credit plans.Give some of these girls some friendliness lessons

review.title: “Run Away”
review.pros: Pros – Lots of good associates that have been brain washed to stay with a company that treats them bad. The pay is good in retail but no bonus?
review.cons: Cons – They will use and abuse you till you think it is over then do it some more. As a manager don't expect any time off, six days a week, even sevens, are the norm and you never get that time back. If you like treating employees bad this is the place to be, the thought is they work better if they think they will be fired.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat the associates as if they are customers. It is hard to work for a company that will do anything to make a guest happy, but will do nothing for the people that work hard to take care of the guests.

review.title: “Good”
review.pros: Pros – easy opportunities, good employees, good pay, fast advancement, good training, steady check, steady hours, fun work environment, a a a
review.cons: Cons – mandatory work on christmas eve, and black friday, rude customers.. just like any other job.... slightly odd interview process. a
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – overall great company to work for, i truly have no real complaints.. besides the holiday work.. which they make it mandatory so its fair upon everyone, so thats understandable.

review.title: “Market the toys for boys”
review.pros: Pros – Great work schedule and fun job.
review.cons: Cons – Do not offer tuition reimburcement.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Acknowledge bottom talent

review.title: “The honest truth about BRU.”
review.pros: Pros – -You are helping people through a major life change, a new baby.-Semi-flexible scheduling.-Store management is approachable.-Earned time off; vacation pay (after a year) and sick pay.
review.cons: Cons – -Late hours of operation/nights/weekends-Lack of feedback and focus.-Redundant policy changes that do more harm than good.-Amount of pay does not equal the amount of work.-Open all year except Christmas and Thanksgiving.-Too many conference calls, with not a lot of information or new information.-No bonuses unless store manager.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – -Pay your employees a living wage. They work hard and take a lot from the guests, each and every day.-Employee morale is decreased, because the policy changes to make us "one company", made every BRU employee job a lot harder.-Reward the associates monetarily, for getting the instant credits and reward card sign ups.-Be consistent. If policies are made to be a blanket that includes corporate as well as store level, then the store teams should be allowed paid holidays with their families as well.-Focus on the succession planning.

review.title: “Backbone is needed to work here”
review.pros: Pros – If you are looking for a job that will give you plenty of hours this is it.Part time earn time off and vacation days and sick days.Management does have an open door polices.
review.cons: Cons – When it comes to following the policies management does not always have your back.There is plenty of drama in this particular store.They are not flexible with your availablitly.Management does not understand part time is partly here not full time.Treating people unfairly is a huge problem here.Many of the employees do have bad attitudes.Management do use obscene language towards there employees such as (stupid, slow, worthless and etc.)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – My advice to managment is stop disrespecting employees.

review.title: “intern at wayne nj 10”
review.pros: Pros – it was a nice place to work i would work there full time if given the opportunity. there are s
review.cons: Cons – I do not like the location of the headquarters for a yuppie wayne nj is not a favorite place for one to live
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I would work on a mentor program so that interns can have more of a opportunity to grow with in the firm

review.title: “Typical Retail Job”
review.pros: Pros – A fine place to work as a high school or college student who is just looking to make a buck.
review.cons: Cons – You are a cog in the machine. Fairly inflexible about hours.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Not every employee is the same. Treat them accordingly

review.title: “starting seasonal pay 2010”
review.pros: Pros – they are hiring now for the 2010 holiday season!
review.cons: Cons – dealing with people, low pay.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – pay more and reward those who deserve it!

review.title: “Not Worth It!”
review.pros: Pros – If you enjoy seeing kids smile, that part of the job could be okay. There's also a 10% discount which, though not much, it helps with the TRU exclusives.
review.cons: Cons – HORRIBLE MANAGEMENT. At the one i worked at, the manager was completely inconsiderate and not at ALL compassionate towards his employees. Everyone is easily replaced & he treated us all as if we were simply numbers to him... Which is all you are.THERE IS NO TRAINING - at least not for seasonal help. I came in on my first shift ever, and was thrown onto the customer service register, meaning I was also responsible for answering the store phone & dealing with grumpy customers - on, and i repeat, MY FIRST DAY.THE REGISTERS AND OTHER EQUIPMENT ARE TOTAL GARBAGE. There is both a touch-screen monitor and a keyboard on the registers, and it was sheer luck as to which one would be working at any given time. Whenever I needed to type something out on the keyboard and my keyboard wasn't working, I had to send the customer to a different register, which is annoying & tedious, and half the time, they told me not to bother. Also, the hand-held item scanning device was continually not working & then we would have to unplug it & reset it. This happened at least 7 times per 6 hour shift.THE METRICS ARE RIDICULOUS. You have to ask EVERY customer that comes through about a credit card, batteries, a buyer protection plan, a loyalty program, AND a donation to charity. Even when the customer's purchase is toys that don't require batteries, you still have to ask them. A woman came through my lane to buy a package of m&m's. Obviously, she's not interested in batteries, right? WRONG. According to the management, batteries are essential to candy consumption, as well as anything else you may buy in the store. Same deal on the credit card. Yeah, you get 10% off on your purchase if you sign up for the credit card.... but if you're only buying one or two things, do you really care? What with all the paperwork needing to be filled out for the card, I'd assume not.ALL IN ALL -- work here if you're desperate -- there's no other reason to.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get off your high horse and realize that your lowest level employees are people too -- they're teh ones taht keep your store running, aren't they?

review.title: “Great starter place”
review.pros: Pros – When you apply you will get a call within a week if you got the green light. Fun place, great experiance.
review.cons: Cons – Lots of push for add on sales and credit card sign-ups. Numbers are a huge part of what you shoot.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Customer service is more important than getting your customers to sign up for a credit card or the birthday club. Let your associates get to know the customers and help them sincely and they will keep coming back.

review.title: “cashier duties; might require sales associate duties”
review.pros: Pros – -It's a nice starter job to make extra cash-Being a cashier makes time go by pretty fast, especially during busy times (such as christmas)
review.cons: Cons – -Not enough work hours-I was hired as a cashier but was placed all over the place other than my department as if I were a sales associate (which is not what I applied for).-Managers play "favorites" when it comes to the work schedule sometimes
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Offer more hours to your employees and be fair with the hours that are given out. One person shouldn't be scheduled 2 days out the week while another is scheduled almost everyday. Some of us do have bills to pay so be considerate of that

review.title: “nice place”
review.pros: Pros – fun, fast paced place to work, love the families, kids, moms and new dads that would come thru, i do not have a bad word to say.
review.cons: Cons – working evenings and sats and sundays, are not the best, wold rather have worked during the day thru the week.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – give the younger people that work there more of a chance, they also have good ideas, and thoughts, and should not be shut down.

review.title: “Toys "R" Us ... an Okay Company.”
review.pros: Pros – While many of their employees don't have college degrees, you'll find that Toys R Us appreciates individuals with an education. That being said, if you have a degree it is very easy to be promoted. The work does not provide much of a challenge and is often mundane and boring.
review.cons: Cons – This organization is completely disorganized. They don't manage there employees correctly. You'll find most of your fellow employees are uneducated and ill equipped to do the job at hand. The offices are not maintained properly and left me with the impression that the company was sloppy with it's day to day business.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Formulate your goals and set effective priorities to achieve said, goals. Make sure all employees are aware of your expectations and enforce those expectations so as not to encourage a corporate culture of chaos.

review.title: “El Cheapo”
review.pros: Pros – A few nice associates that are helpful
review.cons: Cons – Discount is terrible. What is 10% off of a toy for $40 when Target, and Walmart carry the same item for $25?Not consistant in providing information to associates. If a special sale is going on, you shouldn't just provide that to a few associates in the morning meeting, but have a second and third shift meeting to keep everyone on the same page. Of provide and fyi sheet at the start of each shift.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Increase the employee discount since the prices are so high. Keep the money in the store, stop sending it to your competitors.

review.title: “This is the bottom of the barrel”
review.pros: Pros – Easy hiring process, affable co workers. Fun products
review.cons: Cons – Too much emphasis on toys r us rewards and credit card goals that NO ONE wants to buy; forced to offer batteries even for non electric toys AND the batteries are famously and grossly over priced. Lees than 11 hours most week, spread over three days?!?
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get a better awareness that at 8 dollars an hour, its not worth even keeping a job like that with the costs of gas, etc.

review.title: “Great place to start”
review.pros: Pros – Large retailerWell know brandScenic campus at headquarters makes it a great place to go to everydayClear vision from senior management. Doesn't change year to yearCross functional moves are encouraged
review.cons: Cons – Always working on short term goals. Long term goals aren't communicated clearly.A lot of the large company meetings sounds like a pep rally.-- nothing specific and actionableOnce you're on board, salary is impossible to negotiate even if role or responsibilities may changeTurnaround from the brink of bankruptcy means every penny is counted. Twice.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Re-evaluate compensation. That seems to be most people's complaint.

review.title: “Tru management”
review.pros: Pros – Pay seems to be a little above the average for managers that have been with the company for a long time.
review.cons: Cons – The demands of the Christmas season is not counter balanced by an easier out of season work schedule. The payroll hours allowed does not reflect the workload placed on the hourly staff.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Realize the workload and allow the tasks to be done correctly by giving enough payroll to complete the tasks.

review.title: “Overall fairly tedious”
review.pros: Pros – Huge number of products to get involved with and work with those you like the most in addition to benefits which are not exactly generous but definitely fair
review.cons: Cons – job cycles with the retail economic and buying cycles so you don't always have control over when times are going to be overly busy or slow
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Focus

review.title: “Supportive Team Environment”
review.pros: Pros – Good onboarding, supportive of family issues. Your work is centered around kids and play. Management responsive to staff
review.cons: Cons – Working with the public,especially around holidays. Long hours for retail, if someone fails to show for a shift, your break might be delayed or you may have to work late.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – doing a great job!

review.title: “Cash office clerk”
review.pros: Pros – Very flexible with schedule if you have committments, you are able to apply for benefits upon hire even if you're a part time employee, managment really attentive and wants you to learn position, easily accessible through public transportation.
review.cons: Cons – The rate of pay if horrible only eight dollars even when you have years of experience, they also have difficulty fitting training hours into there regular work week so this you'll only work about four hours a day and not everyday until you learn the job
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Employees very knowledegable

review.title: “A great place to work!”
review.pros: Pros – Lots of opportunity to work on interesting projects. Great environment; very little politicking and backstabbing compared to other places. Highly recommend.
review.cons: Cons – Difficult to get promoted, due to the fact that they are still rebuilding. Don't really reward their top performers, making it difficult to hold onto talent.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Recognize who your performers are. Praise them and REWARD them if you want them to stick around. I've seen some talented folks come and go.

review.title: “Decent Place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Had a mostly great management staff, goals were clear cut, customers were mostly more easy to please then in other retail establishments
review.cons: Cons – low pay, disagree with Buyer Protection Plan on some products but still needed to push it anyway, not enough full time opportunities
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I don't have any advice. However, I also worked for Toys R Us and that brand in my experience needed some help.

review.title: “Better from the outside”
review.pros: Pros – Summer hours on Fridays during the summer
review.cons: Cons – Management doesn't relay messages back to their subordinates only to superiors which is counterproductive.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop talking behind peoples back and just be direct

review.title: “Decent pay, good hours”
review.pros: Pros – Good people, lots of friends to be made. The management is competent and generally fair. Good work conditions overall, and easy work.
review.cons: Cons – Not great pay obviously, not great benefits. Sometimes customer complaints can put an employee in a horrible position.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work, more pay would be nice.

review.title: “Store Manager”
review.pros: Pros – Overall Toysrus was a good company to work for most of the year. Upper management was fair in their assessment and promotion opportunities with only a few unrealistic expectations. Good balance of work and personal life most of the year.
review.cons: Cons – From October to January you will live in your store. 6 to 7 days a week 12 hours or more a day this can be a hard time for a family man.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I have been gone for over a year and I see a disturbing direction (or lack of) in your stores. You are the best place to get toys but to keep this title you must be in stock, priced right on the shelf and teach your new managers to apologize when their store looks like crap not make excuses and lies.

review.title: “Supervisor Must Always Set A Good Example..............”
review.pros: Pros – Great Customers..............No Major Sales Goals...........Easy To "MOVE UP" With Company..............
review.cons: Cons – Discount is only 10%..............(and employees can't use discount coupons)Supervisors Dont Always Care.......................Base Pay Could Be Higher............
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Spend more time training the employees,

review.title: “Toys R Us Seasonal Worker”
review.pros: Pros – The job was pretty easy; cashier work, stocking and assisting customers. Not too bad, pay was just above minimum wage.
review.cons: Cons – Some nights we didnt leave until 1 am
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – None

review.title: “I would never go back”
review.pros: Pros – Helping new moms or soon to be moms with seminars, classes, and registering
review.cons: Cons – Management (district level) is ridiculous. they expect SO much with very FEW hours given for payroll. Many cliques where I worked, including upper management. A lot of favortism went on, and almost all employees were Very unhappy there. High turnover rate, and comstantly changing thier minds about the rules, and how things are ran.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do not favor people, or talk down to them.

review.title: “really unfair”
review.pros: Pros – uuuuhh... flexible hours and acceses to product knowledge
review.cons: Cons – everythingelse!!! managers are incompetent, rude dm, loss prevention guy is very disrecpetful. SOP changes all the time. We dont get used to the new ones when they are already changing them again!! they assign you a position and then make you delegate it to someonelse so you can do someonelses job.. MAKES NO SENSE!!!!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – listen to your employees. When there is a conflict and we confide it to a certain manager PLEASE!! dont get the whole store involved...

review.title: “Great first company for me.”
review.pros: Pros – Pretty relaxed corporate culture. Hours sure beat banks, accounting and consulting companies. Summer Hours. Instantly recognizable name on your resume gives you a "stamp of approval". for your resume. Beautiful Corporate Office. Gym on premises.
review.cons: Cons – Not many perks. Work can get monotonous. No clearly defined career path. No bonus until manager level. Comp lags behind, finance, accounting, and consulting industries.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to lower costs and waste to better compete with Walmart and Target. Create as many synergies as possible between Babies"R"Us and Toys"R"US, particularly in the back office.

review.title: “ehh”
review.pros: Pros – Fun place to workExciting environmentFun for the Summer or Holiday10% discount on any of their products or at any R Us locationInteresting people to work withInteresting customers
review.cons: Cons – Barely any advancement opportunitiesYou are only a number at this employerPoor pay and benefits are terribleTreated poorly by the customers who are usually angryPolicies are bogusAfter Christmas, after you've worked like crazy and bent over backwards to help the company, you are left with 4 hours, if that to live off of
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Maybe get rid of some of the holiday staff, and keep some quality employees who will do the work and who will feel appreciated even when holiday season is over.

review.title: “It was OK”
review.pros: Pros – They did work with my work schedule, which was nice, since I was still in school at the time that I worked for them.
review.cons: Cons – I felt at eighteen that I was the most intelligent person working here. It's really hard to listen to a manager when you know that there is absolutelu nothing going on up there. I felt like I was surrounded my morons. They were nice people, but morons!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please think before you speak! It's hard to work in a toy store with managers breathing down your neck to check women's diaper bags for stolen goods. I get it! People in this world are messed up, but I am not going to shake down every mom with a bag like she is a common criminal.

review.title: “Great corporate culture without a lot of reward”
review.pros: Pros – 1. Great corporate culture and work life balance2. fun work environment3. Rewarding work, sense of accomplishment4. Compensation on par with other retailers
review.cons: Cons – 1. Archaic reporting tools2. Poor talent/ a lot of incompetent managers3. Mediocrity will get you promoted, top talent undervalued and unappreciated4. Benefits are poor
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Executives are very clear in the direction of the company. The company does not recognize, cultivate, or develop their top talent. Focus on your top performers and develop them into your bench strength.

review.title: “Hired as Cashier, later became a jack of all trades”
review.pros: Pros – My co-workers for the most part were great. most guests could be decent while interacting on a one on one basis. coming in contact with many products in the more traditional toy, as well as the electronic and video game departments. learned and worked in almost every department of the store. some days working several departments at once or on one shift.
review.cons: Cons – middle management could often be a lot of talk with absolutely no guidance or help. not enough help at key times of year. lack of communication from higher ups in the company that allowed employees at our particular store to be told by guests that "we heard this store is closing down soon", long before any of us heard any such thing. our store was falling apart in many regards, but they did close it and move to a different location, one with the new baby's r us combo stores.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – be aware what your middle managers are doing and the rest of your staffs attitudes towards them.

review.title: “Great Job for Student's”
review.pros: Pros – Great workng enviroment.Managers treated you with respect.Decent pay and discount.Working at TRU was an overall enjoyable and rewarding experience.
review.cons: Cons – If you are a "seasonal" employee, don't expect for them to keep you after the holiday season.It can get really slow, especially during slow seasons.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You need to step up you're game! The company is in some financial trouble. Who would spend $40 on something they can get for $15 at Target?!

review.title: “Good Company ran by a vision that appears unreasonable to reality”
review.pros: Pros – Schedule flexibility. Discounts. Vacation. Personal Time Off
review.cons: Cons – Disconnect between corporate and stores. Poor communication which is sometimes generated by quick unrealistic business merchandising requests. Innappropriate language used by DM's during walks and visits. Regional Staff smell like corporate let downs.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Understand your role and you'll survive the tidal waves. Understand the roles of others and you will have the power to become promoted. It's all about keeping your friends close and your enemies/competition closer.Question below states if I approve Deb Derby's leadership of Babies R Us. She did a good job, DID is past tense meaning she's no longer LEADING Babies R Us

review.title: “Employee”
review.pros: Pros – Very laid back place, and co-workers are always chill. It's a large store so expect to be around a lot of people.
review.cons: Cons – There are too much annoying kids, and nagging parents who always want to buy something. That is the only downfall.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I think the management is okay with what they are doing. It is a large cooperation and seeing them expand is good.

review.title: “Fun Place to Work”
review.pros: Pros – Toys R us is a fun place to work if you like kids. The interaction and seeing a kid get the toy that wanted can make your day. The daily duties can be challenging.
review.cons: Cons – The hours can be long through the Christmas season.During Christmas the company looks to management to give up all other activites to pursue the bussiness.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Toys R us is a great place to work and seems to have gotten back on track after several years of floundering.

review.title: “Toys”
review.pros: Pros – HQ building is nice, summer hrs program (must be approved by manager), on-site cafeteria (not subsidized, food is mediocre), on-site gym facilities (not free), on-site dry cleaning (not free).
review.cons: Cons – Really old legacy IT systems and too much bureaucracy between departments to move forward with any relevant improvements. Company's competitors continuously blow toys out the water when it comes to customer satisfaction at the stores and online. There's favoritism to keep promoting some people while others are let go. 401k contributions were reduced due to the economy, raises are a joke.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Communicate with staff, not just with VPs and directors because those people might not always pass down the information to their staff.

review.title: “Better from the outside”
review.pros: Pros – The company seems to be sharp and progressive. It has a beautiful office and good salary and benefits. Quality of work-life balance is good.
review.cons: Cons – New leadership is terrible. Very unapproachable and sometimes down right dishonest in their dealings with associates. The communication from the top is poor and it is obvious they are just there to sell the company and make their money.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Remember that there needs to be a company after the IPO.

review.title: “"Where a cashier can always do better."”
review.pros: Pros – The job isn't tough, and the other employees are fun. The children that come in keep the mood happy.
review.cons: Cons – The way the cashiers are pushed to sell certain things (credit/rewards cards) gets stressful. The salary also could be higher.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Find as much time to praise the employees as they do when reprimanding them.

review.title: “Meh”
review.pros: Pros – Be around Toys. The kid in me likes that I guess.
review.cons: Cons – Hours are terrible.If you don't trick someone into opening up a scam Credit card, they severely cut your hours.They Tell (not ask) You to come in on days off.They do not train you at allRaises are nonexistentNo registers are even used. They only open Rzone register and Customer Service. So, while I am trying to help people with video games, I also have a huge line of people waiting to check out. Talk about stress for a crappy pay. I have to set the plano and everything and I have not seen one raise. They are never positive. No matter how hard you work, they point out what is wrong.Customer Service is a joke. You CAN NOT have Customer Service and 4 people working the whole store. You yell at us for doing bad at GSAT (Surveys) When it is not our fault we are so limited.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Either hire more people so we can have customer service or lay off of the 4 people working.Open up real registersLeave your office once in awhilePretend to careHuddles and team meeting would be nice.Tell someone when they do good.A raise would be nice.

review.title: “Great job!”
review.pros: Pros – I'd love to work here again if i could, absolutely pleasent. Wouldn't ask for better people to work with again.
review.cons: Cons – It's not the best job in the world to be honest but i do like the fact that it's an ok place to work.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be nicer to your management they are nice people and deserve his things which are nice. I believe in the cause.

review.title: “Great Place To Work”
review.pros: Pros – Great Management, hard working co-workers and supervisors, everyone pulls there own weight, keeps you on your toes and always focused
review.cons: Cons – Pay is minimum wage which is very little for the amount of work and stress we deak with sometimes
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Advise the employees that take advantage of having a job and remind them that it can easily be taken away.

review.title: “Decent Company to Work For”
review.pros: Pros – Pretty decent pay compared to other companies I've worked for, but it also depends on what position you fill. Most other employees are fun to work with. It's a pretty fun atmosphere all-around.
review.cons: Cons – Management is biased when it comes to promotions and advancements, some of the management is very "stuck up," they are very particular about certain procedures--borderline anal.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Actually pay attention to the people who are trying their best and just not making their goals, don't just reward the "suck-ups" who are only doing it for the recognition.

review.title: “fun work environment”
review.pros: Pros – people that work there are really nice and fun work environment, learn alot for a first job.
review.cons: Cons – do not give you alot of hours if you don't have more than 5 hours abailable in a day, you have to keep track of how many customers you have talked to every hour, how many batteries you have sold and how many birthday clubs you get.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – ...

review.title: “Headline”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible scheduling for college students or those with 2nd jobs.
review.cons: Cons – Dead end job. Very poor raises ---> received .50 raise in 2 years. Lack of guidance from managers/supervisors.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Work on giving employees better raises and recognition for a job well done.

review.title: “Drastically changed. No longer an upbeat place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – Very flexible schedule.Not difficult
review.cons: Cons – Incompetent management.Unfairness of pay.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Learn more.On occasion put yourself in associate's shoes.Don't pay someone who has worked there for 4 years the same as a seasonal person.

review.title: “Toys "R" Us”
review.pros: Pros – There is really no good reason to work here. It is horrible the people are stupid and it no a good working environment.
review.cons: Cons – This job is only a job for people who like to be yelled at and hate their life. Yes really
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The management is ok just they dont work themselves they make all the others work while they just sit their doing nothing

review.title: “Good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – They have a very flexible schedule, the people are extremely friendly and it's really laid back. I had a lot of fun working there, and wish that it was more than temporary.
review.cons: Cons – There really isn't a whole lot to complain about. Some of the managers were a little too laid back at times, but they picked up the pace when need be.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There isn't really a lot of advice I can give. I really enjoyed working there and hope I can work there again someday.

review.title: “Not too good, not too bad.”
review.pros: Pros – I worked as an associate for one year at Toys "R" Us in the strategy and operations groups. I tremendously enjoyed the work at the organization and my boss was extremely supportive of innovation.
review.cons: Cons – Working in Wayne was difficult commute, especially coming in from New York City. Management refused to deploy a shuttle, though I've heard that they were researching its feasibility.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There needs to be greater interaction between the different groups within the organization, (especially a greater need for inter-brand collaboration).

review.title: “Not a fun place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – Good pay, you actually get time off when you ask for it
review.cons: Cons – Screaming children, grouchy pregnant women trying to return personal items, have to be able to lift strollers mattresses and car seats over your head, management terrible at giving praise, but good at giving negative criticism.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Tell your employees when they do a good job not just when they don't. Also I know the application says you have to be able to lift 40 lbs, but there's a difference between being able to pick up a 40 lb object and having to take a 40lb object from over your head to the floor while on a ladder. You should mention that on the application.

review.title: “Don't do it!!”
review.pros: Pros – Babies are cute, most associates are easy to get along with. The job can sometimes be really fun. Easy work for most people.
review.cons: Cons – management is incompetent, crazy people shop there. Raises are a joke. Associates don't get enough hours. The best people get treated the worst.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Quit changing everything so often. Can't even finish a project before someone changes it all. More communication. The auto scheduler is lousy, employees who have been there for years get less hours than new people and I don't buy it when you say it's because of their availability.

review.title: “not bad pay, can be fun depending on manager”
review.pros: Pros – awesome coworkers on my partpretty decent pay usally around 8 or abovegood managers make work fun
review.cons: Cons – bad communication with associates and managers at timesasking for time off has to be 2 weeks in advance!random schduling and horrid hours after christmaslaaarge focus on selling toysrus credit cards
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – worry about about customers and less about instant credits, no one wants a credit card!

review.title: “Impossible to Advance”
review.pros: Pros – You work with toys, the work is not mentally challenging.
review.cons: Cons – Everything else. Poor pay, poor management, poor accountability. No opportunities to advance. They treat their lowest associates poorly, and as such these associates rarely stay later than they have to, and subsequently their leftover work falls on the backs of those who actually care about their job. I'll give you a hint, the backs being strained aren't a part of management.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I should have been promoted long ago. I make MUCH less than the people I am supposed to manage.

review.title: “Work with the customers (guests) to find their merchandise and pay for it.”
review.pros: Pros – Fun clientele to work with, pregnant women and new parents. You have access to the latest merchandise in stock for babies and families.
review.cons: Cons – Very hard to work up in the company. Managers are often incapable and unqualified. Very micro-managed which stifles any human aspect to the job.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It would be advised that you take the time to listen to your employees and focus on the big picture instead of tiny details.

review.title: “Not fun place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – Able to meet nice people and see happiness in kids faces when they find that special toy. Fun place for kids.Thats it!
review.cons: Cons – Not fair place to work. Not all people are treated fairly.Upper management does not keep in touch of the climate of the stores. Don' t address problems until their boss is about to visit.Thier main focus is to sign people up for credit cards, warranties. Helps pad bottom line for management bonuses. Lost focus of authentic customer service and selling actual products.Un-ethical people allowed to work in management. Some employees bad mouthed behind their backs. Confidential information shared around stores by management.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire ethical people to run your stores.Too manay managers curse, don't work, leave early, bad mouth their employees and don't care about their jobs. Only when you (their boss) come in for a visit, then they work us to death to impress you, when stores look like crap day in and day out before you arive and after you leave. They are running the company in the ground. One day you will wake up.

review.title: “Where do you begin???”
review.pros: Pros – Dealing with fun retail categories. New store formats are pleasant to shop and have potential. The last toy store standing.Serving some of the TRU loyal customers. Finding their niche product they couldn't get at Target.Interacting with the kids.
review.cons: Cons – TRU drives its' bottom line on sales of worthless paper...credit card bounty from credit card companies, buyer protection insurance add-ons. Sacrifices service and holds transactions of these items as a golden carrot to entire store.You are required to query numerous batches of data to report sales metrics. Scrolling through electronic journals to find correct information. Very redundant and a waste of stores' time. You spend more time manipulating metrics than being a merchant and working with customers and store's team.Pay rates for hourly associates are low and very few full timers within their staffing plan. To the point where you rely on many hourly associates that can't pass a drug screen elsewhere, or were terminated from another big box.Recently rolled out additional cuts to staffing structure. Very similar in nature to Circuit City 2007, eliminating some of the best producers in the stores.Very little incentive to be a long term hourly associate at TRU. Very few full time positions, very small yearly raises, no incentive bonuses, no incentives for driving sales of their BPP and instant credits....Except for perhaps getting a few more hours a week than a non-performer.Tools you work with, outdated store systems, scheduling, none work with each other. Store schedules for all associates are budgeted extremely bare bones and corporate continues to find ways to decrease budgeted hours. Must spend hours updating worthless information on when running weekly schedules. Very outdated system.Register systems extremely dated. Not at all user friendly.Excessive gimmick driven ads that are never backed by having correct inventory levels. Constantly out of product immediately when ad would break.They will not put any money into existing stores as they have a dream to once again be listed publicly after multiple bankruptcies. Also trying to roll out a new combo store format and letting old stores die.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat this company like a real retailer again. Stop with driving worthless paper at your customers. Have fun with your stores. You are the last one standing. Wal-Mart and Target both cutting down selection in toys.

review.title: “I don't recommend anyone working here unless your in high school and don't have to worry about bills”
review.pros: Pros – Pocket changethere's no greater joy than helping a kid find a toy he or she is looking for
review.cons: Cons – hard laborlow payrandom work schedules
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – work there for 5 years+.....

review.title: “It was good for the most part.”
review.pros: Pros – If at any moment you needed help (whether as a cashier or dealing with a customer), the supervisors were very willing to do so.
review.cons: Cons – The only thing I have any sort of complaint about is the way the head manager speaks to people, but he was rarely seen anyways. Other than that, I had a great experience.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I think they are working just fine. I do not believe they need any advice. Customers will always complain about little things, but other than that I find that no customer or employee really has anything to complain about.

review.title: “Toys R Us Experience”
review.pros: Pros – It can be a fun place to work, it allows the opportunity to interact with all types of people, the management is on your level and will do the same type of work that you do.
review.cons: Cons – During season the long hours, the late nights and ridiculous times you stay until, the lack of training that takes place when you start. Some people can be really rude.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – They do an ok job with selecting management, they dont always listen to associates interested in advancement in the company and could do a better job of that.

review.title: “It's what you make of it.”
review.pros: Pros – The pay and respect are about on par with the rest of the industry -- after all, it's retail. Depending on how well you perform your job, there can be quite a few opportunities for cross training in different departments.
review.cons: Cons – Not every store manager is helpful in doing your job. Depending on your store, politics may play a gigantic influence on who gets pay raises.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – District Managers need to engage ALL store associates more frequently, to take a pulse on how effective store leadership actually is. Ineffective store leadership = low morale = low sales.

review.title: “horrible place to work, you will be treated like a slave”
review.pros: Pros – at first it was a nice place to work at. i got job experience. and made a few good friends.
review.cons: Cons – At first it was a great job but after a while i realized only the seasonal people were working. the people that had been there before was able to talk on the phone and tell everyone else what to do. if you were new you werent allowed to talk to anyone, and you were treated like slaves. its a very disrespectful work place.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat every employee equally. Make sure everyone is working not just the new employees. also do a few unexpected drop in to see how things lare going.

review.title: “BRU satisfied employee”
review.pros: Pros – Babies R Us is very flexible with your work schedule, around school, or just when you want to ask off. I've never had a request off denied.
review.cons: Cons – The pay seems to be less than for other retail jobs.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work.

review.title: “terrible”
review.pros: Pros – If you can't find a job anywhere else work at toys. You can hold games and such as an employee. Not much else to say.
review.cons: Cons – Managers are condescending and disrespectful. You will be offered no praise for doing good work but a slight mistake is made and they will crucify you for it. Terrible raises. Horrible organization among the upper management. YOur value as an employee depends on how much of the metrics (buyer protection plans, rewards, batteries) you can push on the customer. Hours are ridiculous especially if you are a college student. (store will close at 12 am..lol a toy store., and you wont get out until 2:30 am sometimes)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't be condescending towards employees because they will have no morale to do a good job, especially when you never commend anyone on doing anything good, but are so quick to react when someone messes up. if your a bad manager do yourself and everyone a favor and just quit. your going to bury yourself.

review.title: “It is very hectic at seasonal months.”
review.pros: Pros – To see the joy on childrens faces when they get the toy they want, especially after seeing so many toys all around.
review.cons: Cons – When you are not in season, there are less hours and the job is even more demanding, I was putting in at least 60 hours a week on salary. I would say it was below minimum wage.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Work with those who are willing to grow with the company and help them. The wrong communication sometimes goes out to the wrong people.

review.title: “It's a paycheck out of college”
review.pros: Pros – starting job out of college, they give you are starting stone to get your career going right out of college
review.cons: Cons – salaried manager position is excuse to work 70 hour week. No discount on toys.working out of control during christmas
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – get back to the roots of being a warehouse of toys. Don't try and beat Wal-mart on price. Beat them on selection of toys

review.title: “Its not the greatest place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – Offer competitive starting wage. Friendly and helpful co-workers. Fun work atmosphere. Helpful department supervisors. Good for part-time or seasonal work.
review.cons: Cons – Don't expect store managers or assistant managers to care much about you. They preach open door policies and talk about their desire to work with you, but when it comes time to act, they fall short. Managers and supervisors play favorites with certain employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Start practicing what you preach. Actually listen to your employees (and no, going over the results of the internal survey and saying that the results were skewed, then patting yourself on the back doesn't count). Stop changing the way everything is done without feedback from actual employees.

review.title: “Toys R Us”
review.pros: Pros – Overall a pleasant work environment.Generally a 9 to 5:30 work dayWork life balance is generally goodSenior Leaders do give regualr business updates.
review.cons: Cons – IT systems are antiquated, which makes getting data difficult or very time consuming. More time is spent gathering/querying data than actual analysis.The size of the organization makes it difficult to implement change; or get compliance by other groups.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Invest in better IT systems, or you won't attract top tier talent!

review.title: “Easy”
review.pros: Pros – There is great flexibility in scheduling. The employee discount can come in handy. Most of the people are pretty friendly.
review.cons: Cons – You are "urged" to meet additional sales goals each day. The amount of hours tends to decline drastically in the summer.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try promoting more people in the stores instead of hiring in from outside the company. You will keep employees morale higher that way.

review.title: “Good but long hours”
review.pros: Pros – Decent pay but really long hours during the holdays. Nice people to work with. Like a family. All in all not too bad.
review.cons: Cons – Long hours. Usually work on weekends. Dealing with the public is always challenging especially during the holidays. The holiday schedules can be a killer
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Offer more hours in the off season to maintain the store. Beef up benefits. Provide more career advancement outside the store.

review.title: “Internship”
review.pros: Pros – The people are great and so it the flexibility the managers give you. Also, the toy discount is a great perk!
review.cons: Cons – A little on the un-organized side. The company is in growth mode now, but that also means that roles change alot. My manager changed roles with in the summer so I was confused through out the latter months,
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay more and give better competitive benefits to full-time employees. They would always complain about it and say that they were under payed. Also give tuition reimbursement.

review.title: “overnight”
