review.pros: Pros – nice sales, good people, vey fast paced store, lots of selection from baby to teen and also clothing items
review.cons: Cons – long hours, holiday hours till 3 am, crazy on black friday, junior high school kids working most of the time and cannot work the extended hours, so there is not a lrage staff
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – promotion rom within goes a long way toward the stability of the stores. Yur most "educated" people are the ones that deal with product day in and day out, not the college cheerleaders.

review.title: “Needs unity of management.”
review.pros: Pros – Very simple job in the retail world. If kept busy the work day goes be fairly quickly. Certain customers always appreciate help and you can make children very happy.
review.cons: Cons – Management of current store has been there entirely too long. Not willing to change their ways to new policies of the company. It's a shame that people have worked for the company over 20 years and are not able to run a register.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – District Management needs to be more consistent with what they say. Doesn't show that what they say means much of anything. Management in the store needs to be all on the same page and needs to know how to do everything in the store. Needs to focus more on long term effects then short term effects.

review.title: “NA”
review.pros: Pros – Decent salary and benefits for amount of work required.
review.cons: Cons – Lack of "Quality Time" out of peak season. Level of knowledge of Field Mangement of day to day store operations and expectations.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Right person, right job also should be used for Field Management employees - door swings noth ways.

review.title: “Nice place to work, but beware of the politics.”
review.pros: Pros – - Campus is great w/a lot of resources.- Pay and bonuses competitive with other companies.- Work/life balance is the best I've experienced anywhere.- No long hours, little pressure from deadlines.
review.cons: Cons – - Systems are sub-par given the size of the company.- Politics reign supreme here. You will not get anywhere unless you play the political game and play it better than the others. Promotions are given to people not based entirely on merit. Merit is only 20% of it here. You won't be recognized for good work unless you're a good sweet talker.- Communication across departments is pretty bad. You can't get things done without making multiple calls.- Worst part of TRU is the lack of transparency. Upper management is very secretive about their plans going forward and the company's performance overall.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More transparency and better communication of company strategy will go a long way in gaining the support of people within the company.

review.title: “nothing to say in the sections”
review.pros: Pros – customers are the reason, seeing the kids excited about being there
review.cons: Cons – longterm managers who do not care about the associates, how they stay in the office and do not come out to the floor to help even when they are called
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – When doing the employee surveys actually listen, do some behind the scenes investigations of the way Store managers actually treat their assistants and hourly employees

review.title: “LOVE working at Toys R Us”
review.pros: Pros – Pretty Flexable scheduling, within reason during the holidays, quick training. availability based on performance to stay on or get a call back after the holiday rush. Great co-workers. Scheduled breaks, and defined responsibilites
review.cons: Cons – Min. amount of hours available, based on sales. Similar to other retail enviroments.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – This store was amazing to work for, and I would happily do it again every holiday!

review.title: “Lackluster pay, fun place to work, sometimes.”
review.pros: Pros – Fun place to work. Most people are grateful for the higher level of customer interaction compared to competitors. Guaranteed off on Christmas.
review.cons: Cons – Too many teenagers who don't care about their jobs work there.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more supportive and less critical.

review.title: “would only recommend as a secondary job”
review.pros: Pros – flexible schedule, coworkers, managers, teamwork
review.cons: Cons – babies r us is now operating same as toys r us and NOT A GOOD IDEA! Micromanaging at every level in the company. Babies r us use to be a fun, energetic place of employment but due to the recent changes, the company morale is dead.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don 't fix something that isn't broken.

review.title: “Great for a Part Time, Transitional Job”
review.pros: Pros – When you leave, you leave your problems. Atmosphere is usually positive, other associates are helpful and friendly. There is flexibility in hours to work. The customers are great. Expectant parents are usually very happy in anticipation of their upcoming big event and that comes across when you do business with them.
review.cons: Cons – Schedules are posted usually be Wednesday or Thursday for the next week. Therefore, it's hard to make personal plans for that week. I've seen it where the schedule wasn't posted until Saturday night and the work week begins on a Sunday. It gets worse if you work in a specialty area like furniture. If they need a day off, they have to switch with someone else from the furniture department. This makes it hard to have an outside life or find someone else that will fill in for you. The store is extremely short staffed recently---they just let go all their F/T long term employees. The employees were told that they could re-apply for p/t positions and would get the prevailing wage for a new associate.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There are three areas for improvement: more staffing so we can make our sales goals and interact with our guests (as R Us wants), improved warehouse management (ours is a safety disaster waiting to happen and takes 20 minutes to locate something when it should be quick), and post the schedule at least 2 weeks in advance (JCP used to do it a month at a time).

review.title: “TRU Summary”
review.pros: Pros – There are some select individuals there that are worthwhile mentors and partners.
review.cons: Cons – Systems and Data Availability is below what it should be for a Retailer this size, makes doing analysis at this company difficult or in at least a slow arduous process bc of the time and energy wasted on just collecting and validating accuracy of data.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Have an IT strategy that is holistic across multiple depts.

review.title: “A good place to gain experience but wouldn't recommend a career there.”
review.pros: Pros – It gave me experience that I need to go to another company after a year. It was a great starter job for after college in the field of human resources
review.cons: Cons – The hours. The shifts are not steady. The holidays are hard when you don't get enough sleep and little time to see family.The human resources position is difficult because you report to too many people. You directly report to the store manager but also you must report to the district human resources manager. Many times these managers have differing views.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Decide on a more clearly defined role for the HR supervisor. Get on the same page with the district HR managers.

review.title: “Fun and Helpful Employees with Horrible store managers”
review.pros: Pros – I was there for almost a year and up until the last few months it was amazing! I loved everyone I worked with and the way the company was ran. I actually loved going to my job every morning. The best reasons to work their are the discounts, knowledge (I now know almost everything I need to have a baby), customer service ( they really do care about customers), and all of the huddles/ communication. I never felt confused, I always had someone to ask for help. I felt very connected with the company and responsible if something wasn't done right or sales goals weren't met. I liked having the ability to make my own decisions and help customers the way I saw fit.
review.cons: Cons – Turnover and low morale, along with crappy incentive packages. I don't have kids so the discount is really helpful for me. I would have liked a tuition pay package for working their for so long. Most everyone their was in college or wanted to go to school. Managers really tried to keep everyone happy, but their was so much drama with not enough hours and favoritism that it was hard to keep the morale level high. Managers are scared of DM visits because they don't do their job the rest of the time.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pop in on stores unannounced and see what your store managers are really doing. Ask EVERY employee what they would like to see fixed without the store manager around.

review.title: “I have been there......”
review.pros: Pros – Its what you make it. Some managers will be worthless, but some are very good. Its about who you work with. People quit people, not companies.
review.cons: Cons – Season, (Christmas), kiss your family goodbye in November. Pay a little low, performance is critisized constantly. If you cannot sell batteries, warrenties (BPP), open new credit card accounts, then do not bother, these are what will get you there, or out to the curb.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Focus on happiness of associates and management. You ask entirely too much from understaffed stores, and you continue to cut payroll while expecting everything from replenishment to re-merchandising to numerous reports all day. Revisit Operation Guest Engagement...it has flaws. I know, I helped develop it.

review.title: “Fun, but not a long-term commitment.”
review.pros: Pros – Had some great co-workers at the time, but this varies from location to location and year to year. Fun, management was stern but fair. There is a 10% discount, but this discount cannot be applied towards video game systems, some electronics, diapers, and baby formula. The discount is good for all other items and is a plus. The co-workers were very close knit, almost a family. Often spent time with them after work. This closeness and openness made work more tolerable and the environment healthier. I believe it also helped with sales by utilizing friendly competition.
review.cons: Cons – Not a lot of room for growth. One very talented employee had been there nearly a decade without growth, another several decades without growth. There are no health benefits for part-time employees, and management would not hire full-time employees. Many part-time employees were working full-time hours without benefit or extra pay. The pay increase was not very much after nearly 2 years of working and always meeting and exceeding my numbers, making near minimum. Did not adjust hourly wage after minimum wage went up, so I essentially was given a raise to minimum wage 2 weeks before the change. Would not raise upon request.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Start pushing your senior team-members forward in the business.

review.title: “R-E-S-P-E-C-T”
review.pros: Pros – Fun place, good co-workers. Good if you have children and need to buy things like diapers and formula.
review.cons: Cons – Pay isn't that great and no benefits for part time work, at least that they let us know about. Management had very little respect for the associates, the higher up you went the worse it got. The 10% discount wasn't really stretching their pocket. Also they weren't very accommodating to changes in you schedule and even if you asked for time off often wouldn't change it and would tell you it was your job to find a replacement for a day you had requested off previously.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – respect!

review.title: “A typical retail store”
review.pros: Pros – Typical job in which 'sales associates' work the floor (includes shelving, organizing, assisting customers in one department) aside from front-end support jobs lead to extra pocket money.The work itself is not terribly hard and those willing to partake in the holiday shopping season will certainly welcome the extra hours. Hours & availability are all negotiable, though some instances they will not be able to accommodate. However, for the most part (particularly in Wayne store), they will try to fit it to your schedule.Also, those working part-time will get discounts too. So if you're looking for certain boardgames, console games, books, gifts, etc, what better can it get! Also you can check out the clearance items after the season is over too.
review.cons: Cons – Too many long hours. Christmas season is very hectic (need to be prepared mentally) and hourly wage is average for this job.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Increase pay, more interaction with management team

review.title: “toys r us store manager review”
review.pros: Pros – good employees and and innovative management team. Working with parents that saw thier childrens experiences though their childrens eyes was quite heartwarming and mad going to work each day tolerable. The employees were generally young high school students that had a high turnover rate so you had to weed out the losers quite frequently. The christmas season was a little tough because you had to fire so many good employees that gave blood sweat and tears during "season.' It was just a way of life....use em and fire em! But I suppose ther was no other way or someone would have thought of it.
review.cons: Cons – too many hours and lacking abilities of regional supervisors
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – listen to your management teams

review.title: “Toys "R" Us Indifferent to service; metrics mean everything”
review.pros: Pros – If you like cooing over babies and little kids, TRU is a good place to be. Co-workers are fun, and the environment is okay. If your kid is sick, the managers don't hassle you about missing work. The in-store discounts are wonderful. Working mothers can fashion their available hours after their schedules. Most employees are helpful and cheery, which is a nice thing to walk into. Most managers are also helpful and happy to be there. Many repeat customers come to see you. Community outreach is good, especially at Christmastime. There are usually enough toys in the store to make just about everyone happy.
review.cons: Cons – No matter how conscientious a worker you are, the bottom line--"metrics"--is the only thing that counts. Although I have seniority over others, metrics is what drives the hours you get to work. Even if you have repeat customers who like you as a person, it doesn't matter. A manager recently tossed a phone book at one of the new hires and said "find some Birthday Club signups." These kids have been randomly taking names and making up kids names in order to get the number of signups required on their goal cards. Hours are seriously cut for those who don't "add up." The managers really hassle you if you have water at your cashier station, despite the fact that cashiers are expected to chat up each customer. The excuse? You're told you can go to the water fountain when you're thirsty. It's not easy to do that at all!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – People come back to the store because of service. Relying solely on metrics is unrewarding for both the customer and the worker. There is little room for advancement unless you play the game, and fake metrics scores.

review.title: “Overall, Toys R Us is a good place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – It is a company that is undergoing some big changes in corporate structure. More integrated (Toys R Us and Babies R Us) Super Side-by-Sides will be opening. This is giving more room for career advancement. Full-time associates get Atena Insurance. It is very good. Part time associates can also get a limited health insurance called Starbridge.It is normally a fun place to work, I enjoy it.
review.cons: Cons – The constant pushing of associates to sell instant credits, buyer protection plans, batteries, etc. There is a lot of pressure. There is no standing around. Whether you are at a register, or on the floor, there will be tasks to be completed on your "down time." After January, everyone's hours get cut, even the full time associates. Making it through January until May on fewer hours in hard.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make sure your Store Managers are having staff meetings weekly. We all need to be on the same page to work effectively.

review.title: “Toys R Us review”
review.pros: Pros – It's often a fun environment with all the toys and excited children. It's satisfying to bring a smile to a child's face, and to help a clueless parent find something worthwhile for their child.
review.cons: Cons – There is not much communication and training from the management. The management at times complain to associates about less than stellar gstat scores, but the company hardly trains and guides the employees on guest servicing, SOPs, product knowledge, etc! They way things are done in the store it seems like most people (including managers) are just randomly "winging it" as they go along. A lot of people work hard and are kind of disillusioned by the lack of acknowledgment for the work they do by management. There are hard-working, helpful, friendly people working there, but it's at times jarring how some managers and associates there are rather cold and impersonal towards each other. They don't seem interested in interacting with their fellow employees and act like they don't want to be approached for anything.The head store manager's presence seems non-existent in the store. Most employees have never seen THE store manager and have absolutely any idea who it even is. This person is cooked up in their office most of the time. Strange how someone can be in charge of this particular store but walks around in it only once every few months (usually just to go shopping or greet a VIP visiting the store).The company can at times be stingy providing hours to its employees, even if it's a very high volume store that needs a lot of help and work done. The salaries offered to associates is not competitive with other major retailers in the area. It's no wonder why a lot of great employees quit and work at other retailers.The company discount (10%) is seriously a joke, and excludes a lot of major items. Major retailers typically offer their employees at least double that rate year-round, and some offer triple (and up) that rate.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more approachable and in-touch with your employees. Acknowledge the hard work your employees do. Acknowledge the mere existence of your employees! Most of you were once associates too. You should never forget what it's like and how vital they are in the operation of the business. Also, you should work more directly WITH your associates so the store is run more smoothly. This is mostly basic, very common sense stuff, but is not practiced extensively in the store.Also, the salary, benefits, raises, company discount should be competitive with what other major retailers nearby offer. Otherwise you will keep losing a lot of great workers.

review.title: “Whats my title again?”
review.pros: Pros – If you like kids, there will be a ton of them there. There are a lot of toys to play with as well if you're into that sort of thing. Overall a good "first job" type of place where you can screw up a lot and not get in trouble or fired.If you work in the morning, there is a lot of time to get your job done, after the store opens however, every single person is an associate and cannot continue their regular duties.
review.cons: Cons – No training at all. The managers kept all of the hourly employees in the dark as to how the store was doing or where we were at. The only thing management cared about was protection plans and not punching in too early.When my job position switched after a week of working as an associate, no further training toward my new job was completed. I was told to come in earlier and that was it, no formal about my new duties. For a month I was only doing two portions of my job until new management came in and told me that I actually had several other duties.Returned/used merchandise was returned to the floor to sell as new, even though some items were obviously used.No one ever said, "good job" or "bad job, do it this way instead." I wasn't doing my job right for a month and the managers said nothing.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Let people know what their job titles are and make sure every store has enough associates so that everyone who needs to do other things can actually do them.

review.title: “Big Changes at Babies R Us”
review.pros: Pros – The people are very nice. Other stores will help you when you have questions. Everyone wants the company to be successful and are willing to work any amount of hours and make personal sacrifices to make it happen. The company used to have no "season" which allowed vacation and personal time to be taken during holidays, however this year things seemed to change and it looks as though time off during holidays will be going away to provide support to TRU this is based on conversations with people who still work for the company,
review.cons: Cons – Advancement is based on how much the DM, RVP, HR, LP like you, not on store performance or personal performance . The CEO is ruining the brand. The store have had hours cut in half and managers are performing a lot of the hourly jobs as well as still having all of the managerial responsibilities. Many long team managers seem to be driven out of the company or can not adjust to all of the changes.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Look at the long term damage being done to the Babies R Us brand and the loss of talented people.

review.title: “Satisfactory Part-Time Retail Job”
review.pros: Pros – I was a part-time, hourly employee. I appreciated the flexibility in scheduling hours and the ability to receive more hours when asked for. My co-workers were pleasant.
review.cons: Cons – Working in retail is stressful overall. Many of the customers at Babies R Us have small children and are stressed out and will take out their frustration on staff.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Maintain greater consistency in store processes. Depending on which manager was on duty, different processes would be followed and enforced.

review.title: “Toys R Us Review from Sales Associate POV”
review.pros: Pros – Easy going workplace. The people you work with are great. Most of the management team is very good and helpful. The team prides itself on our cleanliness. Most of the employees are extremely knowledgeable which makes your job easier. Everything is organized to a certain degree. Extremely flexible with requested time off, as well as earned time and sick time. If you work hard you will be compensated, just don't expect it to land in your lap, you will have to persue it and make your intentions known. There is great communication between corporate and stores as well as stores to other stores.
review.cons: Cons – Pressure for metrics (Warranties, Batteries, Instant-credit sign-ups). Sometimes the management team will make real bonehead decisions. Customers believe that I am actually their slave. Listen if I am lifting an enormous box over my head and its clear that I am struggling, please don't stop me to ask a question. Customers also believe that they are queen and or king of the store. I am not going to bend backwards for you because you think you are the most important person in the store. Everyone needs attention too. Up until the holiday season, the schedule coverage is absolutely horrid. There is an extreme amount of pressure on the hours that are given to our store.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Just keep up the good work and stop digging yourselves into holes you can't get out of.

review.title: “Bad company to work for (BRU Dis. 34)”
review.pros: Pros – It was a great company to work for, knowing what I know now I will not work for them. Toys "R" Us used to be a great company to work for, it was a frienly environment, employees were respected, great feedback, great pay,etc. top management need to look at BRU dis. 34.
review.cons: Cons – Low pay, lot of respect, bad management. Management do not listen to employees in order to work together and make the job easy for every one, it is important to note that respect, training, empowerment are some of the key things in a relationship between management and employees, good relationship pays.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take care of your Employees (BRU dis. 34)

review.title: “If you care about how much you make please don't work at Toys 'R' Us!”
review.pros: Pros – Management is very friendly, nice, and understanding. It's also a lot of fun playing around with toys when it is very slow (especially in the morning times). You also get a discount (I believe 10%) off almost everything in the store and you get to hold items that you want that are on sale or clearance.
review.cons: Cons – The pay! Compared to other companies it is very low! Plus you have to constantly offer customers credit cards and service plans and ask for donations for certain things (for Children, usually around Christmas time). All of this would be ok but you don't see a dime of it since there is no commision pay. Also, the employee discount only covers basic toy items: No electronics. So unless you are still a child at heart or have kids around there isn't a whole lot to use your discount for. Oh, and by the way, after Christmas, if they don't let go of you, you will be hard pressed to get many hours unless you have exceptional experience and skills.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You guys aren't bad people. In fact, I really enjoyed working for all of you. It's just that I can't even pay rent with the salary I got there.

review.title: “Toys "R" Us is great for kids.”
review.pros: Pros – Working with children is very fun. Kids these days have so many different kinds of toys and advances in technology have helped kids gain more knowledge about things. You have a chance to see how toys have changed throughout the years from simple to futuristic. I never realized that toys sold so easily everyday to adults who had children at home. During the holidays, the store was so packed that you couldn't really have time to clean your section because you were helping customers left and right. It was a fun experience and I would work there again if I had free time.
review.cons: Cons – There are so many workers that you don't really get a chance to have a lot of hours to work. During holidays, you might just be hired for a seasonal position, which means that your job may be temporary. If you are a good worker, they may ask you to stay for another season. There is a high chance that you might get called in on your days off if other workers don't show up for work. It is roughly 15-20 hours for part-time workers, which I had applied for. Working at Toys "R" Us can be quite hectic if you are not up for a challenge.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – N/A

review.title: “A company still trying to find their way.”
review.pros: Pros – The enormous wealth of knowledge you can gain from experienced team members, knowing about the deals and promotions before anyone else, ability to earn decent vacation and paid time off based on the hours you work. Also, they have a vast amount of knowledge on the company intranet so that you can search and learn basically anything about the functions within the store and the various products.
review.cons: Cons – The biggest downfall that I've found while working at Babies R Us is the lack of professionalism through out the company. Every where from store level all the way up to corporate it seems like there isn't much follow through and there is a general lack of commitment. There are high expectations for the Dept. Supervisors (and part time associates, for that matter) yet no training program set in place. Its a sink or swim mentality and you are ultimately the decider of your fate in the company. There are a lot of empty promises and very few rewards for your accomplishments. Hard work is expected and the only reward you get is a pin for your name tag. They consistently do contrary to what they promise and blame it on the circumstances. They promise and/or threaten to keep written proof of accomplishments and pitfalls in order to manipulate a persons performance. There is very little management involvement and straight answers are difficult to come by. A lot of issues seem to be taken personally and you can always find management standing around gossiping with their favorite associates. Over all it is a very frustrating atmosphere to work in and the only thing that has kept me there so long is the Supervisor team I work along side.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Think about the "little people." It seems like everyone is so caught up with making money that they fail to realize it isn't corporate making it..its the team members and their commitment to excellence that is keeping the company afloat. There needs to be some kind of reward for our hard work beyond a button and getting to wear jeans to work.

review.title: “Non Seasonal retail environment”
review.pros: Pros – Non seasonal retail environment. Flexible for raising family. Friendly environment. Bright environment, guests are happy about shopping for babies.
review.cons: Cons – Financially difficult in area to live on low salary for market area, promotions are very slow. Communication is poor at times, more attention is focused on hourly employees than management associates. Focus groups are provided for associates to vent and air their frustrations, and the same is not provided to management, yet management is held accountable to what some disgruntled employees may say. Upper Management doesn't always support management staff with difficult guests, and decisions are often made based on that lack of support.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Reward performance with bonus' to compensate for low salary in market area. Empower your managers to make decisions based on fairness, not necessarily on the screaming guest who insists on being treated differently than the average guest.

review.title: “decent first job”
review.pros: Pros – Good money for the part time job it pays for high school students. You get to work with a variety of people both young and old. Also, you get a nice employee discount and you get to play with toys here and there. Apart from that, there's nothing much more to say.
review.cons: Cons – Christmas season, you work til around 2am. Closing the store and doing inventory was the worst part of the job. The managers don't really have any sort of training program in place. It's learn as you go. Promotions are solely dependent on how much brown nosing you can do in a week.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – no comment

review.title: “It can be fun”
review.pros: Pros – It can be a fun place to work. Some employees try to have fun and be friendly.
review.cons: Cons – Management has no education and lacks respect for employees. The systems they use for inventory and sales are outdated and make transactions very difficult to process. Achievements regarding sales and goals are never rewarded except for an increase an future goals. Management tries to motivate you to fulfill their needs as a manager because they are rewarded for the goals you accomplish that you get nothing in return for.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Respect your employees

review.title: “Quick impact”
review.pros: Pros – Managers are scheduled 9.5 hours. Managers are also paid hourly, so working retail, this is good. You are paid time and a half for work. The downside of hourly work is that in California there are meal violation laws. As a manager, it can be very difficult to pull away from tasks. Also, TRU is hiring! Leaders recognize that the only way that they remain competitive in retail, is to hire good leaders. The company seems to be very open to new suggestions to improve store performance. Marketing is good. Parents are able to save a lot of money with the many coupons.
review.cons: Cons – benefits are minimal. The benefits do not offer orthodontic coverage for adult employees. Adult meaning anyone over the age of 19,major internal restructuring, sick time reimbursement does not benefit employees. Also, TRU is hiring! Leaders recognize that the only way that they remain competitive in retail, is to hire good leaders. The company seems to be very open to new suggestions to improve store performance. Marketing is good. Parents are able to save a lot of money with the many coupons. Also, TRU is hiring! Leaders recognize that the only way that they remain competitive in retail, is to hire good leaders. The company seems to be very open to new suggestions to improve store performance. Marketing is good. Parents are able to save a lot of money with the many coupons.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Update technology within the stores! Managers are scheduled 9.5 hours. Managers are also paid hourly, so working retail, this is good. You are paid time and a half for work. The downside of hourly work is that in California there are meal violation laws. As a manager, it can be very difficult to pull away from tasks. Also, TRU is hiring! Leaders recognize that the only way that they remain competitive in retail, is to hire good leaders. The company seems to be very open to new suggestions to improve store performance. Marketing is good. Parents are able to save a lot of money with the many coupons.

review.title: “Appreciate good staff and reward them and get rid of the payroll wasters.”
review.pros: Pros – Discount for employees just barely worth it.
review.cons: Cons – Lack of respect from the top to bottom. Far too many staff members tend to talk down on their " equal" co-workers. No one seems to know or care if you are there to hang out and bs all day. But if you don't, beware because they will come down on you like a brick house if you actually do you job smoothly. They like to throw all kinds of orders at staff just because they have a souped up name tag. They don't seem to not recognize a person that can function and do their job without feeling that they must tell you 3 times even if you are in the middle of doing exactly that task.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Look and listen. If you have team members that are working hard and giving their best, acknowledge this. Do not assume that low paid staff means ignorance. There are a lot of brilliant people working at Toys R US. On the other hand, there are way too many that are wasting payroll and the biggest problem there is that management do nothing about it and instead spend their days lowing the moral of the exceptional staff members.

review.title: “Babies "R" Us is a fun place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – The health benefits for full time employees are very good and affordable. Management is genuinely concerned about their employees both at work and with their personal lives. It's a really fun place to work, you get to help expectant parents with all of their baby purchases. There is great opportunity for growth and advancement within the company. They always prefer to promote from within rather than hire from the outside.
review.cons: Cons – The pay rate isn't that good, the hours aren't very good, and the vacation time isn't very good. You have to be out of work for a minimum of three days in order to use your sick time. It's difficult to get ahold of anyone at the benefits center if you have questions about anything.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Listen to the store workers more when they have ideas. These are the people on the front lines dealing with the customers every day.

review.title: “No longer a Toys R Us kid”
review.pros: Pros – You get comp days based on your hours of work.They do have excellent benefits,good equipment to drive.Once you learn where all the stores are it is real easy work,unless you have to pull doubles.
review.cons: Cons – Poor management,lack of input into easier ways to do your job
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Listen to the employees

review.title: “An enjoyable work place.”
review.pros: Pros – During the majority of the year it is an easygoing place to work at. Business picks up big time in mid Oct thru the New Year, as would be expected. However the number of employees also increases then to cover the bigger crowds.
review.cons: Cons – I have enjoyed my time working at Toys "R" Us. I can't think of anything negative. As with most companies there is the big stress to get more sales of waranties and batteries, as well as credit apps.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make sure old as well as new employees feel appreciated and compensated. With the ever increasing cost of living it should be just as important to keep your current employees as it is to rncourage new people to work for you. At the same time as I said before I enjoy working for the company.

review.title: “Good opportunity to become part of a turn around”
review.pros: Pros – Assuming you perform well in your current position, it is easy to move around the company thanks to an initiative from the CFO to promote internal recruiting and interdepartmental knowledge transfer.The corporate headquarters is understaffed, which leaves extra opportunity to step up and shine.Toys R Us is privately held and going through a "turn-around" phase. We are starting to make up some of the lost market share to our major competitors Target and Wal-Mart.New successful Toys R Us strategy: Toys has rolled out a promising initiative to place Toys and Babies stores next to each other to capture more of the transitional age group between babies and juvenile aged children. This new concept has been successful and is being rolled out to the rest of the chain.Brand equity.
review.cons: Cons – The location of the corporate headquarters in Wayne, NJ is unfortunate. The commute to Wayne, NJ is long from NYC or Hoboken, NJ. The traffic is horrible and owning a car in NY/NJ is very expensive. Unless you're married with kids, life in suburban NJ could be depressing for a young professional.Toys has a very hierarchical structure, which makes it harder to get things done unless you go through the right person who has a high enough position within the company and connections. It is important to travel through the appropriate channels to accomplish a certain task, which reduces productivity.The current budget for pay raises is close to nil.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Employee retention will be a problem with the current budget for annual reviews.

review.title: “Toys R Us is not a fun place to work at, even though you are around toys all day.”
review.pros: Pros – There's not many reasons, the only one I can think of is my fellow co-workers. There are a great group of people that work at the store I am at. I can't even say the discount is great, because it's only 10%.
review.cons: Cons – The training is insufficient. I realize it's hard to effectively train everyone at Christmas time, since our staff triples during that time, but I'm sure that a new and more effective training method could be put in place, especially training on different products in the store. We carry many electronic items in the store, and most people, even those that work in the electronics section, don't have a lot of knowledge on the different products they are supposed to be able to sell. Feedback is not something that is frequently given, whether it be positive or negative. Advancement opportunities, especially at the store I work for, is not something that comes along often, and does not seem to be a priority either. At my store, it seems as though the store manager gets the right people in key positions that make him look good, and he does not move them up from there. For example, an assistant manager position opened in our store. Two supervisors that were more than qualified for the spot applied for the job. Neither one was even given an interview for the spot. The position was eventually given to someone outside of the company. Lastly, the pay is not competitive at all. Someone would probably be better off working at Wal-Mart than at TRU.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There needs to be more communication throughout all levels of management, and more feedback needs to be given, whether good or bad, and performance problems need to be addressed immediately instead of letting the problem progressively get worse.

review.title: “We keep politics on aisle 6c, and high school games on 4d....”
review.pros: Pros – Helping moms make children smile.
review.cons: Cons – The company is reorganizing after a buyout two years ago. However the vast majority of the store level and district level leadership remains in place. These remaing managers are more concerned with playing politics and attempting to protect their jobs than executing the new leadership's vision for success.There is no system for tracking the actual hours worked by salaried managers. Salaried Managers fill out a management time log, but that information remains at the store level and in never transmitted or reconciled anywhere. This means that the controlling authority (the GM) is able to work half days as compared to what they are actually scheduled. They are free to not work at all, and then claim a week later that they did work according to the schedule. This has led to serious abuses of sick days, eto, and vacation days. The ASM is expected to be present the entire shift, and frequently exceeds 60 hours per week compared to the GMs 35-40 hour weeks. Complaints of abuse to higher are simply routed back down to the GM's in question which typically results in action against the reporter. I have personally watched disciplinary actions against hourly associates for 1-10 minute late arrivals handed down by a manager that consistantly cheats the company out of 8+ hours per week. The hourly associates see this and it does nothing to help store morale. Additionally, the GM is the only one that is bonused at a variable rate that can be sizeable. Combine all of these points and one is left with some seroiusly disgruntled employees.Plan o Gram documents frequently do not agree with graphics installation instructions, the layout pictures typically violate the standards of excellence for merchandising, and the layouts usually will not agree with the product list as shown in the diagrams.Store hours have been cut to bare bones staff resulting in a closing staff for three people for a 100K sq ft store. This is a constant complaint by shoppers on our satisfaction surveys. At my store we usually have less than 400 hours to split between the entire staff. Salaried managers make up this shortage by working extra hours.Special projects are also frequently mismanaged by corporate from the beginning. I was allotted 80 man hours to reset and create a section of improved and new aisles. The right size shelves were not shipped to begin with. The proper shelving uprights and base decks never arrived. The right plans were not published to fit my store layout, the new product still has not arrived, and we have ordered the correct material twice now. This was supposed to be complete 20 weeks ago.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get control of salaried managers worked time by making them clock in and out for attendance purposes.Make the silent witness hotline actually "silent" The hotline does no good when the info is relayed right down to the GM it is concerning and they get to solve who "ratted" them out, and then has the ability to dismiss it as a disgruntled person who called simply because they were counselled for job performance.Bonus employees for performance affecting the bottom line. Reward for credit card,extended warranty placement, and assembly dollars.Make the aisle layout documents agree.

review.title: “babys rus nedd to inprove who they hire as managers.”
review.pros: Pros – there are none on less you just whant the health benifits but thats it.
review.cons: Cons – the managers over work you,no respect employes very few to a store needs 75 employess it only has 40 and they expect you to do the work of 3 people the money not woth it even when when you kill your self doing something great you don't get a thank you or any praise they just work you toyou drop.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – to be more productive and lisen to the employes comments and to support there department supervisors.

review.title: “under valued employee”

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – After you finish one of your tours of stores pull the payroll for the store and district leading up to your visit and check the payroll of the stores you visit regularly. review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay close attention to the hiring and firing process and how it relates to customer service ratings. I worked in a BRU in Brooklyn where one manager fired a lot of us and now that store has no store manager, horrible customer service, and it's practically empty. It's not all just a coincidence. Maybe all companies should check up with previous employers that left or was fired after working for the company for many years.

review.title: “Crappy minimum wage job. Still here only until I can find a better one.”

review.cons: Cons – The pay really sucks. I made more working fast food with less work to do.You have to do a lot of work.Terrible customers. Most are always out to get freebies/discounts on things that don't need them. EX: One customer wanted a discount because a box was messed up on the bottom.Employees that have been there for awhile think they are better than you.Poor training.You won't always get a break and they don't care.Management does pretty much nothing.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – For the amount of work we have to do, we should at least be making $8 an hour. Have older employees understand that they aren't better than anyone else. Enforce breaks! It sucks not being able to use the bathroom because we are too busy with not enough coverage. Maybe you should get managers to get off their butts and help out so employees can get breaks/bathroom time.

review.title: “Store level talent is not appreciated.”
review.pros: Pros – The people I work with are the only reason I stayed with the company this long.
review.cons: Cons – They are all about working harder, not smarter. People at the top see all the profits of the company and the hourly employees who work very hard putting together projects dictated from corporate, never are appreciated. Senseless work is done within the store which wasted money, time and discourages team members from being productive.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The people at corporate making up all the projects and moves that happen within the store, have probably never worked at store level, so they are completely disconnected from reality. My advice is listen to the store managers, have a better exit strategy for product, lower prices on formula and diapers, and stop being so stingy with coupons. The company wants to be competitive with others but doesn't understand people will shop around for a better deal, customer service isn't always worth a price hike on toys of up to 30% or more.

review.title: “Not if you are divorced and want to see your kids ever...”

review.cons: Cons – I am divorced. I get my kids every other weekend. 48 days a year. If I didn't specifically request time, I got MAYBE 6 of those days off, and NEVER both unless i took personal or vacation time. Even though the other assistant would have been willing to work opposite weekends with me. NOT FAMILY FRIENDLY.I did not hang out with the Manager and the other assistant. So I was never "trustworthy" to them because I did not break company policy with them...HR Does not take complaints of any employee at any level seriously.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Figure out a policy in which divorced parents whe get to see their kids 4 days a month get to see them the 10 months of the year that it is not Christmas season...

review.title: “World Sales Leader”

review.cons: Cons – The store I am in has a team of managers that has been together too long. They should has been seperated years ago. If you do not fit into the click you are headed no where. Allthe men bosses like to flirt with all the young girls.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – open your eyes

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Reward positions from within the store to those deserving of themFocus on those who do well within the sales floor and not just the cashiersDo more to get the employees closer togetherbe fair on the hoursFire those who should be fired

review.title: “In a downward spiral...”

Blaming everyone else is not the answer so take a better look at yourself first. Anyone can walk a store and point out whats wrong, success lies in the person who's willing to teach you how to fix it!

review.title: “ehh”

review.title: “Seasonal Insanity”

review.cons: Cons – The customers.. you have to have the tolerance and patience of a saint to deal with working at toys r us during the holiday season.Also, if you aren't used to the consistent working environment, it might not be the best for people. There were many times were breaks came at random, most days would be 8 hours straight on my feet.

review.title: “Interesting”

review.cons: Cons – There was no organization within the company and no one would work hard or complete duties at all every day
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Shape up

review.title: “Toys R Us has lost it's focus”
review.pros: Pros – Nothing better than working with kids and toys. Training is good in the off-season, spotty during busy times. At least they have updated their uniforms to the 1970's. Probably not a bad place for part-time job, but I feel sorry for the kid's wanting to start off here.
review.cons: Cons – Ridiculously bad customer focus. This company is so worried about it's bottom line and stock price that it has forgotten who and what got them this far. Very poor working hours during the season, 70 or more hours per week, with the promise of comp time during the off season. But they make the mangers dump all of their help and then it's only you and two other people to run the store every day so you can't take any time off. Company is cutting expenses so severely, we can't even maintain the building. I can't believe anyone still shops here. Upper management is so conflicted, we can't get a straight story from anyone. District manager has no idea what they are doing, no retail knowledge, no product knowledge, no inventory knowledge. And speaking of inventory, the managers have no control. They pump product into your store without any input, product you don't have room for and couldn't sell if you did.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – They know what to do, they just won't do it. I don't think management's attitude towards it's employees will every change, but the least they could do is take care of their customers. Good luck, Toys, I can't seeing you making it last much longer.

review.title: “it was ok”

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Create more full-time team member positions, find a better way to deal with "metrics", compensate more competitively with other big-box retailers.

review.title: “Toys R Us is a very fun place to work”

review.title: “front end manager”

review.cons: Cons – never any hours to run store

review.title: “Not happy”

review.cons: Cons – No raises not enough hours no room to advance.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat your employees right.

review.title: “Great place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – There was always a task to be completed. Customer satisfaction was high priority. Great team environment. Always something new to learn if you want more responsibilities.
review.cons: Cons – It gets a little stressful during holidays but nothing a well trained employee can't handle. The pay could be better.

review.title: “Dynamic retail, fun, fast paced”
review.pros: Pros – Great clienteleProvides an opportunity to make guests happy
review.cons: Cons – Very competetive, to a faultQuick to redirect, too quick at times
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More time planning before reacting on certain initiatives

review.title: “Where is the company going???? Your employees don't know!”
review.pros: Pros – Good place to learn what not to do for your next management position. Coworkers are friendly. Overall Good product line up.
review.cons: Cons – -Coupons are horrible and guest are always unsatisfied with the options for its use.-Signage is a joke because the distribution center never has the items shipped to stores for promos.-There are entirely too many SOPs to keep up with. Apparently there is no one in the company that removes the old information. So good luck finding the most up to date SOP.-I'm not sure that Toys R Us knows who there direct competitor is because they compete with everyone. If they narrow the focus of the company they might find a single direction for the company to follow for the future.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Narrow your focus and company goals so that everyone can be on the same page. You need to over haul all of your technology because its a joke. Your Logistics system is a complete mess. You cant sell stuff if your store is empty. The marketing deparment needs to learn how to use spell check because you sen all these signs to the store and you have to reprint everything always.

review.title: “DEBACLE”
review.pros: Pros – - Discount on some items- Never sitting around doing nothing- Hours were plentiful- uniform wasn't too bad to wear
review.cons: Cons – - Management treats you horribly - I'm sorry I'm not in any way ghetto so why should I act like it to get respect from managers shouldn't it be on employee ethic- Management is not competent- will forget what your role even after you remind them - i was supposed to be a sales associate but they insisted i was to be cashier-Discount is horrible only 10% off items-Many rude customers - part of the job at most places so in essence not that bad in comparision to other retail and at times how management talked to the customers i can see reasons for being disgruntled- No life between school and work - I was being scheduled like a workhorse - again I signed up for the job so I guess I deserved the hardship that came along with job plus not all bad i did get paid a lot since i had so many hours-Constantly moving - can be draining especially if working and 8 hour shift and have to stay two hours after to close
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More respect to employees, management ethic, management who dont talk about employees especially in front of their faces like they're not there

review.title: “Not the best”
review.pros: Pros – Great products to work with
review.cons: Cons – Hours during the holidays are terrible
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay employees more and pay bonuses

review.title: “Work is easy but pay is bad.”
review.pros: Pros – During season there are plenty of hours for everyone and enough people to get job done.It also gets slow during off season.
review.cons: Cons – The pay is horrible. Especially for people who work harder then management.They concentrate too much on sign ups when checking out and really don't care about sales.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It seems that everyone that gets promoted are the workers that work the less. I don't get why that is.

review.title: “good.”
review.pros: Pros – we had alot of freedom.
review.cons: Cons – unprepared and sometime not organized

review.title: “Fun place to work if you like constant change.”
review.pros: Pros – Fast Paced EnviromentAlways something new to keep you busyCustomers are typically happy and great experience with kids.
review.cons: Cons – Upper management is overworked and can be stressful thru holiday season.Had to advance even if qualifications are met.Sometimes unreasonable goals and timeframes to complete.Occasional Irate guests.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More hours for team members and more oppurtunites to grow within the company.

review.title: “All depends on how your store manager is.”
review.pros: Pros – Work around school hours for college students.If you have a good store manager the job is easy.Other employees are fun to work with.
review.cons: Cons – The Christmas season is horrible.If your not a full time employee they will drastically cut your hours when its not Christmas time.Training is sub-par.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – budget more hours for your lower level associates, its almost impossible to provide good customer service when there is only one associate on the entire sales floor.Better raises for lower level associates, 10 to 25 cent raises a year doesn't even cover inflation.

review.title: “Too much too soon with too incompetent shift managers”
review.pros: Pros – They provide good hours, a 10% discount, and train you in different areas. The employees I encountered were nice and some were willing to help.
review.cons: Cons – Train you to do too much too soon. I couldn't learn their cash register system with them trying to train me every other day in a new area. I would have loved to learn all of it, but I needed a couple weeks just in one area only. The shift managers were very bad. One of them was always watching my every move to make sure I did things right. Stressful, right? They expect you too get it quickly and it's just hard. I quit after a month and a half. The customers were fine, the managers and some employees were just idiots.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give new employees at least a couple weeks of one area so they can learn it. And be professional. The managers I encountered were far from that.

review.title: “Never enough time or help with projects. Workload is too great with only little help.”
review.pros: Pros – Customers are friendly.Hourly supervisors work very hard and are great to have on the team with their knowledge and making the store run efficiently.
review.cons: Cons – Hours are few and far between for both full- and part-time workers.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Either lower the workload on reset planograms and projects or give the stores more hours to perform by the deadlines.

review.title: “It was fun for a while but ended not so smoothly.”
review.pros: Pros – Working with parents and kids for toys is kind of fun. Making the parents happy before Christmas is always a good feeling.
review.cons: Cons – There are really no ways to get promoted. Once the holidays are done there are virtually no hours for lower level employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management needs to find a way to improve sales during the spring and summer seasons. Also the store set up needs to be greatly improved.

review.title: “I loved helping customers/guests but management practices were deplorable.”
review.pros: Pros – You get to help customers and coworkers are overall friendly and welcoming. Coworkers really are great to work with. Each day is different and brings new challenges.
review.cons: Cons – Management is under trained and not prepared to do thier jobs. There is like no reward program for hardworking employees. The schedule is put out only days before it starts which makes it basically impossible to plan your life.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Put the schedule out sooner. Try to increase overall moral by giving more rewards for good work. Decrease turnover by training managers more.

review.title: “No room for growth”
review.pros: Pros – Fun to work on a team, some guests are great to work with, managers trust their team with multiple responsibilities
review.cons: Cons – No room for advancement, the pay isn't enough to live off of, the hours are typical retail hours and you're always on your feet - not great when you're pregnant!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – STAR reviews are super helpful, and are encouraging when everything goes right. Make sure to be respectful of the work/home balance, especially when dealing with employees who have young families

review.title: “Exhausting business to work for; a new expectation every day”
review.pros: Pros – Decent benefits available, although it took 5 months to be active; Overall schedule flexibility was good; Looking for the most talented individuals to advance.
review.cons: Cons – New tasks were added to the mountain of work daily; Pay was very low - some individuals who have worked for the company for 7 years still do not make $10/hour; Stores running the juvenille test created additional work, less creativity and far more stress - it went from a fun, creative place to work to a stressful, aggrivating place.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “no employee appreication”
review.pros: Pros – you get to work with toys
review.cons: Cons – hard to move up the ladder
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – company needs more structure everything seems trial and error

review.title: “Neutral”
review.pros: Pros – There were some fun people to work with
review.cons: Cons – The long lines and lack of help from management when there was a problem.

review.title: “Great Place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Great environment. You are recognized for your hard work.
review.cons: Cons – Felt that everyone above the Director Level was not connected to the team.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Not as happy of a place as you would think”
review.pros: Pros – To be honest i was considered a favorite so when it came down to getting time off it wasn't difficult mainly because management was flexible with school
review.cons: Cons – Overworked and understaffed. Favoritism between the ranks within the store. Long hour with no reward for performance in the store. Stress and focused hard on metrics.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – To understand the processes being implemented within the store and give more hours so that the task can be completed without over stressing employees.

review.title: “na”
review.pros: Pros – This place is a fun to place to work.
review.cons: Cons – There is not enough support from the Human Resource department to the District Manager and Stores.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat the Management teams in the stores better and listen to what they are telling you.

review.title: “Not exactly the "World's Greatest Toy Store".”
review.pros: Pros – Having worked as both a part time associate/cashier and as a full-time store supervisor, I would say if you're not expecting to move past part-time, then the company is a good place to work.
review.cons: Cons – In 3 years working there, I never recall an increase in how many hours the store had to give its' workers. Even when the hours were increased during the holiday season, I remember hearing from many long-term works that the increases weren't as much as years past. You cannot continuously cut hours, and yet still expect the same, or even increased, results. It just doesn't work that way. And speaking as a shopper, I have never been asked as many questions by a cashier like the company expects theirs to do. Asking if someone wants to apply for a credit card, sign up for a rewards card, buy batteries, join the birthday club, and make donations, in addition to if they found everything they were looking for and if they need anything split onto separate gift tags makes the transaction take too long. Don't put all of this onto cashiers, and then offer $5 gift cards if a cashier forgets to ask something.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop cutting hours. Give some more time to allow your "sale associates" to really go out and sell things to customers on the sales floor.

review.title: “A job's a job.”
review.pros: Pros – The overall attitude of most of the managers was helpful, positive, and energetic.
review.cons: Cons – Some managers were no help and prevented work from being done. Schedules were never correct, rarely updated, and constantly changing without notice.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More communication is needed with your employees.

review.title: “Loved this job.”
review.pros: Pros – Fun, almost always busy, day goes by fast and the people are great (both customers and employees)
review.cons: Cons – Higher management failed to keep the stores informed about closings and procedures that were followed when a store is closed.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Stay Away”
review.pros: Pros – The 10% discount although it doesn't work on everything.
review.cons: Cons – Training consists of 10 minutes watching someone on a register then you are "thrown to the wolves". Despite not knowing about certain procedures, they will try to write you up for not doing them. Inventory system is horrible. You have to check stock before you can sell any item that comes off the floor with a ticket and noone ever answers their radio calls.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – At least a half day training with a checklist of things you should know.

review.title: “It's retail”
review.pros: Pros – Depending on the store, it can be a fairly laid back environment at smaller stores, which is nice, as you don't work with that many other people. The employee discount is okay, but nothing to write home about.
review.cons: Cons – It seems like there is always something new to push on to the customer, whether it be donating to a charity or some new program, which takes time at the register, when you have people complaining how long it takes to check out.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop making the Rewards program so difficult to use, with there being eligible quarters, and money you spent not carrying over, and the splitting up of the holiday Rewards. Simplify and streamline it.

review.title: “Sign up here for salaried legalized slavery”
review.pros: Pros – The people I work with are awesome for the most part. The company is horrible.
review.cons: Cons – Completely unrealistic goals as to what can be accomplished in a day with the hours and resources given. As a manager or ASM, only way to get daily and weekly goals accomplished is to work every day for more than 12 hours which wears you down both mentally and physically over time. Corporate management has no pity whatsoever for their legalized slavery to store managers. Pay offered to hourly associates leads to bottom of the barrel (in many instances) hourly associates who do not stay long. Constant turnover due to poor working conditions. You will have no life, especially during holidays when you will be forced to work even MORE hours than normal. Kiss your Easter, Thanksgiving, Christmas goodbye because you won't be having them with your family. Constant threats of being replaced for supposedly underperforming- however, no one is actually ever let go because everyone at other stores is in the same boat; barely being able to survive and putting on "horse and pony shows" for the DM's and regionals and hoping for the best. Favoritism and politics rampant in upper management. Ads and specials are horribly thought out by corporate with never enough sale merchandise, which angers customers (and the customers are right). However, you will be held responsible as a manager when customers give bad scores on feedback surveys due to circumstances you have absolutely no control over (in stocks).
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – MORE HOURS MORE HOURS MORE HOURS MORE HOURS MORE HOURS MORE HOURS MORE HOURS MORE HOURS MORE HOURS MORE HOURS MORE HOURS MORE HOURS

review.title: “Avoid This company if you can”
review.pros: Pros – The team members that work there tend to be very versatile and knowledgeable for the most part. Everyone is very hardworking and good at their job.
review.cons: Cons – The company does not have a very good structure of leadership. They try to run the stores as if they are a true big box store but it more of a mid box. 75% of their sales come from the last few weeks of the year for christmas that the rest of the year you are running on barebones. There are never team members in the store and they make the assistant managers work like Team Members. The Assistant Managers seem like a Department Supervisor position and the Store manager an Assistant because the District managers MicroManager the stores. Things that are suppose to get done never do because they make a million priorities and there is no staffing to do it besides you.. the Assistant Manager, and they expect you to run a business also!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give the Assistant Managers bonuses! WE are the front lines and we deserve to be compensated as so. During christmas, do not roll out new programs and expect everything to go smoothly while we are running 17+ registers and every aisle is on the floor.Re evaluate the location accuracy. Take a note from a real big box store Target and notice that their planograms are 100% located down to the label location so it is easier to do reshop, packout and inventory adjustments. Why should i not be able to tell a guest that their toy is in aisle 82, second section, 3 shelf up, 2nd label to the right.

review.title: “It was a great experience to work in fast pace retail environment.”
review.pros: Pros – I worked in the electronics department and one of the things I liked most was having the inside on video game hardware and software releases. Working in my department was one of the most steadiest by far outside. Once the holidays came along, the work load became very fast pace but it was still very manageable.
review.cons: Cons – It wasn't a downside for me but for other employees, some of them couldn't keep up with the fast pace.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Some advice I would give for management is to have a little more trust in their employees. I felt that I was a good worker and was being constantly monitored and told how to do a certain task that I already knew how to do constantly.

review.title: “a j o b”
review.pros: Pros – it is a nice place if you like insanity during the holidays. Very fast paced and unpredictable day to day.
review.cons: Cons – never enough labor hours to accomplish what the company expects people to do. for a company that does 100% increase in 3 months there should be more time to onboard seasonal people

review.title: “Hard Work but fun community”
review.pros: Pros – Fun, Great Employees, Great a great look at upcoming toys, location is not far, meet great people, outgoing, friendly environment
review.cons: Cons – Working through the holiday season is tough, back pains, short breaks, only 10% off merchandise, constantly bug you for credit card sales
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give recognition to your employees, listen to them when they have ideas, give them time off and a little more pay

review.title: “Middle of the Road”
review.pros: Pros – Great enviroment to work with many great people. Competitive company who pushes to be their best. Stability and longevity are a positive.
review.cons: Cons – Full time salary manager hours are 50+. Full time non-salary manager hours are 32-40. Again, great place to work but lots of hours.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It's a toy company, not the military. Lets find a common ground between success and quality of life in the work place and at home.

review.title: “unique opportunity”
review.pros: Pros – everyone's nice and happy. exciting work culture
review.cons: Cons – too laidback. low expectations. need better pay
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – more competitive

review.title: “OK”
review.pros: Pros – Excellent co-workers because of interview process.Working with kids.
review.cons: Cons – VERY low pay. Minimum Wage
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Appreciate the associates more!

review.employee-type: Back of the House Team Member (Former Employee)
review.title: “Solid part-time job”
review.pros: Pros – - Worked around class schedule (for the most part)- Decent pay 9.50 an hour- Most co-workers were friendly
review.cons: Cons – - Management treats its part-time employees like full-timers (had trouble with outside work obligations even though they had said was fine during interview process)- Closing Slavery - Not being able to leave the store when your shift is over because you have to stay and clean (sometimes 3 to 4 hours longer than your already 8 to 9 hour shift.... but people who work a morning or mid shift can just walk out the door when they are done)

review.title: “blah”
review.pros: Pros – you get a ten percent discount.
review.cons: Cons – you have to give up your holidays and not spend with family
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – dont promote the kiss butt people. promote those that are worth it. dont transfer people over an hour from their home.

review.title: “Okay.”
review.pros: Pros – 10% Employee DiscountFun People to Work withShared Product KnowledgePaid Slightly Above minimum wageKind of a good environment
review.cons: Cons – Lots of standing aroundLots of loud noises that may lead to a headacheNot a lot of hoursThey persuade you to try and sell extra stuff
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make sure to have the schedule done on time, so we can plan our week ahead of time. I hate having to wait until Monday or even Tuesday for our schedule!

review.title: “Not bad for a Part-Time job out of high school”
review.pros: Pros – Great coworkers, meet a lot of cool peopleDecent management, they seem to know what they are doing.(Some) customers can be really friendly and nice to talk toVery flexible with time off (I go to school full time so this is a must)
review.cons: Cons – Low pay (Minimum wage)Shifts can be very long (Especially closing shifts since you HAVE to clean the store before you leave)Many customers can be extremely rude for no reasonCoupons for the store are VERY obscure (Makes customers very angry at me when they don't get the "sales" price)Managers tend to focus on selling BPP's (Buyer protection), rewards cards, credit cards, etc. instead of focusing on more positive aspects. This is expected because they are probably forced to by THEIR supervisors.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make your coupons more clear!Provide more positive support over negative support (This will increase work ethic!)

review.title: “My years in Toys R Us has been a complete nightmare.”
review.pros: Pros – The hours is very flexible with the associates but little hours in off season.
review.cons: Cons – If you are not with them, you are against them. The District managers will always stick up for each other including the Store Manager. They run a dirty district, they will make you feel stress out all the time if they wanted to get rid of you. They have done it to more than one Assistant Manager and associate.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There are some good managers and they are really bad ones. The bad ones are alway the one who are in the circle of the Store Manager. It's not just one store it almost all of them. The Store Manager will curse at you, lied to you, but will always get away with it.

review.title: “Good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Varied opportunities Different choices for careers. Training opportunities available. TrAvel for those interested
review.cons: Cons – Limited job security Benefits not the best Limited flexible hours
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop outsourcing give jobs back to USA

review.title: “Low Maintenance”
review.pros: Pros – Coworkers are friendlyTime off granted when askedLow job expectations10% discount comes in handyOpportunities to meet interesting people
review.cons: Cons – Management is highly focused on register metricsMistakes are harped upon and praise is hard to come byCustomer demographic feels entitled
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Overall, the job is not hard. Management tends to be a little short sighted when it comes to operations, but I have no complaints. Don't expect a decent raise, though.

review.title: “Fun”
review.pros: Pros – You will be able to spend your time with very joyful and friendly people and everyone makes you feel like family.
review.cons: Cons – You will have to deal with childern asking for toys or etc that may not be in the stock anymore.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “A great place to work!”
review.pros: Pros – You get to see all the new toys before they hit the shelves. It is like a big family at work. Time flies when you are having fun.
review.cons: Cons – You get your schedule weekly, so it is hard to plan things in your personal life. It is a part time job. So if you are looking for full time hours that usually doesn't happen here.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “OK but could have been great”
review.pros: Pros – FlexibilityGreat brandChristmas could be fun if it wasn't so stressfulPay was okTeamwork between stores within the district
review.cons: Cons – Christmas was a nightmareFollowing national expectations/communications rewarded you with chastisement from regional management..As in all retail, too much work and not enough payroll to do it successfullyConstant never ending changes sometimes within hours to corp procedures/expectationsWanted to sell warranties, batteries, and credit card more than toys
