review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Remember it's a toy store and the associates should love to work there to have FUN with the guests! With so little payroll and so much to do there is no more fun there! Put the fun back in the company and it would be a great place to work!

review.title: “Decent Part Time work”
review.pros: Pros – Somewhat flexible hoursPhysical work if you're looking to help keep in shape or avoid becoming sedentaryLarge mix of responsibilities, from helping guests to stocking shelves to unloading trucks
review.cons: Cons – lower pay than comparable jobs with other corporationsthe hours can be taxing during holiday season/store openingswork on your feet for 8 hours a day
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Consider bringing up pay rates and increasing raises in order to help motivate and retain a skilled and enthusiastic work force. People generally go where the money is.

review.title: “For a company that is in the business of making kids happy, they don't care much about their employees' kids.”
review.pros: Pros – Decent pay compared to same position at other retailers.
review.cons: Cons – Nobody cares that you have a life, children, family.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Busy environment”
review.pros: Pros – Making parents and children happy
review.cons: Cons – No family time, having to work on holidays
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be realistic with work demands

review.title: “Going Downhill”
review.pros: Pros – The people who are at the lower level are dedicated to the company
review.cons: Cons – Simply put - Upper management. They have made it extremely difficult for stores to be successful. Payroll is barely visible during the week and they continue to cutback as sales do not perform to the expectation
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Time to take a good honest look at your performance. If a store or regional employee had the same results you have been showing, they would be gone.

review.title: “I love My coworkers, hate corporate”
review.pros: Pros – I love my coworkers, and my managers. They are really flexible with hours and availability, and will work with me on my hectic and demanding schedule as a full time college student.
review.cons: Cons – I believe that someone else had already made my point. Corporate sucks! They cut our hours and demand more. than when we aren't able they blame us and punish us by cutting more hours and demanding even greater quotas! The store is a mess, building wise. We make tons around Christmas, why doesn't corporate use some of that money and give recognition to it;s employees??? And mandatory holidays are awful. You start at a usually lousy pay rate, and from there the raises are minimal and only happen once a year.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Corporate! Recognize your workforce, we are the ones that make you money. Treat us well if you wanna make more. Don;t be idiots a happy work force means that we are more loyal and hardworking, stop thinking JUST of the profit margin!

review.title: “So far so good”
review.pros: Pros – Great working environment. The encourage employees in professional and technical growth. There are opportunities to work and meet other people outside your own group
review.cons: Cons – Benefits and vacation policy not to my licking and way below par versus other companies and industries in the area.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management should definitely revisit ways to make this a "better place to work". The perks and benefits are no where near Toys' competitors.

review.title: “Fast paced environment, Even outside of the holiday season.”
review.pros: Pros – Your kids love the fact that you work at TRU; Great People and very flexible.
review.cons: Cons – Holiday season is absolutely absurd.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Provide us labor to accomplish the workload expectations.

review.title: “A complete disaster”
review.pros: Pros – Top of the line pay for store managers.
review.cons: Cons – Company cares nothing of personal/work life balanceCompany pays well but treats managment like dirtDefinitly a company that takes advantage of the economy, always threatening your job and status.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop the constant harassment and mistreatment of store management teams, although in this economy you can get away with it, there is not one peer of mine that isnt trying to find another job with another company!

review.title: “Friendly atmosphere for a hard worker.”
review.pros: Pros – Salary, discount, promotions, hours and proximity to my home.
review.cons: Cons – Holiday season, late nights, coworkers
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More carefully screen fellow employees

review.title: “Like all retail, it depends on the people.”
review.pros: Pros – Friendly place to work if you get along with other coworkers. Some of the managers are decent people who will cause no problems or grief.
review.cons: Cons – Depending on the size of the store and staffing you will most likely be understaffed outside of the holiday season. Some managers can also be very detrimental to the morale and throughput of the store.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – If you have a manager that somehow manages to screw up the schedule week in and week out, and cause the entire store to dislike said manager, it's best to get rid of them. Their continued tenure will only cause more problems.

review.title: “Fun place to work, good people.”
review.pros: Pros – Overall fun place to work. You meet lots of new people.
review.cons: Cons – Poor training. The don't take the time to provide job training
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Focus more on training

review.title: “It's a great place to start off at.”
review.pros: Pros – By working there, you get to see satisfaction, not only through yourself, but with customers and coworkers. By meeting sale goals makes you feel good about your work ethic.
review.cons: Cons – Pay rates are not minimal but they are not the best. Hours depends on the sales of the stores so it may be hard to get hours.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It needs to be more organized, the company that is. Sales should depend on location not how they did the year before.

review.title: “Tough, but a great place to learn and grow when your young.”
review.pros: Pros – Great co-workers, organized, informative and promotes strong team work, management is kind. Toys "R" Us can also be a peaceful and easy working environment if you take the time to get to know other employees. Reasonably demanding and management is fair to everyone.
review.cons: Cons – If your a bike assembler, it may be best to have prior experience. Even though fixing the bikes is easy, management expects a certain amount of bikes to be produced in an hour. When I was there the demand was 4. If you haven't fixed or at least taken apart bicycles prior to working as an assembler, be prepared to learn quick. Production is important to the Toys "R" Us team and as an assembler your expected to produce quality fast. If you already know how the transition will be easy, but if you don't expect words from management.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what your doing. Provide safer methods for backroom workers. Keep the competition high and keep rewarding the individuals who especially work hard for your company.

review.title: “Overworked and Underpaid”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible hours.Friendly and great co-workers from store to store.
review.cons: Cons – No holiday pay.Small yearly raises.Weekly hours often changed from scheduled.Hourly associates, especially cashiers do marketing for company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Senior management should visit/conference stores and talk to employees (yearly), as open forum to hear positive and negative issues.

review.title: “Okay, Place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – The managers are really cool on a personal level, its a great learning experience for someones first job and its a great job for a college student
review.cons: Cons – The company is mis- managed, and the employees are underpaid for the jobs they do. Promotion opportunities are no good, because the managers hire external people instead of moving internal people up the ladder.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire more qualified managers and supervisors or better yet promote employees who have the most potential to be a manager or supervisor. Give better raises to people who have been there the longer and that have good job performance.

review.title: “An alright job, hard work didn't really pay off”
review.pros: Pros – The people were great to work with.Possible advancement if a hard workerManagement can be hit or miss.Don't expect good raises
review.cons: Cons – Corporate did not really inform store management very well.Training was horrible, just had to figure out everything on your own.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give better training to department supervisors and management.Give better compensation for hard work.Don't change things so often on management

review.title: “It was just ok.”
review.pros: Pros – There was a decent working environment at Toys "R" Us. As a sales associate it was an easy job with not a lot of responsibilities.
review.cons: Cons – There were multiple managers who did not seem to agree on the proper methodology to get things done, and often the employees would get the short end of the stick.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Work on manager communication, establish some sort of norm on how things should be done. Don't take it out on the employee when it was another managers fault.

review.title: “Can't Complain”
review.pros: Pros – The hours are really good for salary management... 45 hours a week average during the year and about 50-60 during holiday season. Not bothered on days off... unlike previous employer. Great communication with direct reports and clear expectations. Actually gives raises which is hard to come with many organizations.
review.cons: Cons – The stores are understaffed and overall inventory management is poor. Some departments are continuously light on product which is frustrating for guests and employees. Poor exit strategy of clearance merchandise. The return policy is very poor and makes it difficult to deal with guests.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please review the return policy as it relates to online purchases, and electronic purchases. Evaluate the buying process of merchandise to ensure proper stock adequate inventory during the year.

review.title: “Start here, but don't stay too long.”
review.pros: Pros – Great place to start a retail career. Good advancement opportunities for hard working part timers who want more. Will gain great experience for future endeavers.
review.cons: Cons – Don't challenge Senior Management. Procedures need to be followed by the book regardless of success or failure. Tread lightly. Politics hold sway.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Show some gratitude. Your Store Leadership Teams are the life-blood of your business. The impression most get is "Be thankful you have a job".

review.title: “Rude”
review.pros: Pros – Fun to work with toys.Flexible with scheduling.
review.cons: Cons – rude customers and rude corporate. corporate wouldn't listen to anything the managers said. incompetency everywhere. very little discount for employees. I was told to force customers to buy more. we had a successful store but we were expected to make way too much and we closed because of that. everything we did was monitored. we had to straighten merchandise and line it up perfectly the whole time because corporate might come around in disguise and run their hand over the merchandise and it had to be smooth. bar codes couldn't be showing either. the back room was full to bursting because corporate wouldn't stop sending our small store truckloads of toys every week. it was like the managers hadn't complained when of course they had. we received toys that nobody wanted, which made it even harder to meet our ridiculous goals. we had Christmas music playing after Thanksgiving at full volume. when our customers would complain, we cashiers would turn it down but then we would get yelled at by our managers because corporate told us to have the music blaring. this drove customers away and it was frustrating because we were there and could see and fix things corporate couldn't but we weren't allowed too. I was in almost constant fear of losing my job because I was getting 15 people signed up with reward cards in 4 hours when most people already had one or had good excuses for not needing one. Selling demos was a constant concern. someone always had to be outside with the remote control car we were trying to sell in case corporate came by, even when it was scalding hot or freezing outside. and they didn't like us to wear jackets because it covered up our uniforms.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – plan ahead.

review.title: “micro rmanaged”
review.pros: Pros – I enjoy the management team I work with.It would change if these people weren't in these positions.ability to learn a varity of product knowledge.
review.cons: Cons – pay for parttime associates compaired to the responsibilities put on them.their measurement of accountability for associates.micro manages by all the Rules & Regulations,SOP's that put into place.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Company tries to run Toys & Babies business as one.needs to be run as two different Companies.the customers needs are totally different.

review.title: “Good job, depends on management”
review.pros: Pros – - Decent hours- nice people- fun job- decent pay- good management ( depends on store)- ok hours
review.cons: Cons – - schedule not given until day before it takes effect- some managers are jerks- some customers think that you are lower than scum
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - get schedules done earlier- less planogram changes- schedule more people during shifts- pay employees more money

review.title: “Fun but very dissatisfied with management.”
review.pros: Pros – Meeting new people and making new friends. Discounts are not that great but it is better than nothing. Flexible schedules.
review.cons: Cons – Training is not done correctly. Older sales associates treat new ones like garbage and sometimes don't even help you when you ask them.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Okay.”
review.pros: Pros – The feeling of being able to help a couple make their family grow is an awesome feeling and helping guests feel confident in their choices is very rewarding.
review.cons: Cons – The way the company is run is very frustrating and the expectations completely outweigh the rewards. There is no appreciation for how hard employees work.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I think the management of some stores need to take a look back and analyze how they run things and they need to understand that we are all human.

review.title: “Good enough place to build some work exp.”
review.pros: Pros – * Clear cooperation within corporate hierarchy* Management kept tasks on par with my abilities* Good enough camaraderie amongst fellow employees
review.cons: Cons – * Some expectations seemed either unrealistic or not well planned out* Several incidents in the workplace put some employees at odds with each other, and it could've been handled more effectively by management
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Focus on making the company competitive and appealing to customers. Continue to value the concerns of your employees as you had during my tenure.

review.title: “not worth it at all”
review.pros: Pros – people interaction, meeting athletes that donate through non profit organizations by purchases at company
review.cons: Cons – not enough invested in training hours, never enough employees available, unorganized altogether
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – be people oriented and invest time in people by listening, supporting, recognition and pay them well.

review.employee-type: Cash Office Employee/Toys and Gifts Supervisor/Registry (Former Employee)
review.title: “Babies R Us loves to take advantage of hard working employees!”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible hoursFun work environmentGood discount
review.cons: Cons – Will not advance from within
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please hire from within.

review.title: “It's OK. Not the best place.”
review.pros: Pros – It's a stable place to work, but don't expect too many hours if you are part time.
review.cons: Cons – The pay. See advice to Management.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Your "Promotion Matrix" is degrading.How can you want to see "80%" internal promotion, when you offer A LOT LESS money to those internally promoted than to those who come off the streets?*Why hire more and more if you can spare those hours to your part time team members who barely get by with 15hrs a week!!!!

review.title: “Ok to work for if you have the right Manager”
review.pros: Pros – Fun place to work, Customer service is rewarding when you get to know your regular shoppers and new shoppers that turn into regulars. Somewhat flexible hours once the management finishes tricking the system to fit all the employees schedules in. ~~
review.cons: Cons – ~Merchandising changes all the time sometimes too much~Wages should be more than what they are~Black out days occur even for Babies R Us employees even though its not as busy at the holidays~Plan your vacations a year in advance and put in request 2 months or more~Be prepared to learn as much as you can from the associates around you~If you dont know something learn it on your own time~
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – ~Everyone working in corporate should spend at least 40 hours inside a store.~ Focus more on training new and existing employees on products carried in stores. Baby items are a little more complex than you think. Every employee should be trained in installing a carseat.~Management should have more time on the floor leading their team~No one person should close a store 4 nights a week when there is 1 manager and 3 supervisors.

review.title: “So far so Good”
review.pros: Pros – Lots of cross training and opportunities to move around in the storeGood payGood leadership teamGood opportunities to move if you prove yourself to be a good employee
review.cons: Cons – Having to deal with customers who feel the are above all others and should get a different return policyThe schedule not being out early on in the weekHaving to be there for a year to get some of the better benefitsFull-time not being 40+ hours a week but being 32+ hours a week
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Offer the benefits soonerGet the schedule out fasterStop doing resets so oftenOffer more competitive pay to people with experience

review.title: “I have been very happy at Toys R Us.”
review.pros: Pros – The way that my store works with employees' personal lives is most important. And everyone really cares; it is easy to forge friendships. Managers do not suffer from inferiority problems. They recognize team members as intelligent people. There is opportunity to learn and advance if one is willing to work hard and do a good job. This may be specific to my store. Most team members have been there over 5 years, many for more than 20 years. They're doing something right. New managers sent from outside do not last long if they try to lord it over employees or do not pitch in with the hard work.
review.cons: Cons – The pay is miserable. No one should be at any job for 10 years and still be making one dollar over minimum wage, even if it is part time. It can't be that these are such incompetent people that they don't deserve more, or they would have been let go long ago, or driven out. There aren't that many full time positions available. I sometimes don't feel motivated to work because it occurs to me that it isn't necessarily worth it. When the managers ask us to push something to make them look good, we balk at the impertinance of it because we are already undercompensated. Yet no one quits because of the nice atmosphere that can't be found elsewhere. Backstabbing and gossiping, considered typical of retail, stems from the necessity to claw your way up instead of relying on recognition. When corporate heard the complaints, they instituted a "peer recognition" process wherein team members and members of management write little messages on tiny pieces of paper to tape to a bulletin board. So we now have proof who the favorites are, and who stays out of the fray, The latter are usually the awesome employees who still have not received official recognition or advancement because they are too proud and dignified to care about those little pieces of paper. The only pieces of paper many of us would like to see are green and have pictures of presidents on them. There are those who have the manager's ear who, out of competitiveness, knock down other capable employees. That shouldn't be allowed to happen.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Scratch "Peer Recognition". Find out how much your long term employees make, and what they contribute, and compensate them.

review.title: “Good place to work, retail sacrifices must be worth it to you”
review.pros: Pros – Compensation, company stability, experience of senior management.
review.cons: Cons – Usual retail, seasonality creates family time hardships, senior management seems to try to squeeze too much out of limited resources, minimizes impact on employees of extended hours, holidays.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – We're not Wal-Mart or Target. Opening on Thanksgiving or Easter is not productive. What you gain in sales for most extended hours, or 24 hour operation, is negated by associate attitude.

review.title: “Unappreciated”
review.pros: Pros – The people and many customers, good benefits, time off and compensation. As a manager, you are not required to relocate.
review.cons: Cons – No autonomy in making store-level decisions, promotions do not seem to be based on performance and women never get promoted above store manager.I have seen store management get terminated for unsatisfactory job performance, only to be rehired later.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Although this is a family and child oriented company, it is very male dominated. As a female within the company, I don't believe I have any chance for advancement.

review.title: “ok, if you don't seeing your family at christmas”
review.pros: Pros – they pay well if you sacrafice, working with kids is fun, amazing corporate office, very recognized brand, easy during summer
review.cons: Cons – very poor HR, staffing plans regularly fail, Just get through the holidays mentality, poor training, senior management only interested in "CYA"
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Lead time for projects in store in non-existant, senior management thinks the store operate at higher level than they actually do

review.title: “Okay!”
review.pros: Pros – Store management surpasses my expectation for a retail job.
review.cons: Cons – My store never has the schedule done on time
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Worst Experience of My Life”
review.pros: Pros – The pay was good at first because the company wanted to lure managers in to work for their lousy company. However, once I got promoted, the pay was not where it should have been as a manager and they were not willing to negotiate.The customers are generally a good crowd. The only thing that kept me going to work each day was knowing I could see little kids or babies have a smile on their face and get what they wanted/needed from the store. Some parents were nice. Some were mean and rude, as with anyone other people who shop at big box retail stores.Getting to know about new toys coming out is also somewhat exciting.
review.cons: Cons – Pretty much everything. Where shall I start?The company is very old school. In college, we learned about "the good old boys" club and how that mentality used to rule Corporate America. I thought that was the way of the dark ages of business, but this is still the way things run at Toys R Us/Babies R Us. If you aren't "in" with the good old boys, then you are definitely "out" and by that I mean they will find a way to push you out if you don't kiss their rear ends in every which way and lie to their faces about how much you and your team can accomplish. Most of the people who are in upper management (District level and above) presently are people who worked at Toys/Babies before it was bought out, so they go promoted on the old school way of doing things and have no idea what it's like to work in the stores nowadays.As a manager, you are given very little training when hired. My training period consisted of me reading the outdated training materials on my own and spending 4 weeks trying to figure out their very archaic ways of doing things on the intranet and store systems. Oh yes, and don't forget about their millions (OK, sorry, I'm exaggerating, I mean thousands) of "Standard Operating Procedures" or "SOPs" as they call them. You'd better get an early start on reading all of those people, even though upper management doesn't even know what's in them, you better know! Oh, and don't be surprised when many of them are incorrect or haven't been updated in years.Coming from another big box retailer who was a bit more advanced in technology, I felt like I was going back to the 80's or 90's when I started working with Toys R Us. They make very little investment in their stores technology and building maintenence and it definitely shows. One store I worked at had cockroaches and mice. Fabulous. But, don't spend too much money on Service Channel trying to get things fixed up around the store because you will blow your entire budget and basically you will run out of basic supplies like toilet paper on a regular basis, even though you've already put an order in weeks ago. The tech help desk is headquarted in India and regularly takes days to call you back.Also, there's no money budgeted for employee morale at all. If you want to buy a soda for a team members for getting 20 instant credits in a week, you better pull out your wallet! Or better yet, use your last reem of copy paper to print out cheesy peer recognition cards and write them on of those! Hip Hip Hooray! The pay for the employees is very low. You can't offer starting pay above minimum wage unless you are hiring for a speciality position or higher. So, a high school kid taking his first job gets the same as a 50 year old who'se been a cashier at WalMart for 20 years. Lastly, if you are a store manager, be prepared to have some of the most incompetent assistant managers you've ever worked with. They will also want to leave right at their 8 hour mark, or maybe even earlier, on a daily basis. But, not you, you get to stay and work on the schedule until the store closes! That's why you get paid the big bucks, right? Why would any company put a Store Manager of a big box, multi-million dollar store on schedule duty? A schedule usually takes 8+ hours to write if you are doing a decent job. Why would you have your highest paid employee spending that time in the office when they could be on the floor leading?Many of the managers who were there when I was hired left the company within the year I worked for them. Many of them couldn't handle the changes and pressure coming from corporate. Most of us managers had no life outside of work. I consistently worked 12-16 hours a day, sometimes more, to get my job even somewhat done. The reason this happens is because there is not a good training system set up for employees. I created many things for my team, such as "buddy training" on the cash register because Toys/Babies doesn't even have a consistent way to train new people on the cash register. They not only throw the management in with no training, they do it across the board. Also, you will be training a lot of people because if you are a decent manager, you will create some movement when you come in to the store. So, on top of trying to turn around one of their many "broken" stores, you will be training lots of new people with very limited resources on top of your regular duties.If you are lucky to get some tenured team members on your staff when you come in as a manager, be prepared for lots of push back from tenured people who want to challenge any of your ideas and who have no remorse for reporting you to the 1800 hotline for HR. Oh, and don't trust HR either, because they will turn their back on you faster than lightning. It's pretty much every manager for themselves, unless you can find a couple other managers who are just as unhappy as you are who you can vent to on a weekly basis (a common call I received each week from a few of my coworkers).So, if you don't deliver the results they want within a couple months, be prepared to start getting written up and talked about by upper management. They have no compassion at all for throwing managers into "broken" and underperforming stores and expecting you to turn it around and undo years of damage in 2-3 months with no additional resources. You will need to come in under payroll and get at least an 80 on your weekly metric scorecard. Oh, and many of the "favorites" of the store managers are the ones who cheat on the metrics yet somehow fly under the radar.Toys R Us would like to think they are progressing. They have come up with the Guest Service Leader (GSL) program, which is an engaged MOD program that requires a key holder to be on the floor with a clipboard and performing 'coachings" and such at all times. However, they do not execute these programs well at all. In fact, they fail at launching the programs but yet expect store teams to follow through with them seamlessly. The same thing happened when they launched a new truck unloading process, a new price change process, and many other major processes they attempted to launch, yet provided no resources for stores to learn them. This is essentially digging their stores into deeper holes.Basically, my advice to you if you are considering becoming a manager with Toys R Us or Babies R Us is to RUN like the wind FAR away from this place. DO NOT be lured in by their offer of a higher salary or advancement opportunities. Well, unless you subscribe to the "good old boy" mentality. Some new hires who I would consider major tools somehow are still there. But, if you aren't a major tool and actually want to have a life in the near future, stay away.I have a college degree, four plus years of management, an IQ of 165, got promoted with this company in less than 3 months, worked my rear end off every single day down to my last day, yet somehow I got the strong feeling I wasn't good enough for Toys R Us/Babies R Us when it all boiled down to it. I threw a year of my life a way and wish I would have just said no to it all. It was a horrible experience. I wish I had listened to the former employees who told me not to join this company when I got the offer.Trust me, I am not the only one...I know at least a dozen other former managers who are really, really good managers and friends, who were high achievers at their previous, well-known Big Box companies, who quit and I know even more who are looking for employment elsewhere. Many of them want to go back to where they came from. You are probably better off just staying where you are. Anything is better than Toys R Us/Babies R Us.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I will be thoroughly surprised if Toys R Us is successful in the coming years. They are under some really poor direction and management throughout the entire company. I suspect this is the reason they almost went bankrupt once. I wouldn't be surprised if they go bankrupt again. If upper management really cared, the would spend some quality time in their stores and not be judgemental of the management. They should actually be hands on, help unload a truck. Help out with apparel and see how hard it is to run that department with 48 hours a week. Work on a busy Saturday in Baby Gear or Electronics by yourself and see how messed up the ads really are. There are so many things I could say, but why? They will continue to demande store management to put on a one horse show for them on their quick walkthroughs while they text away about lunch plans or Buy Buy Baby spy-sessions on their company Blackberrys.Oh yes, and Buy Buy Baby really is a better store in so many ways than Babies R Us. I wish I could have just said that to the upper management on my last day working there.Any rational company would attempt to retain newly hired managers and long-term managers. It is a very well known fact that hiring and training new people is a very expensive and time-consuming process. Yet, if you do a search for jobs on their career page, you will constantly see that they are hiring for managers in every area of the country all the time. This is because they do not care about retention. They believe management, just like hourly team members, are disposable and replaceable. It is the most backwards way of thinking and doing business I have ever seen in retail and in general. The way this company is being run is virtually insane.

review.title: “Crap”
review.pros: Pros – Work along with your school schedule.Helping costumersCant think of anything else to say that is good about this company
review.cons: Cons – Very Very low pay (after being there 3 years make below $8)Only get hours if can make metrics to give Manager their bonusManagement does not careFavoritism is the major player with managersManagement treats you like dirtfraternization is all over and nobody does anythingCant trust the managementno respect from the management
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – managers that care and respect the associatesClean up the managementhigher paystop giving chances just get rid of them!!

review.title: “It is a paycheck, but just passing time dead end job”
review.pros: Pros – Most of the other employees are a blast and fun to be around.They are a good reason to go to work every day.
review.cons: Cons – There is a lack of communication between management and employees.There is no discipline of lazy workers which is very demoralizing especially when you are trying to do a good job and busting your backside trying to compensate for the rest.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Let the people do there jobs and don't make the good employees have to do the bad employees jobs above and beyond there own jobs.If this was done the whole over all out look of the employees would be so much better and there would be so much less resentment..

review.title: “Toys R Us was a pretty good place to work at.”
review.pros: Pros – -It's really easy and laid back. It's definitely not a hard job at all.-you learn a lot about toys.
review.cons: Cons – - You're not really trained properly if you're a seasonal employee. In the express stores, a lot of jobs are thrown at you.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Run your sales and coupons a lot better. So many people will come into the store and are totally confused about the sales and what they can use coupons on.

review.title: “DONâT DO IT!”
review.pros: Pros – Except for seeing the smiles on the kids faces, there are none that I can think of. The awesome 10% discount you get won’t even offset the cost of sales tax in most places.
review.cons: Cons – Lousy store level management. On paper I am a Department Supervisor, in reality I am nothing more than a high paid lackey for the Store Manager to blame her professional short comings on. In my short time with this company I have been subjected to so many different levels of incompetence that it boggles the mind. I was written up on my first day for violating the company’s meal policy. I was counseled for wearing a pair of pants that did not meet the company’s dress code. Ironically enough it was the same pair of pants I had on when I interviewed (as a current employee) with the District Manager and the Regional HR Manager for a new position.I have had a store manager that dressed me down over the walkie talkies that we carry allowing any employee and customer in the store to hear it. I’m still owed over $500.00 in insurance premiums that were wrongly taken from my paycheck and over $1,100.00 in travel expenses that were never reimbursed but submitted 3 times. My hours were cut from 40 to 29 per week after Christmas yet I am still considered “Full Time” because they will only cut them for a period of about 12 weeks. I have seen employees with BA and BS degrees in Business Management and years of management experience denied a promotion or full time employment so a person with 2 years with the company could have the job.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get your lazy butts off of the soft upholstery and get into the stores to see what is really going on. Stop announcing your visits weeks in advance and just drop in. Your regional managers and district managers have yet to see how a store is actually run.Stop thinking that you are the end all and be all of the toy market. You are nothing more than another big-box retailer, period. You could learn a lot from other retail management if you would climb down off your high horse and listen to the men and women you hire externally.When you hire a full-time employee externally treat them as a professional. It is hard to justify why you are cutting the hours of your Dept. Supervisors and Asst. Managers by saying hours are not available when we see part time employees getting 25-30 hours a week.Try using some useful tools like exit interviews when employees leave. Maybe if you saw why they were running like rats leaving a sinking ship you could do something to stem the flow. Standardize your promotion requirements and training for new employees. If you ask 3 different Human Resources

review.title: “This job is best kept as a short term gig.”
review.pros: Pros – Some cool peopleDiscount is decentFirst crack at alot of hot items before they sell outHiring process is quick
review.cons: Cons – Discount cant be used on game systems or ipodsForce to push stupid metrics, no one want another credit card in this economyGood work is never appreciated, bad work is always brought upAfter the daily focus meeting(which is not needed every morning) its pretty clear if they could just address you by your employee number they would.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Show that you actually care about your hourly employees, cause anyone with a brain will wise up and find something better.

review.title: “Not hard work but unfulfilling and poor management”
review.pros: Pros – -Several of my fellow employees were nice--Got the number of hours I requested-General work environment was not bad.
review.cons: Cons – -very little training- I was seasonal but some of the permanent employees had this problem too- (I never did get to learn how to use the sapphire...)-As a seasonal employee, you are basically told that you have 0% chance of staying if you can't get absurd numbers on card sign ups and such. This made me had very little desire to put forth my best effort in my work-Management doesn't care about you at all- I was out working the floor for 6 hours straight and was wondering when I would finally get my lunch; as it turned out they forgot that I was even there. (And forgot my name to boot) I know I was seasonal but that's still very unprofessional.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You are expected to just sort of figure out everything as you go along which, may be fine for some jobs, but when you are trying to help or check out customers, speed and accuracy are required for the customer to not get angry- I would advise Management to spend more time training their employeesAlso, seasonal employees are your employees too- you should take time to at least learn their names. I often felt like an outsider at TRU- if you were to make seasonal employees feel more welcome, they may actually pull those crazy sign up numbers.

review.title: “Overworked, underpaid, terrible benefits”
review.pros: Pros – Big company with lots of job opportunitiesCompany encourages job movementSummer Fridays - get out at 1pm (officially) - not that anyone actually leaves at that time
review.cons: Cons – Long hours - officially 8:30 - 5:30, but most people work much more than that, lunch hour is unpaidMedical benefits are the WORSTPay is averageMost people work through sick days - they will work from home and be on constant conference callsCompany does not respect sick daysCompany is a revolving door; a lot of turnover; very messy place to workTend to hire anyone with a pulse - not really ensuring if prospective hire is a good fitInterview process is very odd - series of short 30 minute interviews; no second interviewsRetail is a tough industry - margins are razor thin, and company is hyperfocused on keeping expenses down
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Show that you value your employees and the personal sacrifices they make for workRespect employee sick daysImprove benefits; employee premium is much too highReview and rethink self-imposed deadlines and driving relentlessly towards them (to what end??)

review.title: “Employee = Nothing but a number”
review.pros: Pros – Laid back atmosphere, flexible hours
review.cons: Cons – Low pay, lack of communication from management. Overworking staff and keeping stores open to late around holiday times. No concern for employees, they are disposable. Due to that, fact Morale is low turn around is high. No recognition for top performers
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Learn the job that your staffers are performing so that you can effectively ' Manage" aka Lead them

review.title: “Challenging career with high demands.”
review.pros: Pros – As a salaried manager, you have a steady income and benefits to include 401K, medical, dental, vision, and bonus opportunities.
review.cons: Cons – High pressure to meet unrealistic goals which gives you the feeling, if you don't meet those goals, you will lose your job. As a Manager, your told to hire more associates your budget can support, then you are reprimanded for exceeding hours. While you are being told to cut back on hours, the company extends store operating hours, increases the daily work load beyond capacity, and expects you to have certain number of associates working at specific times but when you add up all the hours you are "told" to use, you find yourself over hours. This is a recipe for failure. I was working 12 to 14 hours a day 6 to 7 days a week to try to meet the company's expectations but it was never enough.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Go back to caring about your employee's. Toys R Us was a great place to work but it's obvious your taking full advantage of the "Employers" Market and have lost sight of what's truly important for a company to have long term success. Take care of your employee's and they will take care of you.

review.title: “Terrible Job, I ever have in my life!”
review.pros: Pros – - coworkers are friendlynothing more
review.cons: Cons – - managers get mad when you ask for breaks- have to do so much in a time ( asking the phone, return, cash) make it really hard on us and customer wait too long- you have to sell BPP(rip off plans)if not you will call to the office and your hours will be cut- suppose to off at 9:30pm after a tired shift, but the managers lock all the doors and keep us till 10:00 to clean up the store, never ask an employee are they willing to do so!!!- Managers get mad for over ride, say bad words over the phone when a customer wants to talk to them (all managers having partyin their office)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – the plan itself is pointless the company only wants to make money and does not care the customers, the ppl who bought BPP are nice customers but the company still want to rip them, how sad, I will quit soon because I dont want to rip off nice people like u do. I am human I have heart!!!

review.title: “The management was very unprofessional and inexperienced.”
review.pros: Pros – Great range of people to work withDiverse environmentYou get to be around childrenRegular retail hoursStore is spacious
review.cons: Cons – Management was horribleDespite listing it as a pro, some of the children were not well-behavedCustomers were sometimes very anal or hormonal
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Store and company management should be put through continual training on how to manage and direct their employees.. or even themselves.

review.title: “pretty good place to work for a first job”
review.pros: Pros – - friendly staff and customers- easy work
review.cons: Cons – - hours were not the best- little training
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - more emphasis on training

review.title: “Disappointed working there”
review.pros: Pros – Can get over time in busy periods
review.cons: Cons – No progress opportunities, not treat well by management
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give people a chance and treat them fairly

review.title: “Location, location, location”
review.pros: Pros – Honestly, I know their are better (..far better) locations that the location I worked at. If you can find one that doesn't have any of the cons listed, you might really enjoy the job.
review.cons: Cons – The managers were extremely noticeable with their 'favorites' of the crew. The crew themselves were -all- fresh out of high school teenagers. It always seemed they never wanted to help you out with any questions or they just 'didn't know' (even if they had been working there for a few years.)The training itself was so poor and informal that you'd just end up feeling beyond frustrated. You'd do something, feel good about it, then they'd tell you it was completely wrong. You never knew what to do cause the training was nonexistent.The store location was in really bad shape. One could tell it had once been a grand store but, it was severally lacking and the store was quite messy.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More training, more mature staff that work as a team and, closely looking at the managers running the location since they're the ones making the decisions.

review.title: “It's ok for the holiday season.”
review.pros: Pros – It's a fun place to work, if you don't mind the kids using it as a playground and having to pick up behind them and their parents. Only a seasonal job, though.
review.cons: Cons – Pay could be better. I always thought that retail employees get the short end of the stick anyway.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be nice to your employees and they'll be nice to you.

review.title: “You can do MUCH better!”
review.pros: Pros – Co-workers were amazing and were the only reason I stayed there as long as I did.
review.cons: Cons – Very negative environment. Focuses on the one thing you didn't do instead of the hundreds of things you accomplished. Favoritism among management and bad judgment in promoting. Management rude and condescending. Issues repeatedly brought to manager not resolved. Pay is minimum wage and yearly raises are as small as possible if given at all. Overworked, underpaid, and scolded daily. You can do better than to work here.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Read my "Cons" and realize that this company will never truly thrive with quality people unless this all changes.

review.title: “ok”
review.pros: Pros – fun, easy money, get to goof off
review.cons: Cons – no hours, favoritism, selling reward cards, getting yelled at for not selling rewards cards
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat everyone equally and tell people what they are doing wrong/right more often.

review.title: “Experience with Toys "R" Us”
review.pros: Pros – Toys "R" Us had a great work environment. Their process of checking out was very efficient and easy to use.
review.cons: Cons – There wasn't a lot of communication between managment and employees. There also wasn't much guidence when I started from anyone.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I think you should give you new employees a little more advice and direction. Other than that I don't have any complaints.

review.title: “decent place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Excellent benefits package. The health insurance coverage is exceptionally good for retail insurance. They also have been very good about work-life balance.
review.cons: Cons – There's absolutely no recognition from senior leadership for doing a good job. The senior management sets unrealistic goals and you're a bad manager if you don't achieve them.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Set realistic goals and expectations for the store management team, and understand that Babies R Us is a completely different business and customer base than Toys R Us.

review.title: “it's only a good job if you're seasonal”
review.pros: Pros – i do like my management team, they are very helpful and knowledgeable. my team is also very flexible wiht scheduling if time off work is needed. the people i work with make work more enjoyable as well.
review.cons: Cons – hmm...i don't know where to start. TRU is not a family oriented company whatsoever. The hours we work during Christmas are ridiculous. At one point during season, our store will be open till 1am! It's not necessary at all. Plus, the company has taken a lot of holiday time away from us. We are now open on Easter - I guess religious holidays are no longer important, and we are opening late on Thanksgiving nite, and on Christmas Eve, we are open till 9! Hey corporate!!!!! We have families too!!!! If you compare pay from TRU to other retails, it's pretty crappy!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I have no complaints about members of management in my store. They do their best with what's given them. Corporate morons who are running the company, however, need to sit back and re-evaluate the situation. They are working people to the bone for crap pay and crap benefits.

review.title: “NOOOOOOOOO”
review.pros: Pros – Management is always there to help you out.
review.cons: Cons – Only get nine hours a week! When I first started they only gave me four hours a week!!!! Why did they hire me in the first place? Waste of my time and gas!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need to come up with a better way to train new members! Training is very unorganized! Split your hours evenly to all associates! If I knew I was gonna be scheduled two days out of the week I wouln't have wasted my time fillilng out the application

review.title: “Good but needs improvement”
review.pros: Pros – Good work force, good benefits for start up job
review.cons: Cons – No advancement, need fairness in choosing employee of month
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Lead better

review.title: “Great improvements, still have opportunity”
review.pros: Pros – Great salary, going public soon, doing what it takes to change for the better
review.cons: Cons – Good old boy advancement methods, will black ball you if you say too much, and will not give you genuine feedback to promote
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – If your an external hire into a SM position, you will FAIL!! Demand feedback, training sucks so watch your back!

review.title: “One year is enough!”
review.pros: Pros – The co-workers are very friendly and do want to teach you and help you out. Even the supervisors are like your friend, except the managers definitely divide themselves among the rest of "us" since they are not supposed to be seen too friendly or even to be hanging out with us outside of work.
review.cons: Cons – Most of the time, the store is understaffed because the company is trying save payroll so 5-6 people working in a store is not a surprising thing. Thus, the management expects you to do everything and anything even though you have 6-10 tasks on your plate already. OH! There are usually five different promotions that an employee HAS to sell to customers at the same time so the customers feel bombarded. If you do not offer or tell ALL the promotions to EACH customer, the management will have a "talk" with you.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – HIRE MORE PEOPLE WHEN IT'S NEEDED!!!! ESPECIALLY DURING WEEKENDS!!!!! Customers always complain about bad customer service and not enough products on the floor is because we are understaffed most of the time!

review.title: “An Okay Place to Work”
review.pros: Pros – -Everyone that works there is friendly.-Flexible hours-Management always honors requests off when they're on time-Relatively easy job
review.cons: Cons – -Guests are typically very condescending and rude, which gets old.-There's often times little to no coverage when the registers are backed up, or you need to go on lunch.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – -Train employees in a few different departments to make them more knowledgeable, and train everyone as a cashier for back up.-Don't let every guest that throws a fit get their way when it's against the company's policy.-Implement a drug test for incoming employees.

review.title: “TRU”
review.pros: Pros – TRU pays a little more than minimum wage which can be a good thing to those without other jobs and want to make more than the bare minimum.
review.cons: Cons – Opportunities to rise in this company are as good as they claim. TRU have a bunch of loyal employees however these employees have been cashiers and stockboys for over 16 yrs.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management at TRU is real good. They are professional and really know how to run a store. Only issue with the managers is the favoritism of employees.

review.title: “ok”
review.pros: Pros – discountatmospherenice coworkersgood hoursnice people
review.cons: Cons – to much pressure on promos(rewards,batteries,bpp,instant credit)discount could be betterlong hours- short breakssale prices often do not ring correctlywayyy outdated registersnot enough registers open
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – dont put so much pressure on promos, us employees would be able to provide a much better expericence without pressure

review.title: “If you love back stabbing and harassment is you cup of tea,work here !!!”
review.pros: Pros – Meeting new people,small room for growth.
review.cons: Cons – This company allows backstabbing and rewards harassment,by getting rid of the employees who report it. They are only interseted in shady non productive people to work for them. Management are unprofessional,talk dirt behind everyones back. They put pressure on making your numbers,but dont want to invest the training so you have the tools to be successful. The pay stinks,and so do the hours for most people.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Become more professional,treat people as humans not dirt,respect is a two way street.

review.title: “Mixed Messages from corporate”
review.pros: Pros – the catch phrase is "Great Place to Work" and the Regional staff is excited to promote this. Benefits are decent and it's a good atmosphere to meet people. Try to make improvements occasionally to help customer service
review.cons: Cons – Like most retail it can get very hectic. This anxiety is made worse though by the corporate mentality of a new project every couple of days. Once you are done resetting something, corporate will have you completely change the program.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Prove it is a great place to work by showing your management staff you appreciate them. As associates we can see when they get over stressed and it effects our work too.

review.title: “Its an okay place”
review.pros: Pros – Some really good people work there, most of the supervisors are easy to get along with. Customers arent as bad there either.
review.cons: Cons – Some times management dont cooperate wtih each other on a daily basis, so its hard to get things done. Some times it takes a while to train someone also.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Its an overall good place to work, but some days it feels like its just about to fall apart. Some people do alot of work compared to others.

review.title: “Its okay”
review.pros: Pros – -Friendly co workers-Flexible schedule-Good place to work if you like toys and kids
review.cons: Cons – -Too many annoying questions to ask-Pressure to sale batteries, exteneded warranty, and get rewards cards
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – get rid of the questions are at least stop the five dollar gift card

review.title: “Not bad for an entry level retail position. You get a good general understanding of how a retail chain works.”
review.pros: Pros – Good with time off requesteasy to learn taskgood co worker environment
review.cons: Cons – sometimes customers are not too friendlyimpossible to learn all of the productyou deal with kids and parents
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It has a good overall system. Maybe more incentives for every day employees

review.title: “Good Place to Work”
review.pros: Pros – You are given the ability to grow within the company. The training is available if you seek it out. It is a fair place to work.
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes it is hard to get enough hours. The company tends to overhire. Especially during the Christmas season. The raises could be better.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take the time to get to know each person for themselves. Utilize their individual strengths. Don't hire as many people during the holidays.

review.title: “toys r us”
review.pros: Pros – interesting people,good mix of male and female employeesgood pay and benefitsflexible schedulethe bad managers usually end up leaving
review.cons: Cons – tiring, physical work especially in back roomthe occasional difficult managercondescending,hostile managementlack of regular raisesoverwork and burnout at Christmas
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – show more respect to regular employees , especially ones who have been there a long time.performance based raises instead of raises for management favorites

review.title: “it's a job”
review.pros: Pros – I feel like I am part of something important. I work hard and receive about 10 - 12 more hours per week than other part time associates. This causes a little resentment but I can do nothing to help that.
review.cons: Cons – Noisy crying children. Low pay. Lack of inventory to satisfy baby registry shoppers. The work is harder than for what is compensated but i suppose that's why i get more hours than the others.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop stressing metrics. At the end of the day these places are making bank. Hire a security guard for the holiday season.

review.employee-type: Day Time Sales Associate, Stocker (Current Employee)
review.title: “Current Facts on Toys "R" Us”
review.pros: Pros – Good Entry Level Job;Friendly employees;Company Info discussed at daily store meetings; Team work used to get jobs done.
review.cons: Cons – Little to no training depending on occupation;Working hours vary on sales every week, Meaning "No sales, No hours"
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Inforce an actual training cordinator. So potential employees that can benifit the company won't leave. Please Make it fair.

review.title: “Don't Work Here Unless You Have To”
review.pros: Pros – The flexibility of scheduling allows part-timers to be off when they need to be. Most of the associates are friendly.
review.cons: Cons – After the Christmas season hours are cut to the bone. Sometimes there is only one person on the salesfloor. Part-timers get 8-12 hours a week (if they're lucky) until business picks up in the spring. Fewer associates working adds up to fewer and fewer people doing more and more work.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – If you're going to carry apparel, get serious about it. The signage is a joke.Have some kind of training supervisor in the stores. I have a D.S. in Juvenile/Apparel who has never been trained and doesn't have the sense to know that certain things need to go on racks by price point, and couldn't completely sign an ad if her life depended on it.

review.title: “Eh...”
review.pros: Pros – If your a guy, hot moms. If your a lady, hot dads. Haha.Cute kids who are often unintentionally hilarious. They REALLY appreciate what they purchase!Popular w/family and friends w/children who want to use your 10 percent discount haha.Can make lifelong or at least good friends while working there (as well as have romance).I'd agree that the schedules are pretty flexible.
review.cons: Cons – Asking the same 7 questions over and over and over again (wanna sign up for an tru credit card? wanna extended warranty with that? do u need batteries today? do u need gift receipts today? would u like to donate to (fill charity in here)? do you have a rewards card or would you like to sign up for one? what's your phone number? your also supposed to ask about if their kids are part of a birthday club tru has, but that one's not as enforced as the prior seven.No communication whatsoever when it comes to changes and new policies or promotions or whatever. Your pretty much on your own there.The intense pressure management puts on you to get five credit card sign ups, seven rewards cards, five buyer protections plans, etc. EVERY FRIGGIN DAY! There's almost always subtle hints that if you let them down your stock will go down on the team (ala less scheduling).Why is TRU too cheap to hire a greeter/security guard? It's no suprise shrinkage is pretty bad compared to Wal Mart or Target.Why can't TRU order products online to be shipped for customers to their stores like B&N does?Because it's a toy store, when adults get upset at an employee it's always worse because of kids disappointments compared to an adult buying something for themself at like Macys or something.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get rid of the 7 questions (or stop with the free 5 dollar gift card if you don't ask) as not to force employee's to keep saying the same stuff over and over (and seriously, why do you have to ask somebody buying a barbie if it needs batteries?). If anything, stop the five dollar gift card for not asking and bring it down to four questions (credit card, rewards card, gift receipts, donations).Everybody is stressed out because it's next to impossible to get five people in one day to sign up for a credit card, and if they don't then their scheduled hours will go down for next week. Unrealistic expectations! I also notice that store management gets horribly chewed out by corporate for not making metrics and that affects how they treat their crew.Employee discounts could be much better; how about 20% instead of 10% off? We work hard enough for it IMHO.

review.title: “Not Bad, Not Great”
review.pros: Pros – Great insurance at Toys r Us. Starting salaries are respectable, raises are sad. Great People and Great Friendships can be made.
review.cons: Cons – Raises are a joke at Toys r Us. The management can be very backwards at times. Sometimes DM and Managers will tell you different things.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Better communication with the supervisors. Don't open your mouth just to hear the sound of your own voice. Almost good.

review.title: “Good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Toys are Us is a company that has had trouble in the past but in the last few years it has been heading in a great new and exciting direction.
review.cons: Cons – The company will do a great job recruiting you if you are truly worth recruiting but they do not give you clear direction on where you may end up working.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – To keep strong which its recruiting efforts. We have been looking for recent college grads and I think this will payoff with the company.

review.title: “Good with a management team that works together. Bad when they don't.”
review.pros: Pros – Fun place to work. Making people happy. training new hires
review.cons: Cons – Extremely low compensation for internal promotions. External hires very well paid while experienced employees get paltry increases even for good reviews.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I love the company and it is going in the right direction within the past 3 years but the internal promotions and advancement for employees is lacking.

review.title: “Professionalism is optional”
review.pros: Pros – I'm pretty much blinded by the blatant inconsideration and unprofesionalism of upper management. So at this point I have very little to say, but I'll try.... some of the other employees are nice and they do offer a decent benefits package (of which I, personally, have no need for).
review.cons: Cons – There is no follow through or folow up on anything.35 hours a week- that's a joke. I work minimum of 40 hours and am told that I need to work on my days off (note the "told" and not "asked") then am made to feel badly when I go over 40 hours. I haven't been able to leave on time since I started. (about 2 months ago)I was told each day would be the same. Yeah right... I haven't had any consistancy to my responsibilities or tasks.My boss has been nice enough to point out that I'm not needed- the store would be just fine if I didn't work there at all. Wow, way to boost morale! He also likes to call my direct reports on his day off to have them give me my daily tasks and also share how he feels about me personally.I've walked in the breakroom while he's gossiping about me to employees that report to me.To make things really fun, a long-term p/t employee was just written up because upper management doesn't want her there anymore.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Employees don't quit their job- hey quit their boss.

review.title: “be careful”
review.pros: Pros – erm. not sure really. there arent that many. the training scheme is very very very tough, so other retailers respect that in terms of getting a job after.
review.cons: Cons – no personal life. no free time. awful pay. awful working conditions. no praise. can expect you to do 30+ hour shifts. no care for other commitments. will happily make you commute. promotions are to favored people not always the best.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – i have no advice for them.

review.title: “Manger in sales mood”
review.pros: Pros – 1. Good pay and bonuses2. Scheduling3. Morale4. Fun and energetic place to work
review.cons: Cons – 1. Too many hours2. Long shifts / min breaks3. More encouregement from upper Mgmt
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Learn to grow, nourish, and develop your employees in being a better associate for company.

review.title: “Overall, great environment, but VERY corporate”
review.pros: Pros – Friendly, positive, casual work environment that is very corporate. For the most part, everyone is treated fairly and everything runs smoothly.
review.cons: Cons – Extremely corporate in the sense that every policy feels strictly by the book. I'm sure other companies are like this, but salary increases from promotions within are much lower than getting hired from outside.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Toys stresses leadership and growth, especially for the young employees fresh out of college. They make it a point to desiring to keep there talent, but don't necessarily compensate them based on that motto.

review.title: “Serious disappointment, but what else is there”
review.pros: Pros – It's easy to get hired seasonally, and if you work hard enough you can pretty much assume they will keep you.
review.cons: Cons – You get terrible pay, little or no training and are expected to achieve ridiculous metrics regardless of opportunities. The place makes me sad
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do you have any idea of what happens in your store? The hardest work is to prepare for the corporate visits, rather than for the guests! your working hard to impress yourself!

review.title: “Internal Cost Cutter, and It Shows”
review.pros: Pros – Fairly flexible with your schedule (except around Christmas time,) many really great leaders to learn from, lots of great people working at the store level.
review.cons: Cons – The company has taken to cutting every corner possible to avoid spending money. The stores are perpetually forced to run on a skeleton staff and then ridiculed by senior management when customer service is below expectations.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – If you want to have stores that focus on cost saving, don't expect customer service. If you want the stores to focus on service, don't expect it to be done without costing money.

review.title: “The good ol' days”
review.pros: Pros – If you enjoy working with toys, games, and being around kids...this is the place for you! Overall, TRU was a pretty good place to work for.
review.cons: Cons – The only things I disliked about my job were messy customers, and this whole metrics program (BPP, TRU Credit Card).
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Step out of the office sometimes and interact with the guest. How can you push excellent customer service on the staff if you can't step out on the floor and lead by example from time to time.

review.title: “Not a job you want”
review.pros: Pros – DiscountCould be fun environment on certain days or shifts with certain coworkersDoesn't require much brain powerHR work probably the best position
review.cons: Cons – The corporate bottom line is passed down the chain, at each step you are taking the heat that the people above you should be taking. It makes the overall environment rather dreadful.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Remember that the people are what make the business. While your bottom line is obviously important, the human component is what will make the business successful.

review.title: “Good place for seasonal work”
review.pros: Pros – Good place for Seasonal work, easy to learn the procedures and time goes fast because it is busy. Once the work day is over, you do not have anything hanging over your head.
review.cons: Cons – It took a long time to get from the application process to starting work and my employment ended without warning when they finished with me.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management was involved and was on the floor working with everyone else. A little more communications with employees would be nice.

review.title: “Not the same company”
review.pros: Pros – Good benefits. some supervisors are great, training getting much better, original babies r us team had better overall leaders in comparison
review.cons: Cons – No sense of planning from senior leadership, no sense of what to do to engage a team member from senior leadership...very disconnected at field leadership level. It's all about "I"..no sense of team.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Actually interact , speak with and get advice with the real people in the stores day in and day out..this is for the senior leadership...regional teams try to do good job

review.title: “Fantastic”
review.pros: Pros – If you love retail...this is a great place with great products
review.cons: Cons – hours are not set and that would help
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Work on a set schedule

review.title: “They Shut Down The Entire Marketing Dept.without notice!”
review.pros: Pros – Being able to make your own schedule.Being able to attend and direct fun events.You are only in the retail location a few times a week.You are responsible for you progress.
review.cons: Cons – Management was unorganized and often mean to their teams.Lots of favoritism.Inadequate conference calls.Marketing team never got to relate to in-store employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire managers that are respectful and appreciative of their teams.

review.title: “Don't be a Toys R Us Kid!”
review.pros: Pros – Time off was earned at a fairly decent rate.My Employees made a bad job fun.Enjoyed seeing the little kids happy.
review.cons: Cons – No support from upper management. Very little quality of life. There is no excuse for how many hours we worked during season. Never enough product to "Set the Ads" and customers acted like it was your fault.A dying comany that is taking it's staff down with it.Corporate continues to change it's direction too often.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Ensure you have product to fulfill your advertising. It is degrading to your staff to constantly be belittle by customers that act like the store's management team is at fault. Do not announce upper management visits, you will never stop seeing what you want to see. Instead, stop by unanmnounced on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon and see what it is like for managers running on no hours.

review.title: “Good place to go if you need some extra cash around Christmas, but that's it.”
review.pros: Pros – Well, the hours are excellent during the Christmas season. Some complain about the long days and frequent calls of "Can you come in?" but as a poor college student, the extra income was nice.The other coworkers who are seasonal are usually pretty fun to work with.The pay is not good, but it's not bad. It's minimum wage, but honestly what else can you expect starting out in a place like this?SOMETIMES you get really nice customers who are easy to talk to you and thank you genuinely for your help.
review.cons: Cons – Employees who are not seasonal - who are full-time or regular - generally treat you like dirt. The managers don't really treat you like anything, since they are always holed up in their locked offices.The amount of training given to new seasonal employees is basically non-existent. I had to teach myself how to use the cash registers, which really belong in an antique store. One day during my shift I came in and found that I was scheduled to work the floor, I had no idea what I was supposed to do. I asked the manager and she told me to basically walk around the store. ??You will probably have to come in at an ungodly hour on Black Friday.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Train your employees. Even if they're seasonal and only gonna be there for a couple of months, those are the busiest months of your year and you certainly don't want to tick off customers who may just decide to show up in June and give you some business.

review.title: “Lots of sales pressure for only a $8.50 job.”
review.pros: Pros – I like working around mothers to be and babies, and they really help train you to learn the products that they sell. Many of the people who work her are a more mature crowd other retail jobs. Management lets you know what is expected of you, and it is nice to have concrete goals.
review.cons: Cons – Lots of pressure from management to sell buyer protection plans, batteries, and to sign people up for thier loyalty card. While I like having defined goals, I feel like management doesn't appreciate a genuine effort when people aren't interested in buying the items that you are supposed to push. It really is a high-pressure sales job environment, for just above minimum wage. Also, they have many advertised promotions that actually aren't honored half the time, so I feel really bad for the customers that drove a long distance for a deal that was misleading or doesn't exist. The cash registers are from the 70's, or 80's, and require a manager overide for nearly everything. I find myself paging a manager every five minutes, then the poor customer has to wait.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Update your registers to the current century, and have your prices match the fliers.

review.title: “stressfull place to work”
review.pros: Pros – - good benefits,decent pay for certain niche jobs,friendly coworkers,flexible hours,fast paced lively work environment,good job for meeting new people(customers and employees)
review.cons: Cons – difficult , abusive managers who seem to come and go pretty quickly.Limited hours.Some customers pretty demanding.Hostile environment for full timers
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More positive feedback to hourly grunts.treat long time employees with more respectcreate opportunities for incentive pay for hourly employees

review.title: “it was ok i guess”
review.pros: Pros – I liked most of the people who worked there. It was fun being able to see all the new toys and dealing with most customers. I liked the relaxed work environment, meaning the job was easy as pie.
review.cons: Cons – The discount sucks (10%??), management seemed to play favorites, they like to call you in instead of scheduling you, rude customers think you're the CEO, some of my co-workers were annoying, you have to solicit every customer for a rewards card, batteries, and the credit card which gets reallllly old.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It's a toy store - take away some of the pressure and maybe more parents would shop there instead of going to WalMart where they don't ask a barrage of questions when you check out.

review.title: “Being a Toys R Us Kid isn't what it's cracked up to be.”
review.pros: Pros – The employees are great, and I get along with all of them pretty well, we're close-knit, almost like a family. Half of the Management team are competent and great to work with. When it's not in Season (Christmas), the job is ridiculously easy and practically stress free.
review.cons: Cons – The Upper Management are, by and large, incompetent and demeaning towards a lot of the employees, and favorites are definitely played. Certain members of management will act very different when the store director isn't there. Pay is simply lousy, and raises are given annually, but amount to pennies and are laughable at best. The HUGE 10% discount is silly, and has so many restrictions that it might as well not exist. And everything is based on Metrics. (Batteries, BPP's, IC's...etc ad nauseum.)
