If you can't sell people extended warranties or batteries or high interest credit cards, you're abused verbally and harassed to no end. Be prepared to harass customers to the point of feeling awful about yourself. Meanwhile, while you're pretty much running the store, the management is nowhere to be found, hiding in the office, or taking hour long lunch breaks after being there for 2 hours at most. It's baffling how certain members have been with the company for so long. Certain supervisors have no issue with screaming at you in front of customers, which does nothing for morale, which is a four letter word in the house of Geoffrey. Christmas is absolutely brutal, and surrounded by great dread. The company has since become so disgustingly money-hungry that it has silly hours during the holiday months, seeing nothing wrong with depriving employees of seeing their families. Customers demand the world, and verbally abuse when it's not given to them. Open Thanksgiving? Check. 8PM closing on Christmas Eve? Check. Seasonal employees are given little or no screening, and therefore not qualified to work in a toy store, let alone function as human beings, which makes running the store quite the task. Summer hours are few and far between, maxing out at about 12 hours if you're part time, which you will be, as they NEVER hire for full time. Not recommended. At all.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take a look at what you're expecting of your employees. Realize the scale of it all, and show a little respect towards them. When all is said and done, they run the store, not you. And if you'd come out of your little office, you'd realize that.

review.title: “Toys "R" Us”
review.pros: Pros – Employee discount was nice but so many items were excluded from the program. iPods, computers, video games are examples of items excluded.
review.cons: Cons – When TRU merged with Babies "R" Us many district managers were let go via phone calls. Also, they decided to with hold manager bonuses after the manager evaluation material was submitted.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop fishing on Monster by posting blanket openings for positions. Post for positions that are actually open at the true location.

review.title: “Toys R Us, kids only.”
review.pros: Pros – Working in a toy store is alot of fun.The EMPLOYEES working there have always been a great team.The salary is more or less the average, about 1 dollar higher than minimum wage.Yearly raise for 90% of the people.Decent schedule, they work around your school or other job.
review.cons: Cons – You are treated as a number, nothing else.Managers / Direction mostly comment on the bad things, not the good ones.You have to do things that would be a bad idea, because the head office (which never worked in a store) wants it that way.Managers/Direction can be very immature, and they are not afraid to yell to employees in front of clients.They think they can threaten teenagers because it's their first job and they don't want to lose it.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I've seen mangers/direction taking gifts that were meant for employees.I've seen immature yelling and put downs of employees in front of clients.Respect company reps, they are there to help the store. When they give rewards to employees, don't take it away.Respect the employees, stop being big babies.

review.title: “Toys R Us is a decent place to work if you like retail.”
review.pros: Pros – It is a fun atmosphere. I feel I have a lot of atonomy in my job. I am able to make key decisions.
review.cons: Cons – Limited room for growth if you do not want to be an ASM or SM. Hard to move to the corporate level. Pay is not great. Managers stay in office, and are never on the sales floor. Poor employee recognition. Not enough time to train and coach new employees
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get out of the office, and help out with guest relations. Make an effort to value and encourage your employees. Give more recognition.

review.title: “Babies r us”
review.pros: Pros – Layed back atmosphere, except when there are product recalls. But overall a decent minimum wage job with friendly employees and customers
review.cons: Cons – Not the most lieniant when it comes to time off, so plan ahead and go over it with all supervisors and managers.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up morning meetings but diversify product line they are all from same few companys and then gets hectic in recalls.

review.title: “At your own risk.”
review.pros: Pros – Trained in one store and worked at another. Training store was fabulous, reflective of the store manager. Customers were best part of job.
review.cons: Cons – The store manager was completely ineffective. Other assistants did what they wanted with no communication to others; very little cooperation between assistants. Employees ruled the store due to H.R. manager's obsession with "be nice". This store took it to the extreme. I actually had an employee yell at me on the sales floor and nothing happened to her after I reported it. Other assistants that I trained with said that they experienced the same behaviour from employees in their stores. Favorites got away with everything and managers didn't know how to discipline employees; other good employees left because they were overlooked.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – After having off-location meetings, actually follow-up with management to see where they are in implementing new programs. I was always excited to go to these meetings and hear about new programs but at store level, no response from management or other managers. Very dispiriting. While employee relations are extremely important, please investigate thoroughly complaints made by employees. Establish a manager hotline to report serious infractions that take issues out of store manager's hands; should be mandatory to contact both hotline and store manager immediately.

review.title: “Fun enjoyable low stress job for full time college students”
review.pros: Pros – - Very fun environment-Learn about the newest trends-Help customers find the right toy that meets their needs-Meeting customers from around the world that shop at Toys R US-Seeing the smiling faces of little kids getting a toy
review.cons: Cons – -Forced to sell. Management is very focused on meeting metrics numbers- Customers can be inpatient- Children crying and screaming
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Cashiers should not have to sell every metric. They should sell based on their comparative advantage. That way stores would better meet their metrics goal.

review.title: “All work and no play”
review.pros: Pros – Great Customers, its all about kids and them having fun. Company outlook is looking very good compared to other retailers.
review.cons: Cons – No work life balance, expect to work plenty of hours to get your job done. Tenured management being driven out of there jobs and hiring from outside at higher salaries.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Value the people you have rather than driving them off. There is plenty of talent within, but you have coach them not order them.

review.title: “Pretty Cool Job”
review.pros: Pros – Very Easy going, Great Hours, Worked there part time and full time. Management was professional. Good for a short part time job.
review.cons: Cons – Some of the management did not know what they were doing and were inexperienced. Also too many young people employed.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire more serious people who are not looking to fool around but are willing to work hard and make it a better place.

review.title: “Overall decent place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Great way to meet new people and make friends, manager is the best, very kind and considerate,always willing to accommodate his employees.
review.cons: Cons – Some supervisors are rude,will overwork you and act different when manager is not there.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire better management team

review.title: “wow, this is crazy”
review.pros: Pros – leave all of the problems when you step out of the door for the night. You will always be busy so the time seems to go by faster than usual.
review.cons: Cons – ridiculous rules. It is hard to be motivated when the managment sits in the office all day and barks out commands without ever getting their hands dirty...
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – try to use a little more common sense to make the work load go a little smoother. The SOP is not always the answer and it could be putting your job on the line when all corporate cares about is the numbers

review.title: “room for improvement”
review.pros: Pros – employees receive a ten percent discount at the stores for merchandise, this excludes gaming hardware and other electronics, but the discount applies to actual games.
review.cons: Cons – there are far too many to list but some of the biggest issues have to do with the management team, not the store management team but the district and regional managers
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – training of all associates and communication need to be improved upon, the rate of pay and hours are always an issue,

review.title: “I wouldn't waste my time if I were you . . .”
review.pros: Pros – I think about the only thing left would be the earned time off that you can (supposedely) use whenever you want. (Of course you have to convince management that it is in THEIR interest to do so.) And, at least in my case, I am blessed with dear friends, most of the full time staff are really wonderful at my location.
review.cons: Cons – Where to begin? First off, we're lucky to get our schedule for the next week posted on Friday, which makes it close to impossible to have a life of any kind. If you have something come up that messes with their precious schedule once posted, you'd think the world was coming to an end to change it, even though posting it two weeks in advance would eliminate about 95% of their scheduling problems. They have a computer program do their schedule, and they can only do so many edits because if they do too many, oh my god, their "effectiveness" rating might go down and they might get a phone call telling them what a bad boy they are. They make the full time staff work most all the crap schedules, while the part time people (these people "supposedly" hired to work weekends and nights) request all of them off. Every holiday is me and most of the full time people working . . .Management takes the holidays off and manage to get their weekend off a month, while the two key holders in our building have to work every weekend, get no help scheduled with them when they are scheduled to close during the week, and do all the management stuff, and cover a department on the floor, and are expected to have it all completed.It's like pulling teeth trying to get a little bit of recognition for the hard work you do. A simply "thank you" or a pat on the back is pretty much nonexistent here. It doesn't pay to go out of your way here, so the majority of us don't anymore. Why bother?Our raises were cut to the bone this year, most of us getting less than half of what we might have otherwise, because of the recession, but the company managed to find the millions of dollars to buy 4 different internet companies in lieu of all of that.They are now integrating Babies R Us and Toys R Us, and it is a micro-management hell now with a bunch of useless clipboards and even more useless "routines" that will pretty much run BRU into the ground before too long. It's pretty obvious that the company doesn't care about it's employees anymore, all they are worried about is the bottom line.Their medical insurance is the biggest joke of all. It's expensive as can be, doesn't cover CRAP, and their prescription drug coverage is the most horrible I've ever heard of.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Wake up to the fact that you are running this company into the ground quick. So much has changed in the last six months, and most of it for the worse, that it's not going to be too long before you're going to see you've screwed yourself and ruined your brand. You've got stores full of robots now, shuffling a bunch of useless papers around, passing around clipboards with a bunch of information on them that nobody cares about, and aren't going to, ever! It's meaningless drivel that does nothing to push forward your precious guest service, or drive sales. It's micro-management run amok and in the end you're going to have a serious mess on your hands.

review.title: “Bitter Sweet”
review.pros: Pros – It is a fun place to work. I get to meet so many people and get to put smiles on their faces every day! Training associates to do their jobs well is very rewarding.
review.cons: Cons – It is retail. As much as I love helping customers, they can be very rude and demand more than they deserve. It comes with the territory. Also, long hours during Christmas.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More "town meetings" and down to Earth conversations in the field.

review.title: “Good place for temporary part-time job”
review.pros: Pros – It is a good place to work as a part-time job. Stocking shelves and cashier is what I do for the most part and it is enough for me as a high school student. Management is okay, I only know my store manager and other employees in my store but I only work part-time and I'm not really involved in other things with the company as a whole. Again, good place to work and gain responsibility. It is pretty easy going and flexible with hours, the training is good and I get plenty of work and responsibility in my job.
review.cons: Cons – I don't really like the old stores, mine hasn't been updated like some of the others, so it is in a not so good area with bad lighting in the parking lot and it doesn't have the best reputation. It isnt exactly the coolest place to work but again for part-time it is okay. My manager isn't qualified and shouldn't be running the store but I listen to him anyway. A lot of other students that work here aren't motivated and they slack off and still get paid for gossiping with friends over the counter. Pay isn't too great either.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Again, I don't really know too much about senior management because I only work in the one store, but i would say to keep updating stores because no one in the communities like the old ones they are in bad areas and aren't always safe. I think stupid employees who don't take the job seriously should be fired and those of us who do a good job should be paid more or given little bonuses. Also the employee discount is low, I could get 10% off on a coupon if I wanted to, so that would help also along with more hour flexibility.

review.title: “If you like monotony, here's the place for you.”
review.pros: Pros – Well, I guess if you still like playing with toys then it could be a great place to work. Other than that, it'sjust a paycheck. Though fellow employees do make it a fun place to work.
review.cons: Cons – It can quite boring. Unless you're given a project by a supervisor you're pretty much stuck just putting away all the reshops (whole carts of toys just waiting to be put back when customers don't want them). Either that or just wandering the aisles straightening and picking up toys off the floor left by some dumbasses who abuse the price checker like it's some kind of new and amazing technology they've never seen before and leave a pile of toys waist-high on the floor. Then, after you've spent 10-12 minutes clearing out the area, putting everything back and straightening the aisle customers managed to completely rearrange by sticking all manner of things in every nook and cranny, you go back 5 minutes later to see it was all for nothing as a whole new group of 'em are lining up by the same price checker and leaving whatever they don't want right there on the floor. They'll even look at you as they're doing it too, almost like they're trying to challenge you to say something so they can go off on you. Idiots...What's worse is when you have a psycho supervisor (who feels the only way to get people to do something is by yelling at them) coming up from behind wondering why you're not doing your job and picking up the crap that's on the floor, not knowing I had just spent 12 minutes of my life doing exactly that. After you're done explaining yourself, and having them still thinking you were slacking off, you take your lunch and come back and do it all over again until the end of your shift. Yay!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Umm...stop sitting in your office all day and actually come out once in-a-while to give direction to your employees. Sure there's not always a lot for us to do some days, but have us really do things that are useful.

review.title: “boring”
review.pros: Pros – As a part time job while at university or school this job is fine. BEcause the stores have a large number of employees they have the capacity to replace shifts if you need to take time off for exams etc. Another benefit for workers who are relativly inexperienced, is the absence of food, its is rare to find a workplace for younger people thays isnt fast food, everything is clean ,and you dont finish shifts smelling of burgers.
review.cons: Cons – Ones role in the store is unknown. Many shifts i have been instructed to ¨walk around and make sure everytthing is OK¨ for five hours. No real training into how the store works or details on the stock are given. training consists of a video on OH&S and store policies. consequently, any question from a custoemr that goes beyond ¨where is ...¨ needs to be transfered to a manager.Very rude, bitter and bad tempered customers, or people who expect vauge decriptions of ¨a toy¨ to be in store.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – imporve training of sales staff, make sure they are capable to address common problems, and give more responcibility.

review.title: “You get what you put into it.”
review.pros: Pros – It's just fun. I really enjoy going to work every day. Some of the jobs are mundane, but if you have the right attitude every day can be great.
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes having your hours cut can be a pain, but you have to be patient. Sometimes the pressures of management can be tough. Unfortunately we can't make guests buy this or apply for that with mind control.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't hire in seasonal workers at a higher pay rate than someone who has been there for a year. I realize they are just temporary, but that's really a kick in the gut to have to train people who make more than you do when you have been there for a year.

review.title: “Be careful! A lot promised, little delivered”
review.pros: Pros – Static sales- not the peaks and valleys of normal retailers who run ads. The company has tried to make significant changes in the layout of their stores, but this has done little to increase sales. Margins were high, but this is being eroded away as Babies tries to compete with the Targets and others of this speciality category. Products offered are kept up to date, but warehouse can not supply stores in a consistent manner. Training and onboarding of new employees is not well thought out- they try, but it is confusing and not well executed. Typically a 45-50 hour week.
review.cons: Cons – Micro-managed/very little room for thought or creativity. Very high turnover with associates throughout chain. No advancement possible for assistant managers as there are few locations so morale is low and turnover high for assistants. Panic has set in at corporate as their competitors gradually take market share so there is a lot of initiatives that are not well planned out and too many coming down the pipeline at once. There is an unhealthy focus on keeping everyone in the stores happy which makes it extremely difficult to manage for fear of "upsetting" an associate, manager, supervisor, etc. R us organization is just getting by
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Too much change too fast. Someone needs to oversee change as it is being sensed as panic rather than well thought out decisions. Too many initiatives at once. You need to choose what is important and what will drive the business and concentrate on that. Technology is horrible, especially in terms of supplying stores. New systems and an up-to-date tech staff is needed. How the stores can go bare because there are gliches in programs in this economy is simply unacceptable. The folks that started Babies 10 years ago were good- time for new ideas and thoughts now from the corporate level right down to the district manager level.

review.title: “Toys "R" Us SHOULD be an amazing place to work!”
review.pros: Pros – Toys is a great category to be in. You are dealing with new, fun products everyday. You are dealing babies, kids, families and dreams. It is a place where you can get great satisfaction from making someone happy and seeing the smile on their face. The atmosphere in the store can make you feel young and energized everyday.
review.cons: Cons – constant stress and pressure, unreasonable demands, not enough payroll, too much red tape when trying to get anything accomplished, senior management do not seem to care what is really happening in the field, way too much politics involved in how senior and district management run the business and manage people.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Senior management needs to be more consistent. TRU is struggling with a constant identity crisis. Need to listen to what is going on in the stores and do more to help and support store management instead of only giving out criticism.
